story:
Loudermilk - Man With Gun Kills Three & The Red Record on vinyl. Finally.

Loudermilk started 1995. And from the moment they began, their dedication to making their music the best it could possibly be was clear to see (and hear, of course). I remember seeing the band in their earliest of days and being floored by just how impressive they were then. And they only continued to grow and learn and build and create and define this epic sound of theirs.

They accomplished something that is extremely rare for any band, they gained national, if not global, attention, signed to major labels, appeared on TV shows, and of course released two astoundingly excellent albums.


It's taken us a long time to get us to this point. And honestly, there were times I really didn't know if we were going to be able to make it happen... to get us to where we are now... being able to launch a pre-order campaign to celebrate their albums on vinyl.

 

We've created new masters (which was a process in itself), really striking artwork, and dealt with the licensing aspects of getting these albums ready for you. It's definitely been a journey making this happen but, so proud to be able to share this campaign with you.

 

We've come up with some really amazing (and extremely limited, in some cases) reward perks (like handwritten lyrics, test pressings, bonus tracks, and more!!) for you to choose from that we think you'll love and of course appreciate any and all help in making sure we can get the word out to help make this whole thing as successful as possible. 

 

Thank you so much for reading this far and helping to spread the word.

-Latent Print Records & Loudermilk

story:
Who are Jesse's Divide?

Jesse’s Divide (JD) are a team of hard-working, hyphen-using, semi-professional musicians and friends of over 15 years. Performing with the intention of getting you pumped-up and feeling good :

When life beats you to your knees, let JD help you back up.

JD have performed and remain partnered with some of the biggest names in the UK’s underground rock movement, and are advocates of hard work paying dividends; the band stands aside from others with a live show combining a professional respect of their art with spillages of colourful humour. If you want a good time, and aren’t afraid to raise those glasses and shake your asses; then Jesse’s Divide are at your service.

Si (Vocals and Guitars) – Nick (Bass Guitar and Vocals) – Rob (Drums and Engineering) are JESSE’S DIVIDE. Writing songs about life, love and giant robots since 2012.

A full-length album, y'say?

That's right! The band currently has 4 EPs available to listen to (on Spotify, Google Music, Apple Music, anywhere really), each one a progression of their sound- from the angry proggy days of 2015's "Metadome" to the leaner hard-rock stylings of 2019's "Spacewolf". All these recordings have been self-funded, using money from the band's own pockets as well as any money made from gigs. JD are now looking to record and release a full-on 11 track album, with a supporting tour to promote it and play our music live to all you lovely folks.

What We Need

We're looking to raise £1500. This will cover the following:

£1000- recording session at Lower Lane Studios. 

£250- pressing of physical CDs

£250- Merchandise costs

What You Get

We've got a range of perks, from digital or physical copies of the album, through t-shirts and even exclusive live performances!

Risks and Challenges

We've already begun the writing process for this album. 3 of the songs have already made their live show debut and are recorded, 3 more have been completed and the others are currently being worked on- they're in various states of completion, from "we just need a few more lyrics" to "hey isn't this a cool riff?". This is why we've set the recording date for February 2021; we don't want to rush them and end up with a set of songs we look back on six months later and wish we'd done something differently. When we hit the amount we're looking for here, that will be enough, combined with our gig earnings, to tip us over from WANTING to release the album to being able to afford it and get the lovely merch that we've listed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Know anyone who likes rock music? Tell them to check us out either on Facebook , @ us on twitter @jessesdivide or listen to the songs already out there on Spotify and the like.

story:
Introducing Geek Wave: Something Different

Apple has completely abandoned iPod, the original portable music player. Their vision is to integrate music playback into the iPhone. That's great for everyday music listeners, but what about those of us who don't want our music interrupted when a phone call, email, or text comes in? What about those of us who want the highest quality sound? We know when you start mashing up devices, compromises have to be made. What about those of us who love what high-resolution digital audio sounds like? We know iPhone just can't cut it.

We're trying to save the portable music player, and we're not alone. Along with friends like Sony, Pono, and Astell & Kern, we're dedicated to making a small, portable device that's created for one task: to uncompromisingly playback high resolution music.

 

 

 

 

Geek Wave is the evolution of the portable player. It provides uncompromised sound quality, while also loading you up with the portability, functionality, tech specs, and features LH Labs is known for. It plays PCM formats natively at up to 384 kHz sample rates in pure 32 bit depth. Beyond PCM, it plays DSD formats at up to 128 times the sample rate of a standard CD. Geek Wave doesn't mess around.

Whether you're just looking to replace that old iPod you've been carrying since the early 2000's or you're a hardcorde, dyed-in-the-wool audio aficionado, Geek Wave mixes work with play, and is ready to party. Beer, cheeseburgers, and giddiness sold separately.

The Highest Resolution Audio Available

Being the first company to bring the world a 32 bit/384 kHz plus DSD 128 component has it's advantages. Like it's predecessor, Da Vinci Dual DAC, Geek Wave is the only 32 bit / 384 kHz PCM capable, native DSD player in the world. What does that mean to you? It means you can feed it anything. From MP3's all the way up to DSD128 files.

Geek Wave Architecture

 

Future proof Digital processing stage

After 4 months the campaign ended, we decided to upgrade the center piece of our digital audio to the new architecture that allow "System On Module" to work directly with the whole player. SOM looks like the example here.

 

 

What is the benefit?  That mean if we want, we could even upgrade your CPU inside Geek Wave without desoldering anything.Just pop one system "card" out, and plug the new one. Using the SOM architecture will increase our overall cost and integration design time, but definitely will provide the much better FUTURE PROOF capability.

Sweet and rock solid Analog stage

From the analysis and data from all other respectful competitors. Geek Wave is still one on the TOP. There are  few players could offer both Single-ended and Balanced output. But Geek Wave is the leading one at such a high output wattage. Also, by sharing the same the successful analog design of Geek Out V2/V2+ and Geek Pulse DAC, we prove this analog design could handle both power demanding headphones and noise sensitive IEMs very well.

 

 

 

 

 

Flexible Configurations

As one of the senior digital audio player owners, you know what you want. We designed a flexible configuration that could fulfill different hopes and dreams.

So there are hundreds of possibilities for Geek Wave's configuration. With five different set of modules or components.

Module 1: Mother Board

Module 2: Flash memory module

 

Module 3: Battery module

 

Module 4: Chassis with different back material (main frame is T6061 Aluminum)

 

Module 5: Dock Station

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Geek Wave Chassis Design

Geek Wave has the future proof SOM digital structure, with optional dual mono DAC engine and Femto clocks. It's definitely one of the kind. It took us a lot of reversions to find a sleep and nice chassis to fit its internal guts. 
All the physical buttons will be on the side. And most of the units will be thicker than current samples due to battery. We add some nice touch on chamfer and with a "Wave" concept on software user interface. 
 

Geek Wave Highlighted Features

 

Pure Class A Amplification

Geek Wave has the most powerful pure Class A amplifier than any of its competitors. With different models to choose from, you can use Geek Wave with any headphone that's out there— from sensitive IEM's all the way up to large, esoteric cans.

Touch Control + Physical Buttons

Geek Wave's intuitive design allows you to control it in multiple ways. First, you can touch its screen to easily move from song to song, through playlists. Second, you will still have nice design physical buttons to give you the best user experience from both worlds. 

 

 

Drag & Drop Music Management with Expandable Storage

Easily manage your music files by dragging them from your computer's hard drive onto, and is expandable via an SDXC port, which supports up to 2 additional terabytes.

A Large, Serviceable Battery

One the biggest complaints against many portable music players is that they don't have a replaceable battery. When the battery dies, the whole device dies with it, forcing users to pay for repair.

Geek Wave's battery is user-accessible. After the expected two year lifespan of the rechargeable lithium ion battery, you can easily swap in a new one.

Instant Power Technology

Geek Wave analog output stage holds power in reserve for sonic events that have more "boom." It doubles the power of the amplifier when it's needed.

 

 

Our Powerful Duet Engine

Our company has been developing the most cutting-edge ways to enhance audio from MP3's, CD's, and other low-resolution streams since 2010. In our $31,000 Da Vinci Dual DAC, we have a sophisticated technology called Duet Engine, which is a timing technology that effectively doubles the quality of a music file without artificial "up-sampling" by merging two wave patterns of sound. No gaps, no air, just pure audio. Duet Engine dramatically improves audio quality, making the experience more lifelike.

 

 

 

A Three-layer Elastic Buffer

In digital signal conversion, timing is everything! To ensure computer speed fluctuations won't influence Geek Wave, we're adding the same proprietary (and patent-pending) three-layer buffer we developed for Da Vinci DAC to Geek Wave.

Features vs other competitors

We got really quite some requests from Geek Force hope we could put Geek Wave against the state-of-the-art digital audio players currently on the market. I agree with you, during past few months, we see few respectable competitors have launched good products there.  All we want is to have a clean chart for our backers to know where we are.

 

 

Join Our Geek Force

We've had such good fortune with Crowdfunding that we decided to open up parts of our product development process to YOU.

Geek Force is a forum that allows members to put in their "2 cents" and have a voice as we develop Geek Wave. We're a small company and our Geek Force is an amazing resource for us. It's a pretty cool group. Becoming a member of our Geek Force is free and easy to do. Just visit lhlabs.com.

 

About LH Labs

LH Labs is an amalgamation of audio geeks and engineers who have partnered together with one sole purpose in mind: bringing the sound of high-end audio to the masses.

Based in Northern California, the epicenter of the high-end audio industry, LH Labs was founded on the principle that music lovers deserve something better than just the "usual." We've made it our mission to create the best products possible for both audiophiles and music enthusiasts.

We've earned all kinds of awards, including a CES Innovations Honoree Award, A Publisher's Choice Award from TONEAudio, a Greatest Bits Award from Audio Stream, a Writer's Choice Award from Positive Feedback Online, and a Blue Moon Award from sixmoons.com. We've been featured in Forbes Magazine, Entrepreneur Magazine, The Wall Street Journal, The Los Angeles Times, The Street, Stereophile Magazine, The Absolute Sound, The Business Journals, and The Daily Swarm, among many other publications.

In the years that we've been creating audio products, we've had some pretty nice things said about our gear.

Sonic Satori - Michael Mercer
"Man, that thing was so airy, tight, and downright exciting to listen to. I don't think I've heard a USB dongle-type head-amp/DAC with the overall authority and SLAM of the Light Harmonic GEEK yet. That's why all I can say is WoW!!"
 
Inner Fidelity - Tyll Hertsens
"Boy, this little gadget's got some balls!"
 
Part-Time Audiophile - Scot Hull
"Me? I have two of 'em [Geek Out] on the way. Can't wait... I'm a dork. I ordered an extra."
 
Stereophile - John Atkinson
"Da Vinci produced a sound that thrilled."
 
The Absolute Sound - Steven Stone
"The visually striking Light Harmonic Da Vinci Dual DAC was a CES Innovations Award honoree, but its real beauty is inside."
 
CNET - Philip Wong
"Purists should find the Light Harmonic's DAC's ultra-low noise power supply a welcomed feature..."
 
CEPro - Robert Archer
"With the music industry evolving from a medium of physical discs into a world of digital downloads and cloud computing products like the newly introduced Da Vinci digital-to-analog converter (DAC) take on a greater importance.

"Light Harmonic's latest DAC is engineered to provide audio enthusiasts with a state-of-the-art digital audio solution that incorporates a contemporary industrial design that matches its performance."
 

Current Design Progress

The whole development progress is a long journey. Thanks for the support from our backers. We are able to focus on the technology improvement and make the best portable music player on the market. 

 

There are seven more key items need to be finished as we saw in the chart. And we are working with our WiFi module provider to make sure what is the problem. Software part is very time consuming but our plan is to ship something has core function smooth and add the new features via software upgrades. 
Another worth mention here is we add USB "OTG" functions there. It will be very helpful in near future. ;-)
 

Frequently Asked Questions

 
What amount of continuous play time is anticipated on the various models?

Playback time will vary depending on what type of music file you play. But as a general rule, we project at least 10 hours of playback time for each model. Our Engineering prototype has run 10 hours continuously with max volume without any problem.

 

What is the TRRS connector specification you follow?

Here is our specification in 3.5mm connector.

story:
Welcome family, friends, and music lovers!

My name is Liam Kyle Cahill and I'm a nationally touring Folk-Rock solo act who tours so much I might as well be based out of my Subaru Outback.

In 2015 I played 188 shows in 17 states while traveling over 47,000 miles and I am on track to do the same in 2016. During this time on the road, I have written a new collection of songs that are my most diverse and mature songs to date...but I need YOUR HELP to get these new songs recorded!

Please consider pre-ordering and/or sponsoring me on my journey. In return I will share with you my brand new 4-song EP Four Leaf Clover for immediate download (otherwise available June 2016) IN ADDITION to you receiving my brand new 10-12 song full-length album Love & Loss once it is completed in the summer 2017.

Why do you need money? Isn't music free?!

This may sound crazy, but there is no such thing as a free lunch or free music. Every amazing album you have ever listened to costs thousands of dollars from the time of inception to the time it reaches your ears.

Three years ago you helped me raise $10,000 to record The Key To Happiness, and I couldn't have done it without you. At that time I was still working full time as an exploration geologist, and have since quit my job and given up everything to pursue my personal legend and achieve my dreams of "making it" as a professional musician. But now more than ever, I need the support of every person who also believes that I can do this.

Here is a quick breakdown of what the base goal of $10,000 will be going towards:

  • Paying my producer/engineer and studio musicians
  • Paying for the time spent in the recording studio
  • Paying for the album to be professionally mixed and mastered (i.e. making sure it sounds as good as the songs you hear on the radio)
  • Paying for the album cover art and design
  • Paying for the physical CDs and vinyl to be printed and packaged
  • Paying for the album to be distributed digitally all over the world

What if you raise more than your goal? Does the rest just go to beer?

Not even close. The base goal of $10,000 is the minimum amount necessary to produce a high quality, full-length album. To put it in perspective, I spent more than double that to record The Key To Happiness...but after nearly two years of non-stop touring on a musicians budget I know what it takes to make a dollar go as far as possible.

Every penny that comes into this campaign will be mindfully spent on the making and/or the promotion of Love & Loss. Any money above and beyond the base goal will help cover additional things like music videos, new merch, submitting the album for national and international reviews, and of course more touring. 

Music is not just a hobby for me...music is my job, my business, my passion, and my life. I am a hard-working entrepreneur and I will do whatever it takes to succeed at the highest level because I won't settle for less.

Strapped for cash? You can still help!

Just the fact that you are still here and have read this far goes to show that you are supportive of me and this project! Even if you can't give (or give much) financially, you can still help out in a HUGE way: Spread the word! There is no substitute for good old "word of mouth" so please take a moment to share this campaign page or the "Four Leaf Clover" official music video. In fact, just follow all the steps below:

  1. Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out or use the link: https://igg.me/at/fourleafclover
  2. Share my video here
  3. Join my email list here
  4. Like my Facebook page here
  5. Follow me on Instagram here
  6. Subscribe to my YouTube channel here
  7. Hug the person next to you. Official hug guide here

Thank you so much from the bottom of my beard and I'll see you out on the road again soon!!! See all my tour details at LiamKyleCahill.com
story_txt:
Welcome family, friends, and music lovers!

My name is Liam Kyle Cahill and I'm a nationally touring Folk-Rock solo act who tours so much I might as well be based out of my Subaru Outback. 
In 2015 I played 188 shows in 17 states while traveling over 47,000 miles and I am on track to do the same in 2016. During this time on the road, I have written a new collection of songs that are my most diverse and mature songs to date...but I need YOUR HELP to get these new songs recorded! 
Please consider pre-ordering and/or sponsoring me on my journey. In return I will share with you my brand new 4-song EP Four Leaf Clover for immediate download (otherwise available June 2016) IN ADDITION to you receiving my brand new 10-12 song full-length album Love & Loss once it is completed in the summer 2017.
  Why do you need money? Isn't music free?!
 This may sound crazy, but there is no such thing as a free lunch or free music. Every amazing album you have ever listened to costs thousands of dollars from the time of inception to the time it reaches your ears. 
Three years ago you helped me raise $10,000 to record The Key To Happiness, and I couldn't have done it without you. At that time I was still working full time as an exploration geologist, and have since quit my job and given up everything to pursue my personal legend and achieve my dreams of "making it" as a professional musician. But now more than ever, I need the support of every person who also believes that I can do this.
Here is a quick breakdown of what the base goal of $10,000 will be going towards:

Paying my producer/engineer and studio musicians
Paying for the time spent in the recording studio

Paying for the album to be professionally mixed and mastered 
(i.e. making sure it sounds as good as the songs you hear on the radio)
Paying for the album cover art and design
Paying for the physical CDs and vinyl to be printed and packaged
Paying for the album to be distributed digitally all over the world



What if you raise more than your goal? Does the rest just go to beer?

Not even close. The base goal of $10,000 is the minimum amount necessary to produce a high quality, full-length album. To put it in perspective, I spent more than double that to record The Key To Happiness...but after nearly two years of non-stop touring on a musicians budget I know what it takes to make a dollar go as far as possible. 
Every penny that comes into this campaign will be mindfully spent on the making and/or the promotion of Love & Loss. Any money above and beyond the base goal will help cover additional things like music videos, new merch, submitting the album for national and international reviews, and of course more touring.  
Music is not just a hobby for me...music is my job, my business, my 
passion, and my life. I am a hard-working entrepreneur and I will do whatever it 
takes to succeed at the highest level because I won't settle for less. 
Strapped for cash? You can still help!


Just the fact that you are still here and have read this far goes to show that you are supportive of me and this project! Even if you can't give (or give much) financially, you can still help out
 in a HUGE way: Spread the word! There is no substitute for good old "word of mouth" so please take a moment to share this campaign page or the "Four Leaf Clover" official music video. In fact, just follow all the steps below:


Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out or use the link: 
https://igg.me/at/fourleafclover

Share my video here

Join my email list here

Like my Facebook page here

Follow me on Instagram here

Subscribe to my YouTube channel here

Hug the person next to you. Official hug guide here


Thank you so much from the bottom of my beard and I'll see you out on the road again soon!!! See all my tour details at LiamKyleCahill.com

story:
（概要の日本語訳はページ後半からチェックして下さい！）

支援プランと特典一覧の日本語訳はこちらから。

Hey everybody, and thanks for stopping by! We are the J-MUSIC Ensemble, a band dedicated to bringing new perspectives to Japanese music. As jazz musicians, we play jazz versions of J-Pop, anime, and video game songs, in an effort to get an even deeper understanding of the culture that inspired us so much and give back to it at the same time. Our most recent venture sees us exploring the music of one of the most important games in recent history: the revolutionary role-playing game, Persona 5. We fell in love with this music as well as other fans of the series did, and when it came time to thinking about what our second full studio album would be, choosing to play the music of Persona 5 was a no-brainer.

Because getting into a professional studio in New York City was out of our budget, we resorted to renting out a rehearsal space instead. This way, we could at least make videos and some amateur recordings to show our fans what we're working on. However, these "Persona 5 Jam Sessions", as we called them, grew to be some of our most popular videos on our YouTube channel, and this unexpected attention let us know that we should start taking this seriously. Within a year and a half of us uploading our "Persona 5 Jam Sessions", we were getting hundreds of really inspiring and heartfelt responses letting us know how much of a difference we made in their lives. The fact that there was a worldwide audience of people willing to express themselves and connect with each other through something so niche as Persona 5 and jazz really impacted us. We always wanted our music to bring people together, and we could not have made it this far without the overwhelming support from these fans that listened to, liked, and shared our covers so much. This is when the idea for making a new album, a tribute to our J-MUSIC community, was conceived.

Of course, because we haven't had the resources to record in a professional recording studio since 2015, making this album would be our greatest challenge yet. We have big ambitions for this project, and in order to turn this idea into a reality, we're going to need your help.

 

Due to the nature of our project, our funding goal is pretty high. That's because of not only the production of CDs and digital distribution, but also mastering costs, artwork (by our amazing artist, blazpu), cover song licensing, and special new items like limited-edition vinyls, t-shirts, posters, and more! Here's just the most essential parts of what our price breakdown looks like:

  • CD production: $1,000
  • Vinyl production: $4,900
  • Mastering: $2,000
  • Cover Song licensing: $1,600

This doesn't include aforementioned costs like artwork, digital distribution, and perks we would give you all for helping us out, such as t-shirts, stickers, posters, and future items we'd love to make. Due to the overwhelming cost of making physical merchandise, we don't plan on making vinyl records or CDs available after this fundraiser. However, the more we raise here, the more of this merchandise can be made!

It is also our pleasure to finally announce the track list for the album! You can expect to see:

  • Life Will Change (feat. Mohmega)
  • Wake Up, Get Up, Get Out There (feat. Sapphire)
  • Last Surprise (feat. Karlea Lynné and Ruby Choi)
  • Tokyo Emergency
  • King, Queen, and Slave
  • What's Going On
  • Butterfly Kiss
  • A Woman
  • Price (feat. Norman Edwards)
  • Life Goes On (feat. Adam Neely)
  • The Days When My Mother Was There
  • Layer Cake
  • Beneath The Mask (feat. Ruby Choi)

 

As you all know by now, most of our hopes and wishes for the 2020 year have been either delayed or completely eradicated by the new COVID-19 epidemic. Our hearts go out to everyone and their families who have been affected by this terrible, historic tragedy. While the band has been fortunate enough to not have come into direct contact with the virus so far, we can't say the same thing for our careers.

Starting in the fall 2019 season, we set out to record this album and made plans for a mid-2020 release date, no later than May 2020. However, this goal soon became difficult to maintain, because by the time the virus had made its first major growth escalation, the world began to take serious measures to stop it from spreading. This meant, of course, shutting down all non-essential work, travel, and social gatherings for a period of time until everything could get under control. Not only that, but reopening parts of the world - especially New York City, where we live - would take time, as well. What did this mean for us as artists? This means that musicians were essentially the first to go, and we are most likely the last job to come back. Our main source of income, and connecting with others, is now all but gone. Some of us have not even been approved for unemployment. It is a very dark time for everyone.

It's very unfortunate that our occupation, being professional artists, would not be seen as "essential work", considering that we are the one group of people everyone is now turning to for entertainment, comfort, and clarity during our time of isolation. We've put the entirety of our collective energy into this album, and we want to continue to make people happy with our music. Without the help of the community, this project will become more than just delayed. Let's make this one count!

--

That's about it, for now! We appreciate every bit that you all contribute to us very much. We're not just talking about funding, either. We understand that the world's current situation is hitting everyone hard right now, so if you still would like to help, the best thing you could do is to tell your friends about what we're doing! If you're a Persona fan, jazz fan, or just an all-around lover of good music, you can help us out massively by sharing this campaign with people you know. The more people that get involved, the closer we can get to realizing this collective dream!

Thank you so much, everybody. We can't express enough how much it means to all of us that we're even able to realistically dream of something like this! It's all because of you. We'll see you on the other side!

========================================================

皆さん、こんにちは！この度は私たちのプロジェクトをチェックしてくれてありがとうございます！私たちは日本の音楽に新たな光を当てることを目的としたバンド、J-MUSIC Ensemble（アンサンブル）です。私たちに多大な影響を与えた日本の文化への理解を深めつつ、その愛する文化へ還元できる方法を模索することを目的に、本業のジャズミュージシャンとしての演奏力を活かして、J-POP、アニソン、ゲーム音楽などのジャズカバーをしています。

私たちの最新のプロジェクトでは、近年のゲーム史において最も重要なサントラを誇る革命的RPG作品『ペルソナ５』を探求しています。多くのペルソナ・シリーズのファン同様に、私たちもこのサントラに恋をしてしまいました。私たちが2ndアルバムの構想を練っている時に、ペルソナ５の楽曲を選んだのは必然だったと言えるでしょう。

私たちの現在の予算では、ニューヨーク・シティでプロのスタジオを借りることは難しいため、リハーサル・スペースなどを代用してきました。自前の機材を利用して動画を投稿することで、少なくとも、ファンに僕たちの目指しているものを見せることは出来ました。それにも関わらず、『ペルソナ５ ジャム・セッション』は私たちのYouTubeチャンネルでも最も人気を誇るシリーズとなり、この楽曲たちにより本気で取り組んでみたいと思うようになりました。

『ペルソナ５　ジャム・セッション』シリーズの投稿から１年半のうちに、私たちは心のこもったコメントを非常に沢山いただきました。このファンからの反響こそが、このシリーズが人々にどれだけ影響を与えたかを気付かせてくれたのです。『ペルソナ５とジャズ』というニッチなジャンルを通して、世界中のオーディエンスと繋がることが出来たという事実は、私たちに非常に大きな衝撃を与えてくれました。

私たちは音楽を通して、人々の心を結びつけたいと思ってきました。そして私たちがここまで来れたのも、私たちの音楽を聴いて、イイネやシェアをしてくれた人たちの多大なサポートのおかげだと思っています。そんな時に、J-MUSICのコミュニティにトリビュートを捧げる、ニュー・アルバムのアイデアが生まれたのです。

私たちは2015年以来、プロのレコーディング・スタジオに入って音源を制作する余裕がなかったため、今回のアルバム制作はこれまでで最大のチャレンジとなります。私たちは野心を持ってこのプロジェクトに取り組みんでいます。そして、このアイデアを現実のものとするためには、皆さんの力が必要なのです。

--

私たちのプロジェクトの性質上、目標金額はかなり高く設定されています。これは、CDのプレスやデジタル配信の他にも、マスタリング費用、アートワーク（絵師のblazpuが手掛けています）、カバー曲のライセンス費用、そして新商品の限定版アナログレコード、Tシャツ、ポスター等の製作に費用が掛かるからです。本プロジェクトの予算の大まかな内訳は以下のようになります：

 

CD製作費用：$1,000 （¥100,000*）

アナログレコード製作費用：$4,900（¥490,000*）

マスタリング費用：$2,000（¥200,000*）

カバー曲のライセンス費用：$1,600（¥160,000*）

 

* $1＝¥100換算で計算した場合

以上の内訳には、アートワーク、デジタル配信費用や、Tシャツ、ステッカー、ポスター等々の支援者特典は含まれていません。支援者特典は今後もさらに追加される予定です。また、フィジカルの商品には多大なコストが掛かるため、本クラウドファンディングの終了後には、CDやアナログレコードの生産予定はありません。しかし、このプロジェクトで支援が集まれば集まるほど、多くの商品を準備することが出来ます！

--

アルバムのトラック・リストもついに決定しました！

以下の楽曲が収録される予定です：

  • Life Will Change (feat. Mohmega)
  • Wake Up, Get Up, Get Out There (feat. Sapphire)
  • Last Surprise (feat. Karlea Lynné and Ruby Choi)
  • Tokyo Emergency
  • 王と王妃と奴隷
  • What's Going On
  • Butterfly Kiss
  • A Woman
  • Price (feat. Norman Edwards)
  • Life Goes On (feat. Adam Neely)
  • 母のいた日々
  • Layer Cake
  • Beneath The Mask (feat. Ruby Choi)

 

皆さんもご存知の通り、COVID-19の大流行の影響により、私たちの2020年の前途は後ろ倒しになったり、立ち消えてしまうことになりました。この歴史的な悲劇によって影響を受けた皆さんとそのご家族には、心から同情申し上げます。私たちのバンドは幸いにも、現時点ではウイルスによる影響を受けておりませんが、私たちのキャリアの方は多大なダメージを受けています。

本アルバムの制作は2019年にスタートを切り、遅くとも2020年の５月にはリリースがされる予定でした。しかしながら、前述のウイルスの第一波の影響により、世界中が本格的なウイルス蔓延の阻止に動き始めまたのです。これはつまり、非エッセンシャル・ワーク*、旅行、そしてイベントなどの開催が一旦は全てシャットダウンされてしまったということです。それだけでなく、一部の都市が完全に元に戻るまでには、時間が掛かることが予想されます。特に私たちの住むニューヨークは、完全再開までに非常に時間が掛かるでしょう。

*エッセンシャル・ワーク - 社会を支える必要不可欠な仕事のこと。例：医師や看護師、スーパーのレジ係、公共交通機関の職員など。

これは私たちのようなアーティストにとっては、どういった影響を与えるのか？ミュージシャンのような職業は真っ先に仕事を失い、復職するのが最も遅くなる職種だと言えるでしょう。私たちの主な収入源や、人々との繋がりは儚くも全て失われてしまいました。私たちの中には、失業手当を受け取れない人たちもいます。私たちは氷河期を迎えているのです。

私たちの職業である「プロ音楽家」が”エッセンシャル・ワーク”として認められないことは非常に残念なことです。この隔離の時にエンターテイメントが今まで以上に注目されていて、それを提供している裏側には私たちのような人間がいることを考えると、なおさらです。バンド全体が本アルバムに全精力を捧げており、私たちの音楽を通して皆さんに喜びを届けたいと思っています。皆さんの力が無ければ、このプロジェクトは遅延するどころか、存在自体が危うくなってしまうでしょう。どうかご支援をお願いします！

--

私たちからのメッセージは以上です！皆さんの支援には大小に関わらず、全て感謝しています。もちろん、それは金銭的な支援だけに限りません。現在世界を取り巻く状況は、等しく皆さんに影響を与えていることも重々承知しています。もしそれでも支援したいという方は、ぜひお友達に私たちのプロジェクトについて教えてあげて下さい！もしあなたがペルソナのファン、ジャズのファン、もしくはグッド・ミュージックの愛好家であれば、このプロジェクトをシェアしていただけるだけで大きな支援になります。より多くの人を巻き込めれば、この夢の現実に一歩近付けるのですから！

最後まで読んでいただき、本当にありがとうございます。そもそもこんな夢のようなプロジェクトを立ち上げられたことが、私たちにとってはとても意味のあることなのです！全ては皆さんのおかげです。ぜひこのプロジェクトを実現せましょう！

Indiegogoでの支援方法（住所入力など各種登録内容の入力方法）については、下記リンクをぜひご参考にして下さい！

【INDIEGOGO クラウドファンディングサイト 出資方法をかんたんに解説！これだけ知っていれば海外サイトも怖くない！】

https://tonchikiroku.com/gpd-game-console-gpd-w...

もし支援方法等についてご不明な点があれば、下記メールアドレスまでご連絡下さい。

litjapan1991☆gmail.com　←☆を@にしてお送り下さい

『ペルソナ５　ジャム・セッション』シリーズの投稿から１年半のうちに、私たちは心のこもったコメントを非常に沢山いただきました。このファンからの反響こそが、このシリーズが人々にどれだけ影響を与えたかを気付かせてくれたのです。『ペルソナ５とジャズ』というニッチなジャンルを通して、世界中のオーディエンスと繋がることが出来たという事実は、私たちに非常に大きな衝撃を与えてくれました。
私たちは音楽を通して、人々の心を結びつけたいと思ってきました。そして私たちがここまで来れたのも、私たちの音楽を聴いて、イイネやシェアをしてくれた人たちの多大なサポートのおかげだと思っています。そんな時に、J-MUSICのコミュニティにトリビュートを捧げる、ニュー・アルバムのアイデアが生まれたのです。
私たちは2015年以来、プロのレコーディング・スタジオに入って音源を制作する余裕がなかったため、今回のアルバム制作はこれまでで最大のチャレンジとなります。私たちは野心を持ってこのプロジェクトに取り組みんでいます。そして、このアイデアを現実のものとするためには、皆さんの力が必要なのです。
--
私たちのプロジェクトの性質上、目標金額はかなり高く設定されています。これは、CDのプレスやデジタル配信の他にも、マスタリング費用、アートワーク（絵師のblazpuが手掛けています）、カバー曲のライセンス費用、そして新商品の限定版アナログレコード、Tシャツ、ポスター等の製作に費用が掛かるからです。本プロジェクトの予算の大まかな内訳は以下のようになります： CD製作費用：$1,000 （¥100,000*）
アナログレコード製作費用：$4,900（¥490,000*）
マスタリング費用：$2,000（¥200,000*）
カバー曲のライセンス費用：$1,600（¥160,000*） * $1＝¥100換算で計算した場合
以上の内訳には、アートワーク、デジタル配信費用や、Tシャツ、ステッカー、ポスター等々の支援者特典は含まれていません。支援者特典は今後もさらに追加される予定です。また、フィジカルの商品には多大なコストが掛かるため、本クラウドファンディングの終了後には、CDやアナログレコードの生産予定はありません。しかし、このプロジェクトで支援が集まれば集まるほど、多くの商品を準備することが出来ます！
--
アルバムのトラック・リストもついに決定しました！
以下の楽曲が収録される予定です：

Life Will Change (feat. Mohmega)
Wake Up, Get Up, Get Out There (feat. Sapphire)
Last Surprise (feat. Karlea Lynné and Ruby Choi)
Tokyo Emergency
王と王妃と奴隷
What's Going On
Butterfly Kiss
A Woman
Price (feat. Norman Edwards)
Life Goes On (feat. Adam Neely)
母のいた日々
Layer Cake
Beneath The Mask (feat. Ruby Choi)

 
皆さんもご存知の通り、COVID-19の大流行の影響により、私たちの2020年の前途は後ろ倒しになったり、立ち消えてしまうことになりました。この歴史的な悲劇によって影響を受けた皆さんとそのご家族には、心から同情申し上げます。私たちのバンドは幸いにも、現時点ではウイルスによる影響を受けておりませんが、私たちのキャリアの方は多大なダメージを受けています。
本アルバムの制作は2019年にスタートを切り、遅くとも2020年の５月にはリリースがされる予定でした。しかしながら、前述のウイルスの第一波の影響により、世界中が本格的なウイルス蔓延の阻止に動き始めまたのです。これはつまり、非エッセンシャル・ワーク*、旅行、そしてイベントなどの開催が一旦は全てシャットダウンされてしまったということです。それだけでなく、一部の都市が完全に元に戻るまでには、時間が掛かることが予想されます。特に私たちの住むニューヨークは、完全再開までに非常に時間が掛かるでしょう。
*エッセンシャル・ワーク - 社会を支える必要不可欠な仕事のこと。例：医師や看護師、スーパーのレジ係、公共交通機関の職員など。
これは私たちのようなアーティストにとっては、どういった影響を与えるのか？ミュージシャンのような職業は真っ先に仕事を失い、復職するのが最も遅くなる職種だと言えるでしょう。私たちの主な収入源や、人々との繋がりは儚くも全て失われてしまいました。私たちの中には、失業手当を受け取れない人たちもいます。私たちは氷河期を迎えているのです。
私たちの職業である「プロ音楽家」が”エッセンシャル・ワーク”として認められないことは非常に残念なことです。この隔離の時にエンターテイメントが今まで以上に注目されていて、それを提供している裏側には私たちのような人間がいることを考えると、なおさらです。バンド全体が本アルバムに全精力を捧げており、私たちの音楽を通して皆さんに喜びを届けたいと思っています。皆さんの力が無ければ、このプロジェクトは遅延するどころか、存在自体が危うくなってしまうでしょう。どうかご支援をお願いします！
--
私たちからのメッセージは以上です！皆さんの支援には大小に関わらず、全て感謝しています。もちろん、それは金銭的な支援だけに限りません。現在世界を取り巻く状況は、等しく皆さんに影響を与えていることも重々承知しています。もしそれでも支援したいという方は、ぜひお友達に私たちのプロジェクトについて教えてあげて下さい！もしあなたがペルソナのファン、ジャズのファン、もしくはグッド・ミュージックの愛好家であれば、このプロジェクトをシェアしていただけるだけで大きな支援になります。より多くの人を巻き込めれば、この夢の現実に一歩近付けるのですから！
最後まで読んでいただき、本当にありがとうございます。そもそもこんな夢のようなプロジェクトを立ち上げられたことが、私たちにとってはとても意味のあることなのです！全ては皆さんのおかげです。ぜひこのプロジェクトを実現せましょう！
Indiegogoでの支援方法（住所入力など各種登録内容の入力方法）については、下記リンクをぜひご参考にして下さい！
【INDIEGOGO クラウドファンディングサイト 出資方法をかんたんに解説！これだけ知っていれば海外サイトも怖くない！】
https://tonchikiroku.com/gpd-game-console-gpd-w...
もし支援方法等についてご不明な点があれば、下記メールアドレスまでご連絡下さい。
litjapan1991☆gmail.com　←☆を@にしてお送り下さい

story:
I will be releasing a double audio CD of the complete Brandenburg Concertos of Bach for one musician playing the full family of recorders. The release date is set for Fall, 2021 to mark the 300-year anniversary of the set's completion. I am very excited to begin the biggest project of my career and am honored that you will join me. 

I fully research each piece and create my own playable arrangements from scratch using only original Urtext editions as source material. Check out the video samples on this page for an idea of what it will sound like. In addition:

  • Every part is meticulously checked for errors
  • Properly applied historical performance practices from Bach's time are used.
  • All instruments are faithfully made reproductions of what would have been played in Bach's time 
  • Each audio file is professionally mixed and mastered so that it will sound as good streamed to your mobile device as it does on your home stereo.

 

This recording is the first of its kind. Your support will enable me to arrange all 19 movements of the 6 concerti and to fully immerse myself in the recording of them all. It will also help cover the production costs of recording the CD, mixing and mastering, generating the accompanying printed materials, and promoting the finished product.

Thank you for checking out my campaign and please let me know if you have any questions.

story:
THIS PAGE IS NO LONGER INDEMAND, NO PRE-ORDERS ARE TAKEN AT THIS POINT! THE BOOK HAS BEEN FULLY FINANCED AND HAS BEEN PRINTED, ANYONE WHO HAS PLEDGED OR PRE-ORDERED HERE, THE BOOKS ARE CURRENTLY ON THE WAY TO US FROM Hong Kong, EXPECTED DUE TO COVID NOVEMBER 2021 AND THE BOOK WITH DOUBLE VINYL (NOT AVAILABLE IN STORES) BY DECEMBER 2021. THE OFFICIAL BOOK RELEASE DATE WILL BE IN 2022. THANK YOU ALL!

 

OVERVIEW 

Hi this is Nico B of Cult Epics, I discovered the Christian Death Only Theatre of Pain LP when it came out in 1982. To this day, this landmark Death Rock album stands the test of time, and is now a classic in the Goth scene. Legendary L.A. punk rock photographer Edward Colver followed Christian Death around in the early 1980s, photographing them when they played live in the Los Angeles area and also at a cemetery in Pomona, as well as at Rozz's family home. Cult Epics is to produce an oversized book (available in Soft and Hardcover editions) of Edward's many rare and never before seen photos, and go behind-the-scenes through interviews with him and the original band members to tell the story of the early Christian Death. In honor of Only Theatre of Pain’s 40th anniversary, in collaboration with Lisa Fancher of Frontier Records, we are offering an exclusive, limited edition box set which includes the hardcover book plus a newly produced, double vinyl gatefold album of OTOP that includes a bonus LP of demos and bonus tracks and a bonus poster.

DESCRIPTION

What's in the book?

This book will feature hundreds of Edward Colver’s photos of Christian Death from 1981-1982 he shot at a dozen of the band's concerts in the Los Angeles area as well a shoot at Rozz's family's home with the band (for the U.S. album's back cover of Only Theatre of Pain) and the controversial iconic images at a cemetery in Pomona. The book will include Edward's memories as well as those of the band members, and others through new and exclusive interviews. The book will also include new scans of original Christian Death concert flyers, and all of Rozz's original handwritten lyrics for OTOP and Deathwish. Presented as an oversized, coffee-table book 12.25” X 12.25” (the size of a vinyl album cover) and 1” inch thick (31x31x2.5cm), 220 pages, with over 200 images; including many rare and previously unpublished, b&w and some color, edited by Nico B.

note: the above images are for mock-up purposes only, and are not the final designs.

What's on the album?

Double Vinyl Gatefold album, with the original Gold metallic ink printing as the first edition, inside Gatefold with additional Edward Colver photos, includes lyric sheet, and other t.b.a.

LP1 Only Theatre of Pain

Side 1A: 1. Cavity - First Communion 2. Figurative Theatre 3. Burnt Offerings 4. Mysterium Iniquitatis 5. Dream for Mother Side 1B: 1. Stairs - Uncertain Journey 2. Spiritual Cramp 3. Romeo’s Distress 4. Resurrection - Sixth Communion 5. Prayer

LP2 Bonus album

Side 2A: 1. Dogs 2. Romeo's Distress 3. Deathwish 4. Desperate Hell 5. Spiritual Cramp  6. Cavity - First Communion  Side 2B: 1. Sleepwalk (1982 demo) 2. The Invocation (1982 demo) 3. Cavity - First Communion (alternate version) 4. Lord's Prayer (alternate version)

When will the book come out?

We are planning to have the book (and Frontier the vinyl double album) ready and printed by August 2021. UPDATE: Book will be shipping September 2021, Book and vinyl double album December 2021. Official Book release for it's 40th Anniversary is 2022.

FUNDS 

Funds raised will go to production, including the very high costs of printing a hardcover (+ box) and softcover book and for the license to Edward Colver, and royalties to band members and the family of Rozz Williams. Further funds will be used to pay for the costs of the double vinyl album and other Perks.

PERKS

1. CHRISTIAN DEATH: ONLY THEATRE OF PAIN Photography by Edward Colver. DIGITAL BOOK. $20.00

2. CHRISTIAN DEATH: ONLY THEATRE OF PAIN Photography by Edward Colver. SC BOOK.
Softcover Book. Limited Edition of only 500. $35.00

3. CHRISTIAN DEATH: ONLY THEATRE OF PAIN Photography by Edward Colver. HC BOOK.
Hardcover Book. First Edition. (Regular Book retail price: $70.00 + tax) $60.00 

4. CHRISTIAN DEATH: ONLY THEATRE OF PAIN Photography by Edward Colver. DELUXE BOX SET. Exclusive Hardcover Book and Double Vinyl Gatefold album + bonus Poster housed in a Deluxe Box set  + digital book. Limited Edition. (Not Available in Stores) $140.00 

5. CHRISTIAN DEATH: ONLY THEATRE OF PAIN Photography by Edward Colver. DELUXE BOX SET SIGNED. Exclusive Hardcover Book and Double Vinyl Gatefold album with Book signed by photographer Edward Colver and by band members + bonus Poster housed in a Deluxe Box set + digital book. Limited to 100. (Not Available in Stores) $250.00 

Exclusive bonus Poster size 24"x24" inches (61x61cm) (fold-out) of the HC/SC photography book cover photo (without text) comes exclusively in the Deluxe Box set.

ADD-ONS

THE ART OF ROZZ WILLIAMS: FROM CHRISTIAN DEATH TO DEATH Edited by Nico B DIGITAL BOOK Includes Christian Death, Shadow Project, Premature Ejaculation, Rozz Williams solo work (featuring Gitane Demone among others), his Art, poetry and the film Pig. Revised Edition with 8 additional pages including a new foreword by Rikk Agnew. 256 Pages with over 200 Images, Color & B&W. $19.00

SHIPPING

This project is Euro shipping friendly + to some International countries! We are drop-shipping to a European record distributor so shipping is affordable to Rozz Williams/Christian Death European fans, some other countries will be shipped directly from the printer in Asia (not including box sets). All others will be shipped from U.S., including all the signed box sets. 

Shipping costs for single SC & HC books: US $10 / European Union & UK $20 / Canada, Australia, Japan, Mexico $50 / Rest of the World $80.  

Shipping costs for Deluxe box set editions: US $10 / European Union & UK: $20 & $80 (signed edition) / Canada $50 (incl. signed edition) / Rest of the World $80 (due to large size and weight).

Combined shipping available on all Book purchases, see FAQ.

ABOUT

Who's Christian Death?

Christian Death is an American death rock band formed in Pomona, California, in 1979 by Rozz Williams. He was eventually joined by guitarist Rikk Agnew of the band Adolescents, James McGearty on bass guitar and George Belanger on drums. This line-up was responsible for producing the band's best known work, their 1982 debut album Only Theatre of Pain, which was highly influential in the development of the style of music known as deathrock, as well as on the American and European gothic scene.

Who's Edward Colver?

Edward Colver is an American photographer, best known for his early punk rock photographs.  Colver not only created a visual document of the birth of the hardcore punk in suburban Southern California from late 1978 to mid-1984, but also he greatly helped in defining the photography style and graphic identity of the American hardcore punk movement. He was actually in the right place at the right time, and with the right attitude, but he was not merely a witness in the eye of the storm, he was indeed a living part of that big picture, and in this regard, his early work is an authentic self-portrait of the Southern California hardcore punk scene in its golden years.

Who’s Nico B?

I am the founder of Cult Epics (since 1991), and was a close friend of Rozz until the day he died. I had met Rozz while living with Gitane Demone in Amsterdam after she left Christian Death. A few years later we toured with Rozz worldwide and produced the record Dream Home Heartache. When I moved to the U.S. in 1998, I directed the underground cult film PIG with him, which was his last finalized project. I also produced and published the book The Art of Rozz Williams: From Christian Death to Death (1999/2017). Since 2018 I am the representative of the Estate of Rozz Williams, for his family. New website will be live by 9.1.2021 www.rozzwilliamslegacy.com 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Please tell your friends about the new Christian Death Book we want to publish, by sharing our campaign link and photos we post on our Facebook, Twitter, Instagram on your social media pages.  

RISK & CHALLENGES

This is our 6th self-published book,  previous we had published The Art of Rozz Williams: From Christian Death to Death,  which was successfully funded thru Indiegogo in 2017, currently out of print: https://igg.me/at/artofrozzwilliams as well Cult Epics: Comprehensive Guide to Cult Cinema in 2018: https://igg.me/at/cultepicshardcoverbook 

We believe with your help, we will succeed. For more info on Cult Epics www.cultepics.com

story:
HI! We are Wynona Bleach, an alternative rock band from Belfast, Northern Ireland. We have been recording, touring and making noises together for 2 years, and previous to that a further 3 under our former name of R51.

 

Basically:

We supported Alice in Chains in 2019 on the Irish leg of their world tour, while promoting our debut EP "Sugar" in 2019 (on limited edition green vinyl). Right after a summer of UK/IRL shows we hauled a whole recording studio from Belfast to an abandoned warehouse in central Portugal in September 2019, where we built a studio out of anything we could beg & borrow to record our debut record with Bill Ryder-Jones!

 

Installing the desk into the old cantina/kitchen of the (now abandoned) pool table factory

 

The Factory was a closed down facility built to manufacture billiard tables. The band has a close friend who owns a house near it, and when joking with the idea of us going to the house and writing/recording an album, he asked his neighbour did he mind about the noise. His neighbour said "why not use my empty factory?" So we did. We love you Dave + Joanne & Jeronimo + The Batista Family.

Mike Hanvey (our live sound guy) drove everything down from Belfast (over 1700 miles each way!). We took artist and photographer Audrey Gillespie to shoot photos on 35mm film, Ethan Owens to look after guitars and backline and Matty filmed a documentary of the entire process!

We basically used the offices and outbuildings as a live room and control room, with bizarre spaces like weird sheds and chicken coops as reverb chambers, guitar speaker cab rooms and vocal booths. We used old Pool Tables as sound reflection panels and old insulation to block up windows!

To get it off the ground, we had some financial help with travel from Help Musicians and The NI Arts council, but that only made a small dent in the whole project's travel etc, which the rest we had up until now self-funded from our live shows and merch sales. Now that its almost ready to release (and that the rest of our shows for the year are cancelled due to the lockdown!) we are relying on offering up some pre-orders to help us get the world to hear!!

 

First session with Bill Ryder-Jones, sessions which spanned around 10 long, dizzying days. Another 14 with our Live sound guy Mike Hanvey, after Bill headed home to tour the UK/EUR.

 

We tracked the album across around 3 weeks. Due to sooo many factors, some final vocal sessions were delayed and were completed back home in Belfast. (with some stuff being finished at home even right up as far as lockdown in isolation from each other! more on that story TBA!) But the important thing is we made it home alive and the tracks sound WICKED. The record is currently being mixed by a couple of GREAT and amazing human beings (to be announced shortly), and its finally time to get the last push we need to complete it!

Multiple test packs occurred to make a whole studio fit in a regular van, that was illegally overweight over 1700 miles to Rural Portugal

 

We need your help with:

 - Funds to actually press the record and merch,

 - Funds to cover the PR campaign we have planned to help us get it into peoples ears,

 - Cover final remaining Mixing and Mastering costs.

 

Matty, Bill, Mike and Carl nearing completion of the record. We had found an old freezer that still worked (left of picture) which became a place to crawl into after immensely sweaty tracking sessions.

 

The Impact you will make on a pre-order or donation:

Like almost everyone in the music industry, the Coronavirus pandemic caused us to all lose our only source of income (music) and put the brakes on all of our planned mix sessions to complete the record. This constant pushing back of our hopeful release date has really taken its toll on our brains.

So, any funds we hoped to receive from booked live shows around the UK along with the merchandise sales at these shows have now gone, and any funds we have left have had to be used to keep us afloat during this time with absolutely no income :(

 

Aaron pictured from inside an old office window at the factory. Originally going to be a vocal booth, we jammed it full of insulation we found to help deaden the main room instead.

 

Right now, we have 12 tracks for the record and 10 are completely done and being mixed. 2 just need some vocals tracked (which we are doing at home in isolation!!)

We have a handful of overdubs and things to tweak while being mixed, but due to not being able to be together we are overcoming it by recording these at home! This takes a little longer to get right and even harder to collectively make calls on.

Mixing sessions were originally planned with two or more people together at once with our mix engineer pals (names TBA!), and now we've had to halt them or try to do them as remotely as possible! this has added WAY more time to the original sessions.

 

First session in the live room. Sunlight coming through ceiling joins which was essentially a big wooden room built inside a warehouse. There were multiple  iterations of this room through the first week of setup before Bill Ryder-Jones arrived to begin tracking.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally know that given the lockdown, spare cash to donate or pre-order is a massive ask, so all we can hope is if you can't donate, that you might be able to share our campaign, and stream and share the album when it comes out, please help us tell the world about this mammoth creative undertaking we embarked on!!

 

i

The end of tracking at the end of September 2019. Pictured are the crew who made the record happen. Wynona Bleach with Bill Ryder Jones, Mike Hanvey (WB's Live Sound Engineer) & Ethan Owens (Backline/Guitar Tech). Not pictured, Audrey Gillespie who photographed the sessions on 35mm Film, all photos above are credited to!

 

Thank you for reading and supporting us on this weird and wild journey. Be safe in this strange and historic time and much love from us to you!

WBx

story:
The Song

Do you have a devotion to the Sacred Heart of Jesus?   I do!  And I want to share it with the world through my song, Sacred Heart is the Boat.  

This world is in complete chaos with God having been all but forgotten by our mainstream culture.   But right here, right now, you and I can work together to spread the messages of love and mercy found in devotion to the Sacred Heart of Jesus.   Here's the deal:

My original song, Sacred Heart is the Boat is nearly finished at the recording studio!   But I need to raise a little more money to get this incredibly important song finished and released.  

Sacred Heart is the Boat is about the Sacred Heart of Jesus

Sacred Heart is the boat is my attempt to explain how God's love is like an endless ocean.  The Sacred Heart of Jesus is the boat that can carry us to God's love and to eternal life.  My hope with this song is to introduce new listeners to the Sacred Heart of Jesus while encouraging a deeper devotion to the Sacred Heart in others. 

How the Production Process Works and Where We Are

For anyone who doesn't know, here is how professional working works: First we lay down the raw guitar track using a metronome (also called a scratch track).  Second we record drums and bass guitar.  Next we record higher quality guitar erasing the scratch track.   Then we record vocals.  Next we add additional elements such as keyboards, piano, harp or other instruments.  From there we record backing vocals, any additional percussion or other instruments and we begin to mix down the tracks.  After that we mix, review, edit, mix, review, edit until we produce the final mix!  

I personally perform the guitar, vocals and sometimes the percussion, bass and keys.  But I also bring in professional studio musicians to record instruments such as drums, bass, strings and backing vocals to create my mastered music.

Here is where we are right now in the production of Sacred Heart is the Boat.  We have recorded the drums, bass, guitar and main vocals.  Plus we've added in some cool keyboards.  But we still need to add in backing vocals and potentially more guitar and strings.   Last we need to mix, edit and review until we produce the final mix.  We need around 10 hours of additional studio time along with a few additional session musicians to finish the track.  From there we will master the final mix for release! 

I am not writing, producing and spending countless hours reviewing my music to create mediocre songs.  For music to have a big impact it needs to be amazing, high quality and it must entertain while also being inspirational.  That's a tall order! 

Help me finish Sacred Heart is the Boat & you will receive the following perks:

What we need and what you get:

  • We need roughly $1,500 to book studio time, pay musicians, mix, edit, review and master Sacred Heart is the Boat.  
  • Here is what we need to finish production:
    • $750 to $1,000 for studio time
    • $300 for studio musicians 
    • $200 for the release and to start distribution

THE PERKS.  Every person who contributes, regardless of amount, will receive an exclusive download of Sacred Heart is the Boat before it's made public.  Plus there are other cool perks available such as CDs (for my old school friends), tee shirts and even an executive producer credit. 

Any excess funds will be used towards finishing the other tracks that I also have in production which are: 1. Pray for Me (based on the power of prayer to lead sinners to conversion) and 2. Holy War (based on Psalms 144).   I plan to release all three songs as one downloadable mini-album.  

The Impact

This world needs Truth.  This world needs God.  This world needs Jesus!   The Sacred Heart of Jesus is truly a fount of mercy for all sinners and for the whole world.  But that mercy is not automatic and requires the conversion of hearts along with reconciliation.  Help me to introduce the world to the Sacred Heart of Jesus by finishing this song!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please consider sharing this campaign with a friend.
  • Please subscribe to my YouTube channel at YouTube.com/RoyceHood!

God Bless and thanks for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please consider sharing this campaign with a friend.
Please subscribe to my YouTube channel at YouTube.com/RoyceHood!

God Bless and thanks for your support!

story:
This campaign has closed.

BUT you can still contribute here:
https://www.steve-cooke.com/donations

There is an option for Paypal, Venmo and Credit Card for any amount and you can mention which package you chose.

Thank you. Let's Rock!

 

Rock’n’Roll to Free the Soul

Now more than ever, our world needs music that highlights the joy, pain and beauty of what it means to be human in this time of cultural transformation and spiritual neglect.

We’re in the middle of a pandemic and I am feeling it like everybody else. Tours and regular shows are cancelled, including my tour in India at the end of this year.

But Rock’n’Roll never dies, also not during a pandemic, now more than ever do we need new creative work from artists to uplift our souls and transport us back to a time when music was the universal language that brought everyone together.

In these current times, we need to find a way for emotional growth and spiritual comfort.

We need to seek enjoyment and find sense in all of what 2020 has thrown at us and we need to learn that the human experience is a shared experience.

So, I decided to record a 4 song EP with some amazing artists here in Los Angeles.

The EP will be a creation that reflects the social and emotional landscape of our historically unprecedented era. It will incorporate elements of the 70’s while combining them with a modern rock feel.

It will be produced at some amazing Hollywood studios and we have already made a start.

The songs have been carefully chosen, 2 are covers from a famous British Rock band, but with a twist that will excite you, and 2 songs are my own compositions that will fit into the song style I chose to record.

I am grateful for any contribution. Big or small, it will help to contribute to my costs for studio, mastering and musician, and I will be proud of all the people who dedicate their names to this record (EP), especially those who make an executive producer contribution.

To learn how to get involved please see below and read which method best suits you and how you would like to be a part of this historical music project.

Thanking you in advance for helping me to keep Rock’n’roll alive!

Much love to y’all, stay safe and healthy out there.

Thanks, Love and Peace.

Steve xo

 

Please listen: Click below 

Here is a snippet of the first 2 songs

And I greatly appreciate your contributions to finish this record.

----------

 

The Goal

CURRENT GOAL: 

$8,000 will contribute to EP costs (studio, producer, musicians, IndieGogo fees etc).

STRETCH GOAL:  

$12,000 will support me to create accompanying music videos and additional PR to give this music wings across the internet!

 

----------

 

Campaign Breakdown

Any contributions to this production will be used towards the following:

  • Studio time for recording
  • Producer fee 
  • Engineering (recording, mixing & mastering)
  • Studio musician fees
  • Travel costs, food, drinks etc

 

If we reach more than the targeted amount:

  • Music videos
  • Publicity (US, UK & Europe, New Zealand, Australia)
  • Radio Promotion (US, UK & Europe, New Zealand, Australia)

 

----------

 

Why Your Help Matters

I have been pouring love and energy into music my entire life. While success as an independent artist is a miracle of hard work and passion, the coordination, marketing and understanding of the industry is a whole other story when it comes to success in the creative field.

  • With the COVID-19 pandemic, it may be over a year before I can raise these funds through performing safely by myself!
  • I have full faith that this EP will give my artistry the kind of exposure it needs to prosper.
    I have spent years fine-tuning my craft as you know.

 

----------

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me spread the word! Help me give this music the wings it needs to fly into the hearts that need it. 

  • Make some noise!
    Post about me on your social media platform using the IndieGogo share tools!
  • Share me with radio stations, podcasts, artist grants etc.!
  • Send me your love and prayers

 

----------

 

Perks of Supporting:

- Advance signed copy of the album (CD)

- Pre-Album Release Exclusive Listening of New EP

- Ringtone/Alarm

- Private Music Lesson via Skype or Zoom (45 Min)

- Name On EP

- Customized Song

- Become an Executive Producer

- Private Performance

 

----------

 

PLEASE SCROLL ALL THE WAY DOWN
TO SEE ALL AVAILABLE PERKS ON
THE RIGHT SIDE.  

 

AND CLICK ON EACH PERK TO SEE
FULL DETAILS.

--> --> --> -->

story:
Hi,
My name is Amanda Standalone and I am an Americana musician from Minnesota. I am an award winning singer, songwriter, multi instrumentalist and performer. I have been working at my craft ever since I can remember and have performed all over the United States, on stages and street corners. I hold a BA in music with an emphasis in strings, and all I want in the world is to make music my only job. I need your help!
I recently received a small grant from the Lakes Region Arts Council and the Mcknight Foundation to record a solo album of my original material, all written in my younger years while I was traveling and performing across the states. With the help of my dear friends at the Abandoned Scout Camp in Hewitt, MN, we have completed the recording, but now its production time, and I need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's where your contributions will be headed:

Album Artwork: $450

Packaging/Printing: $1250

CD Production: $500

Download Cards: $100

Promotional materials: $150

CD Release Party $300

Postage/Shipping: $100

Indie Go Go: $150

In return for your contributions we have all kinds of stuff planned!!!! Look to the right and check out the Perks!!! If you have any questions or other reasonable ideas, Please let me know!!! I'm certainly not afraid of work!!! It's all I do!

The Impact

As an Artist, I have worked very hard at maintaining my independence through the hard work of understanding the music business and have made it a point to keep a DIY mentality in how I work. My previous album "Millions of Blackbirds" with my band Amanda Standalone and the Pastryshop Girls received much local acclaim, winning the High Plains Readers "Best Bets" Award for best album, and also the song "Bird Flew Hard" was licensed as the opening song for the HBO documentary "Paycheck to Paycheck: The Life and Times of Katrina Gilbert." With this next album I hope to push myself even further, and get out there and share my songs with people everywhere. I want to remind people that real music is being made, even in the smallest of places, and that the world doesn't have to go the way of auto tune and empty words.

Risks & Challenges

There is always a risk in putting yourself out there. It is a lot of hard work to put something you created out there for scrutiny, but I've been doing it for so long and it brings me great joy to be able to open up my heart in the hopes that it helps others to do the same. The real challenge for me is making a marketing plan and really making it a point to get this album out to as many people as possible. I have many ideas, and have been doing my research. Every listener counts, and every person who helps to pass the word along is helping in a great way. I think that hard work will always pay off, and have great faith that someday I'll work my way up to playing in large auditoriums and touring internationally. Thank you so much for your help in overcoming this first hurdle. Every contribution helps!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute,doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share my campaign on your social media sites, or wherever you can! Tell all your friends!!!!!!
  • Come help out at the CD Release Party!!!!
  • Have a friend in Radio? Hand the tunes over!!!
  • Book me a show!!!!!!
  • Learn how to play the egg shaker!!!!
  • Learn how to play the wine glasses!!!!
  • Donate something for the CD release party!
  • Print a few things for me:)

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Hi,
My name is Amanda Standalone and I am an Americana musician from Minnesota. I am an award winning singer, songwriter, multi instrumentalist and performer. I have been working at my craft ever since I can remember and have performed all over the United States, on stages and street corners. I hold a BA in music with an emphasis in strings, and all I want in the world is to make music my only job. I need your help!
I recently received a small grant from the Lakes Region Arts Council and the Mcknight Foundation to record a solo album of my original material, all written in my younger years while I was traveling and performing across the states. With the help of my dear friends at the Abandoned Scout Camp in Hewitt, MN, we have completed the recording, but now its production time, and I need your help!   What We Need & What You Get Here's where your contributions will be headed:
Album Artwork: $450
Packaging/Printing: $1250
CD Production: $500
Download Cards: $100
Promotional materials: $150
CD Release Party $300
Postage/Shipping: $100
Indie Go Go: $150
In return for your contributions we have all kinds of stuff planned!!!! Look to the right and check out the Perks!!! If you have any questions or other reasonable ideas, Please let me know!!! I'm certainly not afraid of work!!! It's all I do!
    The Impact As an Artist, I have worked very hard at maintaining my independence through the hard work of understanding the music business and have made it a point to keep a DIY mentality in how I work. My previous album "Millions of Blackbirds" with my band Amanda Standalone and the Pastryshop Girls received much local acclaim, winning the High Plains Readers "Best Bets" Award for best album, and also the song "Bird Flew Hard" was licensed as the opening song for the HBO documentary "Paycheck to Paycheck: The Life and Times of Katrina Gilbert." With this next album I hope to push myself even further, and get out there and share my songs with people everywhere. I want to remind people that real music is being made, even in the smallest of places, and that the world doesn't have to go the way of auto tune and empty words.
    Risks & Challenges There is always a risk in putting yourself out there. It is a lot of hard work to put something you created out there for scrutiny, but I've been doing it for so long and it brings me great joy to be able to open up my heart in the hopes that it helps others to do the same. The real challenge for me is making a marketing plan and really making it a point to get this album out to as many people as possible. I have many ideas, and have been doing my research. Every listener counts, and every person who helps to pass the word along is helping in a great way. I think that hard work will always pay off, and have great faith that someday I'll work my way up to playing in large auditoriums and touring internationally. Thank you so much for your help in overcoming this first hurdle. Every contribution helps!!
    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute,doesn't mean you can't help:  Please share my campaign on your social media sites, or wherever you can! Tell all your friends!!!!!!
Come help out at the CD Release Party!!!!
Have a friend in Radio? Hand the tunes over!!!
Book me a show!!!!!!
Learn how to play the egg shaker!!!!
Learn how to play the wine glasses!!!!
Donate something for the CD release party!
Print a few things for me:)   And that's all there is to it.

story:
***English Version Below***

Wer wir sind:

Wir sind Delta Constellations aus Göttingen. Anfang 2020 haben wir uns zusammengefunden und haben angefangen Lions Texte und Ideen in einen Bandkontext zu übersetzen. Mit Aaron an der Leadgitarre, Jonas am Bass und Carsten am Schlagzeug haben wir uns seitdem ein komfortables Repertoir an eigenen Songs aufgebaut. Zehn davon würden wir nun gerne professionell produziert in einem Album verewigen.

Warum Crowdfunding?

Diese Kampagne unterstützt direkt - und ausschließlich - unser Album Projekt Recoveries. Über die letzten eineinhalb Jahre haben wir ohne Auftrittsmöglichkeiten und Gage keine Möglichkeit gehabt uns die hinreichenden Mittel anzusparen. Dennoch sind wir momentan an einem Punkt, an dem wir bereit sind mit dem Material ins Studio zu gehen. Ein unsicherer Ausblick in die Zukunft sorgt auch dafür, dass wir nicht mehr warten wollen. Nun sind wir aber auf eure Hilfe angewiesen.

Was eure Unterstützung für uns bedeutet:

Eure Unterstützung nimmt uns den Stress jeden Tag darüber nachzudenken wie wir das Album finanzieren können. Jeder Beitrag - auch jede kleine Spende ohne ein Perk zu erwerben - bringt uns näher an unser Ziel unsere Musik in eure Ohren zu kriegen.

Was wir brauchen & Was ihr bekommt

Die finanzielle Planung eines Albums hängt in unserer Situation von einigen Variablen ab, die wir nur grob einschätzen können. Deswegen haben wir uns für ein Kampagnen-Ziel entschieden, bei dem wir uns sicher sind, uns voll auf die kreative Gestaltung des Albums konzentrieren können, sofern dieses Ziel erreicht wird.

Bis ihr das fertige Album und alle weiteren Perks genießen könnt, kommen diverse Kosten auf uns zu. Dazu gehören Produzent, Studiozeit und Mastering, aber auch Versand und Produktionskosten der CDs, der Sticker und der Poster.

Ganz exklusiv für diese Kampagne sind die handgeschriebenen Songtexte. Für 20 glückliche Unterstützer:innen gibt sich Lion sehr viel Mühe jeweils einen Song seiner Wahl niederzuschreiben. Da dieses Perk limitiert ist kann es nicht als Add-On erworben werden, wenn ihr schon ein anderes Perk ausgewählt habt. Wählt also zuerst den Songtext aus, von da aus könnt ihr dann eine CD, ein Sticker-Paket und ein Poster hinzufügen.

Über die haptischen Perks hinaus bieten wir ab sofort Wohnzimmerkonzerte an, bei denen ihr die Möglichkeit habt uns innerhalb Deutschlands zu euch zu holen, um einen Abend mit guter Laune und stimmungsvoller Musik zu genießen!

Ebenso gibt es den Absurdteuren Grillabend. Wenn ihr zu viel Geld habt und uns einen unglaublichen Gefallen tun wollt, machen wir einen Ort fest und bringen alles mit für einen perfekten Grillabend.

Sollte das Kampagnen-Ziel nicht erreicht werden legen wir trotzdem alles daran das Album produzieren zu lassen. Je nach Situation müssten wir dann privat finanzielle Anteile übernehmen - was wir aber gerne vermeiden möchten.
Wir sind sehr motiviert um dieses Album zu verwirklichen!

Teilt, teilt, teilt!

Über die finanzielle Unterstützung hinaus könnt ihr diese Kampagne und das YouTube-Video sehr gerne auf euren sozialen Medien und privat teilen. Jedes Paar Augen und jedes Paar Ohren, welches wir zusätzlich erreichen erhöht unsere Chance unser Ziel zu erreichen. Markiert uns gerne auf allen Plattformen (@deltaconstellations) wenn ihr etwas postet, dann können wir direkt interagieren.

Nun denn: Wir hoffen auf eure Unterstützung und versichern euch, dass wir diese in jeder Form wertschätzen!

________________________________________________________

 

English Version!!!

Who we are:

We are Delta Constellations from Göttingen. At the beginning of 2020 we found each other to start converting Lion's songtexts and ideas into a band context. With Aaron on the lead guitar, Jonas on the bass and Carsten on the drums, We have accumulated a very sizeable repertoire of songs,ten of which we now want to professionally immortalize in the form of our first studio album

Why Crowdfunding?

This campaign directly - and only - supports our album recording project 'Recoveries'. Over the last one and a half years, without gigs and opportunities to earn money as musicians, we were not able to save the needed dough for a project like this. Nonetheless, we find ourselves at a point in time, where we are ready to hit the studio. A not secure outlook on the future is one more reason for us not to wait any longer. Now we need your help!

What your contribution means for us:

Your contribution saves us the headache of thinking all day and every day about how to finance this project. Every Euro - even the smallest donation without getting any perks - brings us one step closer to bringing our music into your ears.

What we need & What you get

In our situation, financial planning for an album is tied to some variables, that we can hardly predict. This is why we have decided on a campaign goal, where we are sure of being able to fully concentrate on the creative work on the album, as long as the goal is met.

Until you can enjoy the album and all the other perks, there are several costs awaiting us. Included in that are the producer, studio time, mixing and mastering, but also the shipping and production costs for the CDs, the stickers and the posters.

Exclusive to this campaign, you can get handwritten songtexts. For 20 lucky people, Lion is making an effort to individualize a song of his choice and writing the text down for you. Because this perk is limited, you can't purchase it as an Add-On. If you want to get it, you have to select it first and then add on a CD, sticker package or poster, if you want.

In addition to the tangible perks, we are now offering living-room-concerts, where you have the opportunity to bring us to your home within Germany to enjoy an evening with us, good music and a great atmosphere!

There is also the absurdly expensive barbecue evening. If you have too much money and want to do us an incredible favor, we'll fix a place and bring everything with us for a perfect barbecue evening.

In case the campaign goal will not be achieved, we will still do everything we can to produce the album. Depending on the situation, we would need to take over financial shares privately - which we would like to avoid.
We are very motivated to bring this album to life!

Sharing is caring!

In addition to financial support, you can share this campaign and the YouTube-Video on your social media platforms and with your friends and family. Every pair of eyes and ears, that we reach increases our chance to acheiving our goal. Tag us on all platforms with @deltaconstellations if you post something, so that we can also engage.

Now: We hope for your support and can assure you that we are appreciative of any and all contributions!

story:
HEY HEY! 

Here's the deal.   5 song ep of some worship songs i've written or cowritten.  We've been doing these songs for the last couple of years or longer for one of them.   

 

We're down to the final push and need about 2500.00 to finish the project.  

 

I'm going to do this different.  As i said in the video i dont want to promote consumerism in the church so i'm asking for your support without perks.  If you want a CD i'd be glad to give you one. I think most of us listen on Free or subscription platforms now anyway.  You'll be able to find it on there for you listening convenience and pleasure :) 

 

Thank you to everyone who's supported me over the years whether with Jami, Mercyme, or Charlie Hall... I am a creative and i love to create and share it with all of you. 

 

Please consider helping me finish this project with a bang!!

If you cant help financially, please consider sharing with friends and family that can.  Also pray!  I never want to be one who is adding to the "noise".  I pray these songs find their listeners and God's grace and mercy flow out to them in powerful ways! 

 

Kendall

story:
Update #3

It's official! The album is now released as of July 20, 2016! You can still order it here, or visit tara.vision for more purchasing options. 

All perks have now been fulfilled (except for CDs, which are coming very soon). If you are missing anything, please let me know as soon as possible so we can get you all sorted out.

Thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for your support!


Update #2

My album will be released in just a few days!! It's 10 songs ~ 1 hour of my deepest musical prayers. I just listened to the final versions all the way through and I am happy to say this is the most proud I've ever felt about any creative project I've touched. I am elated and can't wait to share it with you!

Working with JonJon, my producer, has been a glorious collaborative experience. I never dreamed that the recordings and arrangements could sound like this. Thanks to him I get to have a total "hell-yeah" feeling about baring my soul via this music.

1. Cuatro Colores 
2. Gateless Gate
3. Ember
4. Surrender
5. I See Your Wings
6. Broken Open
7. Divine Alignment
8. Rainbow Light
9. Be Love
10. Precious Being

You can still pre-order the album or the CD here, or claim any of the remaining perks. 


Artwork by Ka Kathryn June Amorastreya



Update

I'm so elated that this campaign is now over 100% funded!  Anything raised over the $6,000 goal will go toward the following parts of the project:

- Hiring a special Visionary Artist (TBC) to create absolutely magical cover art that I've been dreaming about since I wrote "Rainbow Light."
- Doing a photo shoot with the fabulous Robin Clark (so I don't need to use bad phone selfies or 3 year old photos) for live show flyers, reviews, interviews and other press coverage this album may receive. 
- Paying the guest musicians for their time, energy, gas and tolls (I'm so thrilled to be able to do this).

Your contribution will be well utilized and highly valued! Thank you so much for your support.

The Music

I'm finally recording my album!

For years, people have been asking me where they can find recordings of my music. Up until now I've had to simply say, "soon." 

Now I'm teaming up with producer John Alezivakis at Little Buddha Studios in San Rafael, California to create my first full length album. He has worked with many artists in the same genre including Tina Malia and Shimshai.  I'll be recording 9 original songs (and re-recording the ones on the EP) in a beautiful, simple acoustic style that allows their healing power to shine through.


I would love your support so that I can finally offer my musical medicine to all who may benefit from receiving it!

If you're not familiar with my music, I write original sacred songs that are prayers for deep healing and transformation. People often share with me that long after hearing them, my songs spontaneously reappear in their consciousness in moments of challenge and celebration. The lyrics contain mantras that slip into their subconscious over time, gradually replacing ruminating thoughts and unproductive worries with powerful prayers.  You can listen to a couple of them in the video above.

If you are familiar with my music, this is the track listing (subject to change during the creative process, of course!) 

1. Gateless Gate
2. Rainbow Light
3. Cuatro Colores
4. I See Your Wings
5. Divine Alignment
6. Ember
7. Surrender
8. Broken Open
9. Open Up Your Heart


What I Need & What You Get

It takes so much time and energy to make a great album! I had no idea what truly went into the process before I recorded my 3 song EP.

I am raising money to cover the main expenses, which are the studio time, the producer and the post production. 

If this campaign is successfully funded, I'll be able to spend the ideal amount of time in the studio to record and capture the vision I have for this album.

I've created some beautiful and unique perks here for you to make sure that you're handsomely rewarded for your contribution! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! 

You can help by:

  • Post this campaign on your Facebook page
  • Share this campaign with someone who loves healing, ceremonial music (like Shimshai, Deva Premal, Murray Kyle, Darpan, Tina Malia, Carioca).
Thank you so much for your support!
