Thank you so much for your support!

story:
UPDATE 04.09.2021

HURRAY! We have reached 50%, that's amazing you guys!! I also have some lovely news! Doreen from Greiftier made the most awesome pendants! There are 3 types of perks for this pendant so things will go right!

- HELISIR'S REISE (Pendant only). This is for you who only want a pendant. Shipping costs are calculated based on your location
- PENDANT CARVER. Contains the album and nifty merchgoodies AND the pendant. Shipping costs are calculated based on your location.

And on REQUEST:
- FOLKETONER PENDANT COMBO. This is for those of you who have already claimed a perk, but wish to add the pendant as well! You have to contact me to receive the specific link for that :) This means the pendant will be added to your perk without additional shipping costs. This is NOT VALID for the CUPID and STORMBRINGER PERKS!

The following pictures are prototypes, but aren't they gorgeous??


 

UPDATE 24.08.2021

Thanks to so many of you sharing, contributing and donating to the campaign we're now on 40% Wiehooo. I am so so so grateful! These coming weeks I will work on the book that I'll be releasing alongside some of the campaignperks!

 

Welcome hello hello!

I am Lene and this is the third time I'm launching a crowdfunding campaign to help raise funds for a new album! The personal way and approach that a crowdfunding offers has led me to the point where I can make something again for those who like my music; you!

This time I'm recording a new album on a larger scale and the funds are therefore also a lot more than the previously recorded albums. With your help I can cover the costs for the studio, which means recording, producing, mixing, mastering and the printing part of the album.

It's important to me because I felt I've been wandering around aimlessly trying to get the music off the ground, while at the same time relocating to another country, working a full time job and becoming a mama again. So priorities have shifted massively in a 4 year time span and the free time I have is all about this album right now.

With the funds generated by this crowdfunding campaign I'm finally able to take you on a journey again, and it's more exciting than ever!
 

 

What do I need and what do you get?

Breaking it down for folks in more detail:

  • The total costs for the album are something I largely pay out of my own pocket, I do not rely on funds from art or music institutions. This means that with a little bit of help I'm able to move up the process a little further. The largest part of the crowdfunding will go to the studio.
  • Guest musicians! I'm working together with Martine Kraft (who I played together with in LEAF (2016-2017) and Steinar Ofsdal (flutist, former professor at Ole Bull Akademiet, Bukkene Bruse and involved with Osa Festivalen). Guest musicians don't work for free and I need to properly pay them for their work.
  • Travelling! From Oslo to Gjøvik, where the studio is, is quite a journey and the costs for either car or train are covered in here as well.
  • Printing the album and merchandise. There'll be hoodies and t-shirts and tanktops and giftcards and bookmarks and ofcourse the album itself full of extra artwork. I can do the design for free, because I'll do it myself, BUT.. the printing? Yeah that will cost a bit as well!
  • I'm ready to go full out on merch this time. Remember the skogskatt pendants in Folkvangr? Maybe something like that again, I'm still working on that. But there will definitely be t-shirts and keychains and things like that, because those are either nice to have or to give as a gift!

But why should you support?

Well, you shouldn't do anything you don't feel like. If the album or idea doesn't speak to you then no one is forcing you to crowdfund anything. But:

  • I'm known for making music that makes you travel and I'm working together with an amazing producer who understands what I'm trying to do here and helps me with that.
  • I have an amazing team around me who supports me while also juggling daily life where the bills need to be paid. With your support I can either speed up the progress of the process or leave it as it is.
  • Maybe you just feel like supporting for the sake of supporting. Maybe you like artists who work independently and understand how much time goes in practicing, creating, thoughtspinning and the whole shebang before an album is actually there. Maybe that journey is what makes you excited about this.
  • Perhaps you are just really ready for a new Helisir album and you just can't wait for it to be there, so you'd rather pay up front so you're guaranteed part of the group who receives the album shortly before the release date? 

Risks & Challenges

Look, I work as a hairstylist. I love my job, but I won't work 12 hours a day with full lists just to get an income that also can cover my expenses as a musician. Pandemic happened, no concerts and streams don't nearly generate as much income as you buying an actual album. The risk of the last year could've been that I had to file for bankruptcy, but luckily that was not necessary.

  • The last four years have been a challenge in terms of finding a studio, time, peace of mind, a producer who understands and except for the last 2 years there used to be a very scarce supporting network. That really pushed the brakes hard on music, resulting in contemplating if I wanted to continue to make music at all. But here we are four years later, with a couple of studio hours already behind me, raw mixes playing regularly to find where we can expand and go full out even further.
  • I am running a flexible funding, because with a fixed funding it's all or nothing. I've experienced that stress once and that was not very good for my overall wellbeing. 24/7 stressed in 60 days was... tough :)
  • So the risk is that if I don't get the funding to a 100%, the process might take a little longer and release might be delayed a little bit. But I'm determined to make an album regardless!

Other Ways You Can Help

Look, money is always a tough thing, even when you make enough it might just be that circumstances don't allow you to feel like it's enough. But in that case: please feel free to share and get the word out! Sharing and making the campaign visible is the way to go! I'd be indefinitely grateful for your help regardless!

  • Get the word out, make some noise and don't be shy to share!

I'll make a FAQ with the most frequently asked questions, but feel free to contact me if there's anything you'd like to know?
story_txt:
UPDATE 04.09.2021
HURRAY! We have reached 50%, that's amazing you guys!! I also have some lovely news! Doreen from Greiftier made the most awesome pendants! There are 3 types of perks for this pendant so things will go right!- HELISIR'S REISE (Pendant only). This is for you who only want a pendant. Shipping costs are calculated based on your location- PENDANT CARVER. Contains the album and nifty merchgoodies AND the pendant. Shipping costs are calculated based on your location.And on REQUEST:- FOLKETONER PENDANT COMBO. This is for those of you who have already claimed a perk, but wish to add the pendant as well! You have to contact me to receive the specific link for that :) This means the pendant will be added to your perk without additional shipping costs. This is NOT VALID for the CUPID and STORMBRINGER PERKS!The following pictures are prototypes, but aren't they gorgeous??
 
UPDATE 24.08.2021
Thanks to so many of you sharing, contributing and donating to the campaign we're now on 40% Wiehooo. I am so so so grateful! These coming weeks I will work on the book that I'll be releasing alongside some of the campaignperks!

 
Welcome hello hello!
I am Lene and this is the third time I'm launching a crowdfunding campaign to help raise funds for a new album! The personal way and approach that a crowdfunding offers has led me to the point where I can make something again for those who like my music; you!This time I'm recording a new album on a larger scale and the funds are therefore also a lot more than the previously recorded albums. With your help I can cover the costs for the studio, which means recording, producing, mixing, mastering and the printing part of the album.It's important to me because I felt I've been wandering around aimlessly trying to get the music off the ground, while at the same time relocating to another country, working a full time job and becoming a mama again. So priorities have shifted massively in a 4 year time span and the free time I have is all about this album right now.With the funds generated by this crowdfunding campaign I'm finally able to take you on a journey again, and it's more exciting than ever! 

 

What do I need and what do you get?
Breaking it down for folks in more detail:

The total costs for the album are something I largely pay out of my own pocket, I do not rely on funds from art or music institutions. This means that with a little bit of help I'm able to move up the process a little further. The largest part of the crowdfunding will go to the studio.
Guest musicians! I'm working together with Martine Kraft (who I played together with in LEAF (2016-2017) and Steinar Ofsdal (flutist, former professor at Ole Bull Akademiet, Bukkene Bruse and involved with Osa Festivalen). Guest musicians don't work for free and I need to properly pay them for their work.
Travelling! From Oslo to Gjøvik, where the studio is, is quite a journey and the costs for either car or train are covered in here as well.
Printing the album and merchandise. There'll be hoodies and t-shirts and tanktops and giftcards and bookmarks and ofcourse the album itself full of extra artwork. I can do the design for free, because I'll do it myself, BUT.. the printing? Yeah that will cost a bit as well!
I'm ready to go full out on merch this time. Remember the skogskatt pendants in Folkvangr? Maybe something like that again, I'm still working on that. But there will definitely be t-shirts and keychains and things like that, because those are either nice to have or to give as a gift!



But why should you support?
Well, you shouldn't do anything you don't feel like. If the album or idea doesn't speak to you then no one is forcing you to crowdfund anything. But:

I'm known for making music that makes you travel and I'm working together with an amazing producer who understands what I'm trying to do here and helps me with that.
I have an amazing team around me who supports me while also juggling daily life where the bills need to be paid. With your support I can either speed up the progress of the process or leave it as it is.
Maybe you just feel like supporting for the sake of supporting. Maybe you like artists who work independently and understand how much time goes in practicing, creating, thoughtspinning and the whole shebang before an album is actually there. Maybe that journey is what makes you excited about this.
Perhaps you are just really ready for a new Helisir album and you just can't wait for it to be there, so you'd rather pay up front so you're guaranteed part of the group who receives the album shortly before the release date? 


Risks & Challenges
Look, I work as a hairstylist. I love my job, but I won't work 12 hours a day with full lists just to get an income that also can cover my expenses as a musician. Pandemic happened, no concerts and streams don't nearly generate as much income as you buying an actual album. The risk of the last year could've been that I had to file for bankruptcy, but luckily that was not necessary.

The last four years have been a challenge in terms of finding a studio, time, peace of mind, a producer who understands and except for the last 2 years there used to be a very scarce supporting network. That really pushed the brakes hard on music, resulting in contemplating if I wanted to continue to make music at all. But here we are four years later, with a couple of studio hours already behind me, raw mixes playing regularly to find where we can expand and go full out even further.
I am running a flexible funding, because with a fixed funding it's all or nothing. I've experienced that stress once and that was not very good for my overall wellbeing. 24/7 stressed in 60 days was... tough :)
So the risk is that if I don't get the funding to a 100%, the process might take a little longer and release might be delayed a little bit. But I'm determined to make an album regardless!


Other Ways You Can Help
Look, money is always a tough thing, even when you make enough it might just be that circumstances don't allow you to feel like it's enough. But in that case: please feel free to share and get the word out! Sharing and making the campaign visible is the way to go! I'd be indefinitely grateful for your help regardless!
Get the word out, make some noise and don't be shy to share!
I'll make a FAQ with the most frequently asked questions, but feel free to contact me if there's anything you'd like to know?

story:
LIKE A RAVEN IN THE DARK - Who is Ravenous E.H?

We are a Canadian Heavy Metal band combining elements of speed, thrash, power, black, and prog metal into one heavy, uniform streamlined package that we call 'Symphonic Speed Metal'.

  • Our members include frontman R.A. Voltaire (Villainizer, Kobra and the Lotus, Shadowblade, Sixguns over Tombstone, Death Toll Rising), guitarists Jake Wright (Viathyn) and Skyler Mills (W.M.D., Outlaws of Ravenhurst, Terrorizer), bassist Chris Valax (Black Pestilence, The Myconid, Lithica), and drummer Dave Crnkovic (Viathyn, Triple Threat, Becari).

  • This is NOT A CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN - it is a pre-order! Like any video game or album or book etc... we want to offer our true fans a chance for better prices, exclusive perks, and early access to our material in exchange for your faith in our product!

 

 

ALBUM BE THY NAME - Album Information

Title: Hubris
Release Date: October 22nd 2021
Tracklist:

  1. Carnage in Carthage
  2. Astral Elixir
  3. Son of Storms
  4. Die 1,000 Deaths (ft. Heinrich Yoshio from 'Aether Realm')
  5. Bridgeburner
  6. The Alder Queen (ft. Nina Osegueda from 'A Sound of Thunder')
  7. March of Hunger
  8. Claw is the Law (ft. The Dread Crew of Oddwood)
  9. Onwards & Upwards (ft. Mathias Blad from 'Falconer')
  10. ...Of Beasts and Faust (ft. Vincent Jones from 'Aether Realm')

Japanese Edition Bonus Tracks (Spiritual Beast release only)

11. Cakaw te Partiro (Andrea Bocelli Cover)
12. 一瞬千撃 (Die 1,000 Deaths Japanese Version)

 

AIN'T TALKIN' 'BOUT FUNDS - What We Need 

Here is the price breakdown of the new album (all prices in $CAD)

  • Recording - $0

    • Seriously - we did all the recording ourselves by taking our downtime during COVID-19 to upskill, buy good gear, and spent THOUSANDS of hours together demoing, re-writing, and finalizing the tracks and we are charging NOTHING to our fans for that time - this will not be factored into our costs. 

  • Guest artists - $760

    • We actually pay our guest artists for their feature spots as we don't believe in the "Hey bro want to be on an album for free?" bullshit that seems to permeate our industry.

  • Editing, Mixing & Mastering - $10,389.79

    • This was our attempt at getting as professional-sounding of an album as possible with a world-class producer.

  • Design - $1042.50

    • This covers artwork, design services, and photography

  • Printing - $1300

    • This is only covering the cost of printing and shipping 

  • Press & Advertising - $7522.84

    • Press kits, media mailouts, Facebook ads, Instagram ads, Spotify ads, you name it... this is the wonderful world we live in where your album goes unnoticed unless you pay our overlords to allow others to see it. 

  • Music Videos - $3060.64 

    • This is only covering the costs of our lyric videos pre-album launch - all music videos set for post-album launch are not factored in. 

  • Indiegogo Fees - $1924.23

    • Yes, they take 5% of whatever we raise.

TOTAL - $26,000

 

THE PERKS OF FEANOR - Perks Packages

  • $6.66 - WARRIOR OF HUNGER COMBO #1

    • Get the new album 'HUBRIS' before the release as high quality mp3s, including Japanese bonus tracks, and the pre-order-only instrumental version of the album!
    • Indiegogo won't let us charge $6.66 so we're charging $6 :'(

  • $10 - TRVE WARRIOR COMBO #2

    • Get a signed copy of the new album 'HUBRIS' before the release as a standard jewel case CD, plus all the previous perks!

  • $30 - ULTIMATE WARRIOR COMBO #3

    • Get the official 'HUBRIS' T-shirt (XS-3XL), plus all the previous perks!

  • $50 - HADOKEN WARRIOR COMBO #4

    • Get the official 'Die 1,000 Deaths' T-shirt (XS-3XL), plus all the previous perks!
    • Includes a personalized shout out video!

  • $100 - RAMENOUS WARRIOR COMBO #5

    • Last time we did "Caffeinous" shirts with a bag of dark roast "Caffeinous" coffee beans - and it was a hit! So we're making food-pun Ravenous items a regular thing for each pre-order.
    • Get the official 'RAMENOUS - EAT THE RAMEN' shirt only available during this pre-order, plus a pair of official branded Ravenous chopsticks, a pack of the spiciest noodles we could find, and all the perks of the previous combo!
    • Includes a personalized shout out video!
    • PRE-ORDER ONLY!

  • $420 - COVER WARRIOR COMBO #6

    • A cover song of your choice (note, it works best when you provide us with a few options to "Ravenize". We had so much fun last time doing a Rush cover for David Levin (check it out below) - we thought we would open it up to multiple covers this time! (This combo includes all perks of the Ramenous Combo #5 package)
    • Includes a personalized shout out video!

 

  • $800 - PARTY WARRIOR COMBO #7

    • Last album we launched this as a package where we come to your house and play a private show for you and your friends - and it was one of the most enjoyable experiences we ever had. Kegs. Partying. Sweat. Rowing. It was also a lot of work and mayhem, so we've upped the price to make up for all the gear that was broken last time. 
    • Includes a personalized shout out video!
    • NOTE: ONLY AVAILABLE TO LOCAL RESIDENTS OF CALGARY

  • $1000 - LEGENDARY WARRIOR COMBO #8

    • Last campaign we put this up as a joke - little did we know that we had David Rapp ready to subscribe to a lifetime of Ravenous perks and we've since held up our end of the bargain, including sending him one of every merch item we've printed since the last album. This perk includes:
    • Free entry to any Ravenous show (not including major festivals)
    • A lifetime subscription to all future merchandise prints
    • All previous perks
    • Includes a personalized shout out video!

Everyone Say "HI DAVID!"

  • $4305 - R4V3N0U5 WARRIOR COMBO #9

    • The Legendary Warrior combo was supposed to be the "ridiculous thing no one would ever buy" last time, so we had to up our game! Seriously though... contact us beforehand if you plan on throwing this much money at us!

Standalone Add-ons

$5 - Pins Package - Thanks for helping us hit 25%!

 

$20 Hubris Flags - Thanks for helping us hit 35%!

 

$20 - Astral Elixir Tshirt

ANOTHER SHARE IN THE WALL (pt.2) - Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this page on your social media pages
  • Follow us on Facebook
  • Follow us on Instagram
  • Follow us on Spotify
  • Check out our YouTube videos
  • Tell your friends

story:
Short Summary

Elemaria is a unique expression of fervent faith, devotion, and reverence in the form of music. From gentle, ambient grooves - mantra-like with repeating themes and affirmations, to explosive rock, funk energy - grande, experimental, and progressive. 

Honest and soulful, they are love and gratitude channeled creatively, alchemizing pain into love, through powerful music.

This campaign is to raise funds so we can properly release our debut album, Into the Light, a 7 song lightning storm of groovy inspiration.

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping to raise $8888 to fully cover the costs of recording,  mixing, mastering and promoting the album. 

  • Recording costs (Artscape Daniel's Launchpad + 4 Home Recording Studios= $2500
  • Mixing 7 songs (Mixes by Ashton Price, Loup V and Jeremy Legault) = approx. $4250
  • Paid to our friends Matt Bajcar and Zarah Aedma as session musicians = $350
  • Mastering by Kristian Montano = $800
  • Promotional campaigns for blogs, Spotify, Instagram, and Youtube = $2500
     

If you help us achieve this you'll get access to unique perks and some limited edition items you'll only ever find as a contributing member of this campaign including:

  • Limited edition shirts (View the shirts here: https://www.etsy.com/ca/shop/SalijCustoms?ref=s...)
  • A vinyl pressing of the album
  • An original song written and performed just for you
  • One of a Kind Custom Art Thank You Cards
  • An invitation to an exclusive pre-release listening party
  • A five-class access pass to  Ashley's Community Mantra Nights
  • Access to the VIP club grants you weekly calls with the band to talk about whatever you want
     

The Impact

We hope that this album inspires people to live their best lives. We hope it brings joy. We hope it makes you smile. We hope it evokes awe, and wonder, and amazement. These are some of the things we feel when we play and we hope that comes through in the music.

When you invest in us you encourage us to dream even bigger. We become more confident and better able to reach more people. Your collaboration helps us create our music and spread our message further.
 

Risks & Challenges

The process of recording this album has had many ups and downs. We've had resources given to us, and also pulled away. We've had people come on in and out of the project. We've had good laughs and good cries. But we made it. On July 15 we begin releasing this long awaited project. It's been 18 months of realizing the collective dream we shared.

At this point the biggest challenges feel like they are behind us, ahead of us lies the task of getting this music heard. It would be great to have all the love and effort we poured into this album validated by having it actually reach people. A marketing budget would help us spread the message far and wide.
 

Meet the Team

​Ashley Gilmore is the singer. Her voice will make you quiver. There is an undeniable power that her voice carries - it is sincere, and raw, but so rich and expressive. Her response seems super-natural. Music is her first language. With cat like reflexes she harmonizes and crafts melodies that steal your heart and leave you speechless. She is irresistible, like an eternally burning fire. 

Daniel Salij is the bass player. He is solid, constant, and allowing - gentle yet firm. Creating a space/foundation on which the others can explore and create. He is the Earth. A vast stunning landscape, unshakable and enduring.

Jacob Blanchard is the guitar player. A master of audio atmospheres and textures. Using multiple layers of reverb, delays and other effects, he paints universes you can taste with your ears. At times his playing is spacious and ethereal, and at times funky and articulate. His style is undeniable. Transcendental and experimental. Jacob is the sky and ocean - explosive bursts of light in the deep and dark. 

Dylan Piercey is the drummer. A perfectly fitting glove, or cinderella's glass slipper. He is a solid, pocket post-experimental player whose skill and expertise glues the Elemaria project together.  He is music's expression of rocket science. He is dynamic - a pebble and a mountain. The sands of constant time and natural momentum. He is a tempo conductor, pointing to forever.

Beyond the band listed above, the album includes extensive contributions from: the magical and breathtaking Matthew Bajcar (keyboards on 5 of 7 songs), from  Luis Valiente on Into the Light (mixing and keyboards), Zarah Aedma (back up vocals on Prayer and Always), Ashton Price (mixing 5 of 7 songs), and Jeremy Legault (mixing on Turquoise Dreamer).

We also want to acknowledge and thank the staff at Artscape Daniel's Launchpad (the studio at which we tracked drums and bass), and Beck Ganon for connecting us to the studio and donating 30 hours of studio time to Ashley for the album. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that our music carries strong vibrations of love, joy, peace and acceptance and every engagement helps us deliver this message further. Every testimonial, comment, review, share, subscription, means something to us. Every smile, every connection, and positive interaction motivates us. We want to inspire people to choose love, and to affirm that with you co-creating is very encouraging. 

  • Co-create with $$$
  • Co-create by commenting and sharing posts in our social media campaign on Instagram and Facebook
  • Co-create with personal messages to us about how our music impacts you.

Access to the VIP club grants you weekly calls with the band to talk about whatever you want 


The Impact
We hope that this album inspires people to live their best lives. We hope it brings joy. We hope it makes you smile. We hope it evokes awe, and wonder, and amazement. These are some of the things we feel when we play and we hope that comes through in the music.When you invest in us you encourage us to dream even bigger. We become more confident and better able to reach more people. Your collaboration helps us create our music and spread our message further. 

Risks & Challenges
The process of recording this album has had many ups and downs. We've had resources given to us, and also pulled away. We've had people come on in and out of the project. We've had good laughs and good cries. But we made it. On July 15 we begin releasing this long awaited project. It's been 18 months of realizing the collective dream we shared.At this point the biggest challenges feel like they are behind us, ahead of us lies the task of getting this music heard. It would be great to have all the love and effort we poured into this album validated by having it actually reach people. A marketing budget would help us spread the message far and wide. 
Meet the Team

​Ashley Gilmore is the singer. Her voice will make you quiver. There is an undeniable power that her voice carries - it is sincere, and raw, but so rich and expressive. Her response seems super-natural. Music is her first language. With cat like reflexes she harmonizes and crafts melodies that steal your heart and leave you speechless. She is irresistible, like an eternally burning fire. Daniel Salij is the bass player. He is solid, constant, and allowing - gentle yet firm. Creating a space/foundation on which the others can explore and create. He is the Earth. A vast stunning landscape, unshakable and enduring.Jacob Blanchard is the guitar player. A master of audio atmospheres and textures. Using multiple layers of reverb, delays and other effects, he paints universes you can taste with your ears. At times his playing is spacious and ethereal, and at times funky and articulate. His style is undeniable. Transcendental and experimental. Jacob is the sky and ocean - explosive bursts of light in the deep and dark. Dylan Piercey is the drummer. A perfectly fitting glove, or cinderella's glass slipper. He is a solid, pocket post-experimental player whose skill and expertise glues the Elemaria project together.  He is music's expression of rocket science. He is dynamic - a pebble and a mountain. The sands of constant time and natural momentum. He is a tempo conductor, pointing to forever.Beyond the band listed above, the album includes extensive contributions from: the magical and breathtaking Matthew Bajcar (keyboards on 5 of 7 songs), from  Luis Valiente on Into the Light (mixing and keyboards), Zarah Aedma (back up vocals on Prayer and Always), Ashton Price (mixing 5 of 7 songs), and Jeremy Legault (mixing on Turquoise Dreamer).We also want to acknowledge and thank the staff at Artscape Daniel's Launchpad (the studio at which we tracked drums and bass), and Beck Ganon for connecting us to the studio and donating 30 hours of studio time to Ashley for the album. 
Other Ways You Can Help
We know that our music carries strong vibrations of love, joy, peace and acceptance and every engagement helps us deliver this message further. Every testimonial, comment, review, share, subscription, means something to us. Every smile, every connection, and positive interaction motivates us. We want to inspire people to choose love, and to affirm that with you co-creating is very encouraging. 

Co-create with $$$
Co-create by commenting and sharing posts in our social media campaign on Instagram and Facebook
Co-create with personal messages to us about how our music impacts you.

story:
Who Is Rainbow Star and Where Is This 'Palace'?

  • "My daddy named little Pine Valley Drive..."  Thus begins 'Berea,' the first single from "Music From The Rainbow Sparkle Palace: Volume I."   I grew up amid the Appalachian hills, traveled the world, and returned to put down roots, in a 96 sq. ft. 'tiny house,' with sparkly pink floors, abundant gardens and medicinal mushrooms growing in the woods.
  • My debut album is being recorded in a geodesic dome nestled in the woods on Pine Valley Drive, just a few houses from my childhood home, and the creeks I played in as a child.  My family recounts tales of 18-month-old me ascending the stage of a woodland amphitheater we stumbled upon on a hike, and performing at length and with vigor.  "MFTRSP: Volume I" brings full-circle the efforts of many years and many songs, begging to be brought to light in the form of a full-length album.  
  • My dear friend Sam Gleaves is generously offering his fiddle-playing on the album: I'm elated to be working with such a generous, genuine and talented soul.
  • Author SARK asserts that our passion indicates our purpose in life, and by following it to completion, we inspire others to live "joy-full" lives and pursue their dreams as well.  By contributing to this campaign, you not only assist in the creation of a life-long dream for me, but via ripple-effect will be assuring others that dreams do come true. 
  • 10% of album profits are going to Medwater, a Kentucky-based non-profit that brings clean water and sanitation to communities in Uganda, El Salvador and Ecuador.  It's a great honor to be working closely with this organization, and I can personally attest to the fact that every penny is amazingly well-spent.  So by supporting this project, you are supporting tremendous efforts to bring clean water and sanitation to our brothers and sisters!  That feels wonderful.

The Nitty Gritty: Details

  • $6,000 will secure PR (publicity) which ensures the album receives proper press exposure: radio and news releases will be successful, and will make contacts I can use for the rest of my music career.  
  • $2,000 will secure funds for recording the album and pressing the records. (So exciting!)
  • $600 will create a magical music video for "Berea,"  shot by talented local photographer, Erica Chambers, and edited locally as well.  The video will tell the story of my childhood; the story of returning to our roots and the deep fulfillment found at home. 
  • A small portion of campaign costs are to cover fees from IndieGogo for hosting a campaign
  • Campaign Perks include an early-download of the album, 1 week before release date, original watercolors made by lil ol' me, signed albums, handwritten lyrics and more.  Details are found to the right on this page!
  • Feel free to email me with any questions, etc. at thisisrainbowstar@gmail.com.  I would love to hear from you!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make some noise about the album and this campaign: Share on social media, email your friends!
  • Feel free to be generous with the Indiegogo share tools!

Magic ensues!

Deep gratitude, and namaste.

story:
A new night featuring full band performances from two of Nubiyan Twists freshest offshoots in the intimate venue Paper Dress vintage set in the heart of Hackney Central.

MATTERS UNKNOWN 

This is the debut project from the multi-instrumentalist and composer Jonny Enser. A solo project emerging from his work as a key contributor to the UK afro-jazz pioneers Nubiyan Twist, Jonny has gathered some of the most talented forces contributing to the London Scene drawing from projects such as Nerija, Noya Rao, COLECTIVA, Allysha Joy's and Emma-Jean Thackray's bands to create a kaleidoscopic project of united musical visions. 

Jonny is deeply influenced by diverse traditions, with undercurrents carrying grooves from the roots of the Blues to West Coast beats. 

“This is Celestial Blues, wrapped in contemporary global grooves. MATTERS UNKNOWN simply defines all things and all thoughts. Inspiration can occur from anything. Each member of the project is a huge spiritual influence for me. They have found me through years of hard graft in the industry.'

and

TOE

Bastions of creative partnership. Joe Henwood (Nubiyan Twists Bari Sax and Dub Master) and Tash Keary lead a powerhouse duo taking audiences on a transfixing journey through this groundbreaking project. Expect explorations from King Tubby and Cinematic Orchestra to Radio Head and Rage Against the Machine. Big things to come from this fiery duo. 


Gracing the decks we will have beats curated by Papaoul(Worldwide FM Resident, NTS) keeping the vibes high until the early hours. He is one of the finest DJ's on the the London scene and brings all the energy to each of his shows. Expect floor fillers, stank faces and much perspiration.

AUKA (AKA Viva Msimang) following a season of successful stream gigs she is one of the most exciting up and coming DJ's paying homage to the freshest global bass music.

And

New to the bill, playing outside early evening all vinyl set in the courtyard from Ben The Roman, 

We are crowdfunding this event to be able to support musicians with appropriate fees, given the small capacity of the venue and years closure of venues, we have to explore new ways to get quality music played live in all venues. Be part of the movement for better rights for musicians and supporting your local grassroots venues. 

As of 19th of July this page is being used exclusively for merchandise. If you want a ticket there is now a DICE link.

https://link.dice.fm/NFuxczrSWhb

story:
Too Bad Eugene is recording our first new album in 19 years! Recording is well underway and the first single will be releasing soon! We ran a Kickstarter campaign to fund it, which went very well, but we still need more money, so we are offering a run of T-shirts to help raise more funds. This shirt was designed by our buddy Sam Pine, a Santa Cruz artist whose company The Undertakings you should be looking out for. Check them out @the.undertakings on Instagram!

The shirts are black on unisex red heather 50/50 cotton poly blend moisture-wicking t-shirt. Price includes shipping anywhere in the US! $30 for 1 shirt or $55 for 2!

As an added bonus, anyone who buys a shirt will get every song we release for the new album a week before they are generally available on streaming sites. Every pre-release single and the full album itself will be emailed to you at least one week before everyone else hears them!

story:
WE DID IT - WE REACHED OUR GOAL OF $7000!! We have unlocked new rewards for everyone at all reward tiers.

Even though we've reached our goal, you can continue ordering rewards until our supplies run out!

Since reaching $7000, all contributors at all reward tiers will now also receive Crissi Cochrane guitar picks, a 5x7 postcard featuring a portrait of Crissi created by Delaney, and hand-written thank you notes!

Our original goal was set at the lowest end of our budget. Upon reaching that first goal, we decided to push forward with stretch goals. The more funding we raise, the more co-op hours Delaney can work on this project (which is a part of her Animation degree at Sheridan College), and the more loving detail that she can render in our finished work!

When we reached our first stretch goal of $5000, we unlocked the creation of bonus features (an Artist's Commentary Cut and an Interview with the Artists) and a digital download of Crissi Cochrane's entire digital discography (dating back to 2006!) for all contributors. 

Contributors will be receiving your digital download of Crissi's discography in August, and all perks will be shipped out by the end of August/early September. We'll also be contacting you over the summer to provide details about the Early Screening Event that we'll be holding just for you via Zoom in September.

Thank you so much for helping us fund this project - we are completely overjoyed by all your kindness and support!

 

 

 

About WHY: Animated Music Video

Windsor, Ontario pop/soul singer-songwriter Crissi Cochrane wants to create her first-ever animated music video! The project, to be animated by Sheridan College student (and Windsor native!) Delaney Beaudoin, will accompany Crissi's upcoming single "Why".

Animation is a such a beloved medium for story-telling, with a limitless capacity for creative exploration - breaking the laws of physics, suspending disbelief, and manifesting rich imaginary worlds. But it's also a time-intensive process, and artists deserve to be paid - and paid well! - for their work. 

In exchange for contributing to this project, you'll be entitled to receive some very special perks to thank you for your support. Plus, the warm, fuzzy feeling of knowing that you helped two independent artists follow their dreams and create a piece of art that the whole world will enjoy!
 

A coloured storyboard frame, showing a seamstress at work in her studio.
 

Video Concept

This animated music video accompanies Crissi's upcoming single, "Why", a bittersweet and expressive pop/soul song all about missed connections in romance, and inspired by the true story of two people who continually cross paths at the wrong time. 

In the video, a seamstress will be creating garments that come to life around her, and enact scenes from her romantic past. It's a whimsical and artistic concept, set in the early 1900s, with vintage sewing tools and techniques. 

The animation style is to be done in 2D and hand-drawn, inspired by the works of Studio Ghibli (Totoro, Ponyo) and Nickelodeon's Avatar and Legend of Korra series. 

One of five gorgeous prints that contributors of $40+ will receive, featuring artwork from the video by Delaney Beaudoin.

 

What Goes Into an Animated Video?

Production is expected to last 18 weeks. From design, script, storyboarding, rough and clean animating, compositing, and editing, this project will take anywhere from 270 to 720 hours of work to complete. That's a tremendous amount of time! Which is why you don't see more animated music videos, as most musicians don't have access to budgets significant enough to undertake this kind of project.

  • While our Indiegogo funding goal is set at $3000, the actual cost for this project is estimated to be in the ballpark of $8000. We've applied for grant funding from the City of Windsor and the MVP Project, and are awaiting results of our applications.
  • As Delaney is an animation student currently enrolled at Sheridan College, this project will be a co-op credit for her animation degree. (So cool!)

A coloured storyboard frame, showing an embroidered piece created by the seamstress as she reminisces about her romantic past. 

 

Making It Happen

Over the past dozen years, Crissi has created 3 albums, 4 EPs, 8 music videos, produced countless special events and tours, written dozens of grants, and co-founded a record label. Being a self-managed artist requires a lot of careful planning and follow-through, and Crissi is devoted to making this particular project happen! Crowd-funding takes a lot of dedication, which Crissi has experienced first-hand in funding 3 different crowd-funded projects over the years, including the most recent vinyl pressing of her 2020 album Heirloom on vinyl.

We'll be hustling to get as many eyes as possible on this campaign, and continuing to scout for other sources of funding throughout the summer. 

 

A limited-edition screen-printed handkerchief, featuring the "Constellation Hands" design of the video's title card artwork by Delaney Beaudoin. Printed on 100% cotton, with hand-rolled seams finished by Crissi Cochrane.
 

Perks

 

VIP Early Screening Package - $20

  • Access to the VIP Early Screening online event in September 2021

 

VIP + One Signed Print Package - $40

  • Access to the VIP Early Screening online event in September 2021
  • One 8.5” x 11” print featuring art from the video, signed by Crissi and Delaney
  • Your name in the video’s description on Facebook and YouTube

 

VIP + Five Signed Prints Package - $60

  • Access to the VIP Early Screening online event in September 2021
  • Five 8.5” x 11” prints featuring art from the video, signed by Crissi and Delaney
  • Your name in the video’s description on Facebook and YouTube

 

VIP + Name in Credits Package - $80

  • Access to the VIP Early Screening online event in September 2021
  • Five 8.5” x 11” prints featuring art from the video, signed by Crissi and Delaney
  • Your name in the video’s on-screen credits
  • Your name in the video’s description on Facebook and YouTube

 

VIP + Prints + Credits + Hanky - $100

  • Access to the VIP Early Screening online event in September 2021
  • Five 8.5” x 11” print featuring art from the video, signed by Crissi and Delaney
  • Your name in the video’s on-screen credits
  • Your name in the video’s description on Facebook and YouTube
  • A one-of-a-kind handkerchief handmade by Crissi, featuring the video’s title card screen-printed on a navy blue 100% cotton

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to quickly help spread the word!

And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much for your time and support!

story:
No Hay Banda!

As many of you know, I am the singer in the David Lynch classic, 

Mulholland Drive which is celebrating it's 20th Anniversary this year. 

2021

I also appear in Twin Peaks the Return (Ep 10) and many other movies such as Southland Tales.

I am starting this IndieGoGo page because....

  • NEW ALBUM

I am putting out a new vinyl on 11/11/21. 

It's a lovely 7 inch vinyl (45)  with my favorite song, Llorando on side A and 

a mystery song (a Capella, of course) on Side B

Hence the title "No Hay Banda" because there is no band.

  • TOUR

I will be playing Art House Theaters across North America in the Fall of 2021.

Due to the impact of the last year, these beautiful little theaters are struggling and we are not able to provide my touring support (flights, tour manager, gas, cars, merch, food, etc.) 

Help me celebrate the 20th Anniversary of Mulholland Drive this year as sadly, we missed the 30th Anniversary of Twin Peaks last year. This will never happen again. It's also the 60th Anniversary of the release of "Crying" by Roy Orbison. 20, 30, 60!! How Dreamy!

  • HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE

I need help to make this dream come true. I don't have a big record company supporting me or any Tour promoter, manager, handler, etc. like all the big acts do. 

I am trying to raise 11,111.11 Dollars for an 11 city National tour.

If I could get 11 backers at 1,000.00 or 111 backers at 100.00, or even 1000 backers at 11 dollars, I could make it. 

Only YOU can help me make this dream a reality. 

So far I have Chicago Sept 29 & 30  Missoula Oct 3, Tucson Oct 23, Portland Nov. 13 & 14. Seattle Nov 21, San Fran Nov 27 & 28  which is wonderful for all of the Twin Peaks fans. Please get your tickets asap when the theater announces the sales, as we anticipate these shows will be sold out quickly.

I have interest from other major cities (including NYC, Austin, Alabama, Nashville, and Los Angeles) but I can't commit to them until I know I can raise some funds to pay for my travel.  Any help you can provide via Venmo will still allow you to receive the perk related to that donation amount and I can start booking flights to these cities! 

Once I get there I can sell merch (I have to purchase more merch to sell as well) and sign autographs but I won't be able to get there without your help.

Any donation will be much appreciated. Even if you don't want any perks, please feel free to donate whatever you can.

  • PERKS (Goodies)

I have some gifts to offer...

Would you be interested in:

A Handwritten Autographed gorgeous postcard?

Shout Outs on my social media and/or on Stage?

Download cards of New Singles?

Headshots autographed and dedicated to you or that special someone?

New 45" Vinyl?

New 45"  Vinyl for VIP donor including an autographed suitcase record player?

Two Tickets to any show on the tour?

Personal outgoing Voice Message by Rebekah Del Rio (could include a little jingle)?

Cameo for you and a friend? (2 for 1)

Private Zoom Meet & Greet?

Private concert for your friends?

Executive Producer Credits on album?

Getting Married??? I am a Non-Denominational Minister and can Officiate your special day. I will even serenade the lovely couple during their nuptials too. Now that's gotta be worth something! 

oh the Goodies are endless.... I have so much to give...

Gift in kind donations will be accepted with a tax write off letter as I will be giving a percentage of my earnings to help children through my late son's charity The Phillip C. DeMars Foundation. A California Non-Profit 501 (c) (3) 

You can Venmo me, PayPal or Zelle me a donation if you are not a collector and just want to show your support. Thank You!

Please go to my Insta account - RebekahDelRioOfficial for all my links in the Bio.

Can't donate today? I understand. We've all been through so much financial uncertainty during this pandemic and it's been really hard to recover.

You can spread the word by sharing this fundraising campaign with your colleagues, friends and family on your socials. That would really be so helpful.

Thank you for any and all of your generosity and love!

 

Rebekah Del Rio

11:11

Note:

This page will be going through updates throughout the duration of the funding campaign as we add photos of the perk items and more videos and little BTS footage, etc.
story_txt: No Hay Banda!As many of you know, I am the singer in the David Lynch classic, Mulholland Drive which is celebrating it's 20th Anniversary this year. 2021I also appear in Twin Peaks the Return (Ep 10) and many other movies such as Southland Tales.I am starting this IndieGoGo page because....NEW ALBUMI am putting out a new vinyl on 11/11/21. It's a lovely 7 inch vinyl (45)  with my favorite song, Llorando on side A and a mystery song (a Capella, of course) on Side BHence the title "No Hay Banda" because there is no band.TOURI will be playing Art House Theaters across North America in the Fall of 2021.Due to the impact of the last year, these beautiful little theaters are struggling and we are not able to provide my touring support (flights, tour manager, gas, cars, merch, food, etc.) Help me celebrate the 20th Anniversary of Mulholland Drive this year as sadly, we missed the 30th Anniversary of Twin Peaks last year. This will never happen again. It's also the 60th Anniversary of the release of "Crying" by Roy Orbison. 20, 30, 60!! How Dreamy!HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTEI need help to make this dream come true. I don't have a big record company supporting me or any Tour promoter, manager, handler, etc. like all the big acts do. I am trying to raise 11,111.11 Dollars for an 11 city National tour.If I could get 11 backers at 1,000.00 or 111 backers at 100.00, or even 1000 backers at 11 dollars, I could make it. Only YOU can help me make this dream a reality. So far I have Chicago Sept 29 & 30  Missoula Oct 3, Tucson Oct 23, Portland Nov. 13 & 14. Seattle Nov 21, San Fran Nov 27 & 28  which is wonderful for all of the Twin Peaks fans. Please get your tickets asap when the theater announces the sales, as we anticipate these shows will be sold out quickly.I have interest from other major cities (including NYC, Austin, Alabama, Nashville, and Los Angeles) but I can't commit to them until I know I can raise some funds to pay for my travel.  Any help you can provide via Venmo will still allow you to receive the perk related to that donation amount and I can start booking flights to these cities! Once I get there I can sell merch (I have to purchase more merch to sell as well) and sign autographs but I won't be able to get there without your help.Any donation will be much appreciated. Even if you don't want any perks, please feel free to donate whatever you can.PERKS (Goodies)I have some gifts to offer...Would you be interested in:A Handwritten Autographed gorgeous postcard?Shout Outs on my social media and/or on Stage?Download cards of New Singles?Headshots autographed and dedicated to you or that special someone?New 45" Vinyl?New 45"  Vinyl for VIP donor including an autographed suitcase record player?Two Tickets to any show on the tour?Personal outgoing Voice Message by Rebekah Del Rio (could include a little jingle)?Cameo for you and a friend? I will even serenade the lovely couple during their nuptials too. Now that's gotta be worth something! oh the Goodies are endless.... story:
Overview

Nocturne is the debut studio-recording project of Awaz Trio, an ensemble led by saxophonist and composer Aakash Mittal along with Miles Okazaki (guitar), and Rajna Swaminathan (mridangam). This recording exemplifies the trio's mission to foster an inclusive cultural imagination through musical performance, cultural hybridity and community engagement. It is only with your support that we can bring this project to life.

Nocturne is a series of pieces that deconstruct five Hindustani evening and night ragas. The music paints a unique picture of the night, evoking the meditation of a world at rest, night terrors conjured by the imagination, and the slow cadence of blue light melting into darkness.

This recording is the culmination of six years of development, with performances across the Northeast, New York, Denver, and Kolkata, India, and will help Awaz Trio's unique music reach an ever broader audience. Additionally, the project will provide critical documentation for the ensemble’s music, aiding in the creation of future performances, educational workshops, residencies, and community outreach.

Every contribution to this project will have a lasting impact, not just enabling us to cover the expenses of the recording, but also igniting momentum for present and future creativity. Please support Nocturne and help the Awaz Trio build community around music.

Awaz Trio at Lincoln Center Atrium. Photo credit Satchyn Mital

About Nocturne 

I composed Nocturne while living in Kolkata, India as part of an American Institute of Indian Studies Performing Arts Fellowship from 2013-2014. This project weaves my experiences of studying evening and night ragas with Prattyush Banerjee with the vibrancy of nighttime festivals, marketplaces, and rituals I experienced in Kolkata. In this work I wanted to explore the intersection of my experiences with jazz and raga music as well as my experiences of physical and sonic density that occur at night in Indian cities. The term Nocturne was made famous by European composers Frédéric Chopin and John Field. These pieces often depict a calm pastoral approach to night music with a voice like melody and accompanying arpeggiated chords. Through this project I seek to disrupt this traditional European view of the Nocturne by drawing on Hindustani time theory and jazz improvisation to offer a different perspective. The night can also be a place of vibrancy, action, and dissonance. My hope is that this music will bring awareness to our own hybrid nature and offer a unique perspective on the concept of the nocturne. 

-Aakash Mittal

 

About Awaz Trio

The Awaz Trio sculpts sonic landscapes, pointalistic textures, and angular melodies from Indian and American improvised music. The trio has performed at such notable venues as The David Rubenstein Atrium at Lincoln Center  (New York City), the Shastra Festival at Le Poisson Rouge (New York City), National Sawdust (Brooklyn), Dazzle Jazz Club (Denver, Colorado), The American Center in Kolkata, India and The Walden School Concert series in Dublin, New Hampshire. In 2014, the trio conducted a residency in Northern Colorado that involved workshops in public schools and state universities. The trio’s artistic mission is to create and present new work that explores the concept of Awaz, a Hindi-Urdu word that changes meaning between sound, noise, and voice depending on the context. Through adventurous programming and community engagement, Awaz Trio advances a unique perspective on cultural hybridity that supports cultural diversity and a universal creative spirit. Awaz Trio comprises Aakash Mittal (saxophone), Miles Okazaki (guitar), and Rajna Swaminathan (mridangam).  

Photo credit Satychn Mital

Building Community

In gratitude for your support, I am excited to offer insight into the album’s creation process and unique opportunities to gather with the artists and other supporters over homemade food and drink. In addition to receiving a copy of the album, you can examine the scores used by the ensemble and listen to alternate tracks that will be exclusive for Indiegogo supporters. I am particularly excited to open up my home in Brooklyn, New York and share my passion for cooking, mixology, pie-making, and hosting for supporters at the highest levels. Consider combining donations with your friends for the $500 level and join me for a special evening of food and drink. At the highest level I will give a private performance of solo music in your home. 

$1 Thank you email Receive a personalized email thanking you for your contribution and have your name included in an alphabetical list of supporters on the Bandcamp album page. 

$10 Digital Download of album. Receive a code by email where you can download and listen to the album on the Bandcamp website. 

$20 Copy of CD mailed to you. Receive a physical copy of the album as a compact disc. Orders outside of the US may require an extra fee for shipping.  

$40 Double Album: Experience the recording process of Nocturne. In addition to the original album receive selected alternate takes of the music that were not chosen for the album. The trio recorded a number of versions of the music each with their own beautiful interpretations and improvisations. I will curate a series of alternate takes that offer a look into the evolution of the composition. You will receive a link where you can download the tracks directly to your computer. These tracks are exclusive to this fundraising campaign. 

$50 Musical Scores. Receive a PDF copy of the scores Awaz Trio uses to play the music from the album. Follow along with the recording or play the music with your own band. 

$100 Invitation for you and a friend to a “pie and cocktails” party at my home in Brooklyn, NY. I am passionate about making food, mixing drinks, gathering people, and building community around music. For a donation of $100, you will receive an invitation to a party at my home in Brooklyn, NY. I will make several homemade pies and mix cocktails for everyone to enjoy. (Some of my favorite recipes include a pear, fig, apple pie with a hazelnut crumb topping and bourbon milk punch, which is a mix of vanilla, cinnamon, chocolate, bourbon, and milk shaken with ice.) This will be a chance for you to meet other supporters, listen to music, ask me questions about the project, and enjoy sugar in many forms. Consider splitting the cost with a friend you would like to bring or bring someone as your guest. The party will take place on a Friday or Saturday evening in Spring/Summer 2020. 

Homemade pumpkin pie from scratch!

The "Canadian Cocktail" garnished with blueberries

$200 VIP Tickets to the Lincoln Center Atrium (only one set of 2 tix available) Receive two VIP “tickets” and two drinks for a Thursday night show at the David Rubenstein Atrium at Lincoln Center. You and a friend will be put on the Lincoln Center’s VIP guest list. Skip the line and enjoy an evening of incredible music from an elevated VIP seat in the rear of the Lincoln Center Atrium. Concerts start at 7pm. Once you notify me about which Thursday night you would like to attend, I will contact the Lincoln Center and reserve the seats. Show availability is subject to the Lincoln Center’s schedule so request seats at least one week in advance. The Awaz Trio’s performance at the Lincoln Center Atrium in 2018 was the catalyst for the studio recording that you are generously supporting.

$500 Private dinner for you and up to three guests at my home in Brooklyn, NY. I love to host and feed people. Bring up to three guests to my home in Brooklyn, NY for a private dinner where we can hang out, discuss music, and enjoy some homemade food. Some of my specialties include butter chicken with puris, sautéed chicken thighs with a wine reduction sauce, and vegan coconut curry soup. We will schedule this dinner for a mutually agreed upon time in 2020. Dinner will include 2-3 dishes, drinks, and dessert. The meal will be a surprise menu that will take into account any dietary preferences or restrictions requested. (Expires January 1st 2021)

Spiced fish, cinnamon-coconut mashed sweet potatoes, and roasted beet & banana salad

$1000 House Concert. I will play a short set of solo music for you and your guests at your home. There will also be an opportunity for you and your guests to ask questions about the album and solo music. (For performances outside of New York City you may need to cover travel and accommodation expenses.) 

 

Budget 

Artist Fees $1,500 

Recording Studio $1,250 

Mixing $1,500 

Mastering $1,000 

Artwork and Design $1,000 

CD Duplication $825 

Digital Distribution $50 

Publicist $3,000 

Total: $10,125 

If we exceed our goal extra funds will go toward publicist fees and future recording projects. If we don't meet our goal I will prioritize paying the artists, mixing and mastering costs and printing CDs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family on your preferred social media platform using the “share” tools on this website. Consider staying in touch by joining my email newsletter at aakashmittal.com where I will share upcoming events, stories, and music. If you are very excited about supporting this project, feel free to send me a direct message or email and we can discuss ways for you to help spread the word. 

Thank you for your time and generous support!

Aakash-

About Aakash Mittal

Hailed as “A fiery alto saxophonist and prolific composer” by the Star Tribune (Minneapolis), Aakash Mittal is sculpting a dynamic voice that mines the intersection of improvisation, composition, sonified movement, and noise. The colorful dissonances, meditative silences, and angular rhythms that emerge invite the listener to enter a sonic landscape. Mittal’s work explores universal designs while being rooted in both South Asian and American musical traditions. 

As a composer, Aakash Mittal has written extensively for a variety of ensembles and mediums composing over one hundred new works. His recent commissions include, Samay Raga for Wind Ensemble for Lawrence University and a consortium of eleven international wind symphonies, the found sound piece Ghosts (2017) for BOMB Magazine, a work for solo percussion titled Meditation, Motion, and Melody for Indian-American percussionist David Abraham (2017). The Playground Ensemble has commissioned a number of works including Urban Raga (2011), Transitions (2011), and Questions of Identity (2012). In 2009 Mittal wrote Octet on Raga Yaman for the Ethos West Chamber Orchestra. In 2012 Mittal wrote Meditation for Pictures on Silence saxophone and harp duo. American University Creative Ensemble commissioned the work Pooja, in 2013. As a leader, Mittal has self-released four recordings, Possible Beginnings, Videsh, Thumbs Up EP, and Ocean to rave reviews. 

Aakash Mittal performs with such notable ensembles as the Milford Graves Trio, Du Yun’s Ok Miss, Amir Elsaffar’s Rivers of Sound, and the Brooklyn Raga Massive. As a leader, Mittal performs nationally at such venues as Lincoln Center (New York City), The Dakota (Minneapolis), The Cultural Center of Chicago, The American Jazz Museum (Kansas City) and Dazzle Jazz Club (Denver). Internationally, Aakash Mittal led a quartet at the Congo Square Jazz Festival in Kolkata, India. As a sideman, Mittal has performed in Kolkata with world renowned percussionist Pandit Tanmoy Bose’s Taal Tantra, and with the creative music ensemble Kendraka. In 2012 Mittal toured Mexico with Ravish Momin’s Trio Tarana. Other collaborations include poet Bhanu Kapil, Yells at Eels with Dennis Gonzalez, and Joining Hands with bharatnatyam dancer Anjal Chande. 

Music education is a core element of Mittal’s creative activities. He began teaching private students at home and clarinet classes at Lucille Erwin Middle School in Loveland, Colorado at the age of sixteen. He has maintained a private studio since 2002. After moving to New York City Mittal taught music classes at the Salvation Army in Harlem. Aakash Mittal is currently on the music faculty for Special Music High School, The Lucy Moses School, and The Brooklyn Waldorf School. As a conductor Mittal leads three ensembles for Face the Music. Face the Music is a NYC youth organization where students play the music of living composers. Mittal has conducted workshops at a number of universities including Concordia College Ann Arbor, University of Denver, University of Colorado at Boulder, and Lawrence University.

As a writer Mittal has published essays, interviews and performance reviews in NewMusicBox, BOMB Magazine, and New York Music Daily. Writing is an integral part of his compositional practice. Mittal shares personal essays through his website and email newsletters. 

Aakash Mittal’s awards and honors include the Chamber Music America/ASCAP Award for Adventurous Programming of Contemporary Music (2012), the Herb Albert/ASCAP Young Jazz Composers Award (2013) and the American Institute of Indian Studies Creative and Performing Arts Fellowship (2013). Aakash Mittal has received a Bachelor of Music from the University of Colorado at Boulder (2007) and has been a participant of the “Workshop for Jazz and Creative Music” and “(R)evolution: Resonant Bodies” at the Banff Center in Alberta, Canada. Mittal has been studying Hindustani raga music with Prattyush Banerjee and Tanmoy Bose since 2009 and with Samarth Nagakar since 2016. Aakash Mittal currently studies music and creativity with the legendary drummer/healer Milford Graves.

Acknowledgements

Nothing is created alone, not even the writeup and video for this Indiegogo campaign. Thank you to all my friends and family who watched videos, mastered sound tracks, offered perspectives and edited misspellings for this fundraiser. Thank you Meera Dugal, David Bloom, Rajna Swaminathan, Miles Okazaki, Josh Moore, Meera Mittal, and Trevor New. If I forgot to include your name please let me know so I can add you to this list! 

To my wife Jayanthi, thank you for being a collaborator in every step of every project. I love you!

Thank you to all my friends and family who watched videos, mastered sound tracks, offered perspectives and edited misspellings for this fundraiser. Thank you Meera Dugal, David Bloom, Rajna Swaminathan, Miles Okazaki, Josh Moore, Meera Mittal, and Trevor New. If I forgot to include your name please let me know so I can add you to this list! To my wife Jayanthi, thank you for being a collaborator in every step of every project. I love you!

story:
ABOUT US

Hello! We are musicians and artists from Belarus, Ukraine and the Appalachian region of the USA. 

We represent our project Slavalachia that brings culture together through folk music. 

SLAVALACHIA is a collaboration of folk musicians from Belarus, Ukraine, and the Appalachian region of the USA whose mission is to create revolutionary new pathways for cultural alliance and exchange. Despite the pandemic, travel restrictions, a revolution in Belarus, and other obstacles, SLAVALACHIA is at last coming together again for the first time since January 2020 to record an album in Ukraine this August!

During the last year we have been working together online and even created a music video in  support of the fight against authoritarian regimes in Belarus and the world over. 

You can check it out HERE

As an independent project we have decided to invite people like you to contribute and help us create a really unique album at the crossroads of Slavic and Appalachian cultures. 

Yes!Magazine and Expatalachians.com, Belsat TV made interviews with us! 

Check them out: 

  • 100daysinAppalachia | Yes! Magazine "Slavalachia: The New Music Tradition Uniting Across an Ocean, a Pandemic and a Revolution"
  • BELSAT.TV | Амерыканска-беларускі гурт «Славалача» запісаў крутую песню ў падтрымку Беларусі – па-беларуску, ангельску ды украінску адначасова
  • Expatalachians "From Ohio to Belarus with Love"

ABOUT AN ALBUM

This first full-length Slavalachia album will be built around traditional tunes from Belarus, Ukraine, and the Appalachian region of the USA. All musicians will contribute their creativity and culture to the chosen tunes.

HOW FUNDS WILL BE USED

We are raising funds (4000 USD) to be able to cover studio recording, mixing and album printing.  Musicians contribute their own funds towards all the traveling expenses to Ukraine.  

WHAT WILL YOU GET

Check out our perks that connected not only to the musicians, but to our traditional cultures as well. There are online traditional vocal workshops, CDs, postcards, tickets and many more!

The Impact

As we told, our album built around traditional tunes from Belarus, Ukraine, and the Appalachian region of the USA. Moreover, we will make experimental renditions and mixture of our cultures. AND! Some of the songs were found by Slavalachians in real ethnic expeditions.

LET'S KEEP YOUR TRADITIONS ALIVE! 

Meet the CREW

  • Brother Hill is an Ohio-based singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, and recording artist. He is bandleader of Appalachian folk ensemble Hill Spirits and singer/frontman of post rock quartet NNTNTHRTN. 
  • Benya Stewart, a carpenter from the Appalachian Foothills, is rarely seen these days without guitar, drum or mandolin. He is a folk musician and songwriter inspired by a wide spectrum of genre and tradition.
  • Marichka Chichkova is a Ukrainian traditional singer, leader of a band Torban and a cultural manager. 
  • Siarhei Douhushau, belarusian singer, multi-instrumentalist, folklorist, researcher, founder of Tradycyja initiative, leader of multiple folk projects and collectives. 
  • Arthur’s Temchenko main instruments are drums and percussion. But he can also play any other musical instrument. Works in theatre as a light-artist. 
  • Sviat Halas, bass player, composer, cultural manager. He has experience in many music projects and different music genres such as jazz, folk and improv.
  • Marta Bodnar is a Ukrainian traditional singer and participant of multiple folk bands. Also she is a professional classical pianist and organist. 
 

The Slavalachia Project is organized and produced with the support of CreateCulture, a non-profit organization based in Ohio, and Local Cultural Support, a non-profit organization based in Lviv, Ukraine.

Production/Producers Team: 

  • Nadzeya Ilkevich, producer, cultural manager. 
  • Quintin Schomaker, filmmaker, producer.
  • Bart Kuraga, filmmaker, producer. 
  • Marichka Chichkova, producer, cultural manager. 
 

MORE ABOUT US HERE: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yHB1ZKG6EaA&amp... 

Our music video:  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=krLfZEjO2yk 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sign up to our Facebook

Follow us on Instagram 

SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS!

story:
Hello, people of this universe! 

My name is Kabeção. I'm from Lisbon, Portugal. I'm a musician, handpan player and a passionate about sound exploring. 
In the last 7 years, I have been traveling around the globe, discovering new countries, cultures, languages, people, and sharing music to new audiences have been one of the most fascinating experiences in my life. 

And here I am today! With a dream of recording a new album, at a professional studio in Israel, with my friend Thomas Ben Tov, who is an amazing sound engineer. I'd like to create the best handpan album I can make!
I decided to call this new album ' F R E E D O M   E X P R E S S I O NS ' 
A gathering of musical stories that came to my fingers, inspired by the emotional waves and feedback from the people who got in touch with my music.  I feel truly amazed to see and feel how people react to sound, and I really think that feeling these emotions is a way of giving Freedom to the Soul. Playing for people made me grow a lot as a musician ,but especially as a human being. Now I feel deeply inspired to record this new project and share it with you guys, all around the world.


My music will never make sense without you "Listeners".
This will only be possible with your help and support! 
Let's make it happen together!  

You guys make my music Come Alive and I'm really excited to share my high quality recorded music with you all. To keep things short, here are some informative bullet points-

  • I'm raising 14,000€ for this release.
  • You can make donations OR get a Perk with a specific contribution amount.
  • If the goal will not be reached within 50 days, the project will be CANCELLED.
  • You will not be charged in case the project will be canceled.
  • The songs will be professionally produced by Thomas Ben Tov.
  • This album could be ready for release on the fourth quarter of 2019 / early 2020.
  • If we surpass 14,000€, there are more amazing things that will happen-

15,000 - We will offer a limited edition Autographed Poster and a Hoodie with the Album's Artwork

16,000 - 3 professional videos from the Studio Sessions of the album

17,000 - We will live stream a concert with compositions from "Freedom Expressions"

18,000 - A Black Andoized Pantam Stand will be raffled between all the supporters of the campaign!

19,000 - Vinyl edition of the new Album! 

20,000 - Special recording session at a secret location in Israel

22,000 - A photographer will join me and make a documentary video about the making of "Freedom Expressions"

24,000 - We will record some incredible guest musicians and release another album with Pantam + amazing guests on various instruments
 





PERKS (REWARDS): What do I get?

The perks (or rewards) of this crowdfunding campaign are divided into separate tiers based on how much you contribute. Because this is a Fixed Funding Indiegogo project, you will NOT be charged unless the final €14.000 goal is achieved. It's all-or-nothing, so don't worry about not getting anything in return.
 

  • €10 perk: Digital Download on the release date
  • €15 perk: Physical CD + Digital Download
  • €20 perk: Autographed Physical CD + Digital Download
  • €25 perk: T-Shirt with "Freedom Expressions" artwork + Digital Download
  • €35 perk: Yishama Pantam Lottery Ticket + engraved with the words "Freedom Expressions" and my signature on it + Digital Download
  • €35 perk: Yishama Pantam Lottery Ticket + engraved with the words "Freedom Expressions" and my signature on it + Digital Download
  • €40 perk: Digital download + 1 Autographed CD + 1 T-Shirt + Hardcase Technologies Discount Coupon 15% (Shipping costs included)
  • €50 perk: "The Pirate" Pack -  Personal/ Skype Handpan Lesson with Kabeção + Digital Download
  • €70 perk: Mastering one track of your handpan recording by Thomas Ben Tov + Digital Download
  • €100 perk: "La Sirena" Pack - Two lessons of 1 hour of Handpan Skype Lesson + T-Shirt + Autographed Signed CD, + Digital Download 
  • €200 perk: "Astronaut" Pack - Four lessons of 1 hour Handpan Skype Lessons + 2 T-Shirts +Autographed Signed CD + Digital Download
  • €300 perk: Living Room concert - Portugal only 
  • €400 perk: 3 days Handpan Workshop in my HOUSE in Portugal
  • €448 perk: 2 Classic Pantam Stands
  • €500 perk: Living Room concert - Europe
  • €750 perk KABEÇÃO Signature Cajonico - Solid Mahogany Cajonico with Laurel Burl Top signed by Kabeção
  • €1,000 perk: Living Room concert and personal workshop for 3 days - Worldwide
  • €1,500 perk: Endless Gratitude! You'll get all the cool stuff + Your name will be on the album :)
  • €1,000,000,000 perk: I will literally become Jesus Christ!


 

BUDGET: Why do I need 14,000€?

Producing a professional music album costs a lot of money, and I couldn't afford it without your help.

Remember that your contributions are NOT donations. Every amount starting at 10€ gets you a perk, so you're essentially pre-ordering an album, merch, workshops or concerts.

Here are the things that I need to pay for in order to make this release happen-

  • Studio Days + Sound Engineers: 4.000€
  • Mixing + Mastering: 3.800€
  • All Artwork Design: 900€
  • CD Printing: 2.500€
  • Online Distribution & Publishing: 500€
  • Rewards Making + Shipping: 1.000€
  • Travel Costs (Flights): 500€
  • Indiegogo & PayPal Fees: 800€



NOTE: ALL of the money raised from this campaign will be invested in making the best album possible!

 

 

SUPPORT: How else can I help?

 If you are unable to contribute, you can still help by spreading the word and telling your friends about the campaign. Here are some things you can do-

  • Tell your friends about Kabeção and this new Album project.
  • Post the campaign video to Facebook, Twitter, and Tumblr.
  • Like the Kabeção page on Facebook.
  • Subscribe to my YouTube channel. Lots of cool stuff over there.
  • Follow me on social media and like/share/retweet.
  • If you have questions about anything that weren't made clear by this page, you can always contact me and I'd love to answer!

story:
The album celebrating 25 years of our music! 

For many years the legendary gypsy brass band Fanfare Ciocarlia’s purpose has been to make great music that inspires people to dance, be free and enjoy life. For almost 25 years, they have released over 12 albums and played countless shows around the world, topping world music charts and international festivals. Through their music they have kept alive a unique centuries-old gypsy culture from their home country of Romania. Sharing it around the world, accumulating a host of in fans,and inspiring new genres within world music, bands, and festivals. Their music has featured in Hollywood films such as Borat, and some of their most prestigious live shows include the Nobel Peace Prize and NPR Tiny Desk. 

To celebrate our 25th anniversary as a band in 2021, we had planned to record, release and tour a special album ‘It Wasn’t Hard to Love You’ (an ode to our fans). However, COVID 19 put a stop to this! We usually fund our albums through income from live shows, but due to the Corona crisis we cannot play live, and because we cannot play live we can not fund the album! 

We wracked our brains, creating ever more elaborate plans to find the money to fund the album. The thought of not being able to make it made us very sad, as  to us this would be our most important release, a celebration of our fans, and possibly our last ...

Then it struck us!!!  Why don't ask all the amazing fans and music lovers across the world to become a part of this milestone album by donating to fund it!

What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of €30,000 to cover all the important and expenses required create and release an album of this magnitude. This includes; 

  • Basic studio hire - €5,000
  • Mixing €4,000
  • Special feature artists - €2,500
  • Studio recording overdubs - €2,500
  • Mastering (CD and Vinyl) - €3,000
  • Financial support for the 12 bandmembers during the 2 month pre-production and recording - €4,500
  • Artwork and CD/ vinyl design - €1,000
  • Promotional photos and videos €2,500
  • Travel expenses (between Bucharest and Berlin studios and rehearsals) - €2,000
  • Creative writing for liner notes - €200
  • Vinyl manufacturing - €1,800
  • CD manufacturing - €1,000

As a funding supporter you will :

  • Have early access to the album  (before anyone else!) 
  • Be rewarded with some amazing perks- from a signed vinyl to a lifetime of free shows and backstage entrance, to a song named after or recorded just for you!
  • As an extra bonus the first 50 supporters will receive a exclusive copy (50 only ever made) unreleased cassette of the first ever Fanfare Ciocarlia recording from 1997. 
  • Most importantly you would have played a very vital role in the birth of our next and most culturally and historically important musical project. A piece of music that will live forever in history, that you helped build! 

The Impact

This is our last chance to make this album. If we do not reach our funding goal we cannot see a way of bringing this album to life. And the music we have prepared will have to go unheard for the rest of history.

We are well practiced at this, having released over 12 albums and played over 3,000 shows worldwide. If you choose to support us in this next musical album endeavour then we can happily guarantee the delivery of one of our greatest albums to date. After its completion we can be proud of working together, to create an album that will then go on to be enjoyed by countless others as the years go on, bringing a little bit moe light and joy to this world! 

Risks & Challenges

Due to to the uncertain nature of the current  COVID 19 global pandemic, we must retain a certain level of flexibility as to the exact date we will be able to record, produce and release the project. We estimate to begin in January 2021, for release summer 2021.However, due to potential extenuating unforeseen circumstances, such as border closures and illness, we cannot guarantee this exact deadline. We will do our absolute best, but we ask for your understanding and patience as we endevour to under these difficult times.

Other Ways You Can Help!

We want everyone to be a part of this album no matter if they can afford to spare some money or not. Anybody who shares this campaign on social media with the hashtag #fanfare25years will be invited to an exclusive early online album listening party.
