story:
About

My name is Lindsay Holifield and I'm a singer-songwriter, visual artist, and poet based in Birmingham, Alabama. 

During my 14 year struggle with an eating disorder, I discovered my voice, which has sustained me even in the darkest of places. From the walls of hospitals and treatment centers, carrying around a ukulele or finding a dusty keyboard hidden in a corner, I found that music was what brought me to life. 

Many of my songs reference mental health struggles, transforming the pain into something beautiful.  A number of the songs also reference the confusing, painful reality of fundamentalist religious systems that taught me (and too many people I know) fear and shame. This is my story, put in lyrics and melodies.

I've been brave for a long time in battling my own demons, but now I'm doing something big and brave again in asking for my community to come alongside me and brings this project to life.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $8,000. This will cover costs of production, studio time, musicians, engineers etc.  We will be recording in Nashville, TN, with Carrie Welling as the producer.

As an incentive, there are five tiers of perks, a few of which utilize my other creative skills - creative writing and visual art. 

The Impact

While these songs come from my own story, I am giving voice to pain that resonates with many people who have also experienced fear-based religion and mental health struggles. I want these songs to go out into the world and be heard by those who need these words the most, and hopefully allow those humans to feel less alone. 

Risks & Challenges

It is always a risk to be incredibly honest and raw with art. It might make some folks uncomfortable and there is a part of me that badly wants every person who exists ever in the world to love my art. But I am also a brave human, and believe in speaking truth to power and being open about the pain that has resulted from abuses and distortions of that power.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people simply can't contribute and that's okay! That doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Spread the word on social media 
  • Share videos of music with your friends

story_txt: Hear Bajinn live at the launch event:

story:
We’re Gramps The Vamp... 

a seven-piece band from Chicago. Our music is a post-apocalyptic dance party with heavy, sinister grooves, cinematic melodies, and freak-jazz experimentation. Since our first show on Halloween 2011, we’ve been lucky enough to play all over the United States, to have our music featured in several films and shows, and to make two albums (the second of which made it into the Chicago Reader’s “Best Chicago Albums of the 2010s” list). 

We’re now ready to release our 3rd full length album: THE DEATHSHIP HAS A NEW CAPTAIN. Composed over the last three years, this 10 song album is heavier, wilder, catchier, groovier, and more immersive than any of our music in the past. In short, it’s more Gramps The Vamp than Gramps The Vamp has ever been before.  

We are SO proud of this music and can’t wait to send it out into the universe, but we need more funds to finish the job. Making an album is expensive and since we are not affiliated with a record label, the funds can only come from ourselves and our supporters. This campaign is to bring our community together to try and make this album a reality. If you like what we do, please consider pledging for a copy of the record or one of the other perks we’re offering. Every little bit helps.

We are truly grateful for all the love you’ve shown us over the years and can’t thank you enough for the support! 

Your friends,

Gramps The Vamp

 

You can check out our previous albums at:

grampsthevamp.com

 

 

What We Need

Here’s a breakdown of the costs of releasing this record:

  • Recording: $2500
  • Mixing: $1000
  • Mastering: $700
  • Vinyl Pressing: $1500
  • Record Jackets: $600
  • Album Art: $500
    •     Total: $6800

Since we’ve already invested some of our own money into recording, we lowered our goal for this campaign to $6000. If we surpass our goal, we’ll put that money toward a publicity campaign to help get the word out about our music.

 

What You Get...

The number one thing we hope you get from this campaign?… a copy of the record! However, if you’re interested in something different we’ve got you covered at all these different levels. Please note: all perks $15 and above get the new album in either digital format, vinyl format, or both. 

$1 - Thanks from the band for joining our campaign!

Even if you don't have a lot of cash to spend, you can make a difference in our campaign by putting your name on our list of supporters. Every donation, no matter how small, adds to our momentum and reach. 

$10 - Two signed 11x17 posters

Isla Muerta Poster:

Wolfman Poster:

(Please note this poster also contains an Emporium logo at the top put on it by the venue. It looks good on the poster though!)

$15- Digital Download

Get our new album, "The Deathship Has A New Captain" in lossless audio format. 

$25 - Vinyl Record

If we had one perk we recommend above all others, this is the one. Get our new album "The Deathship Has A New Captain" as it was meant to be heard: on vinyl. Please be advised that to be a little easier on the environment, we are NOT shrink-wrapping the records in plastic. A positive side effect is that we can sign the cover for you.  :) ​Includes a digital download as well.  

$30 - Halloween 2016 Poster (SOLD OUT)

This 11x17 poster, by Nate Girard of the band North By North, was made for our last record release in 2016 and is one of our favorites. We only have two copies left so get at them! Includes a digital download of our new album "The Deathship Has A New Captain".

 

$40 - Shirt + Digital Download

$50 - Shirt + Vinyl

With either of these perks you get a choice of one of these shirts in sizes S, M, L, or XL. Plus the album of course!

Gramps The Vamp TEEth-Shirt

 

Gramps The Vamp - Red Text Shirt

Gramps The Vamp - BATS! Shirt

$65 - Vinyl GTV discography (All 3 Gramps records!)

Includes copies of all three limited Gramps The Vamp vinyl presses:

Gramps The Vamp (self titled LP) - 2014 - The record that started the "doom funk" journey, featuring fan favorites "Boomzap!", "Things That Go Bump" and "Isla Muerta".  Also this record is full of horror and science fiction samples from mid 20th century America.

The Cave of 10,000 Eyes - 2016 - Listed in the Chicago Reader as one of the "Best Chicago Albums of the 2010s", this 10 song album is written as a faux-soundtrack to a B horror-thriller from the 70s.

The Deathship Has A New Captain - 2020 - Our forthcoming record! 

$70 - Peter's Curated Library

Our trumpet player, Peter, has an extensive library of books. With this perk Peter will curate and give you a selection (ca. 3000 pp) of nonfiction/literature from his personal library based around your interests. Also includes the album on vinyl or digital.

 

$70 - Kundalini & Tarot w/Stevenson

Our drummer Stevenson is a trained Kundalini yoga instructor and knowledgable tarot reader. In support of the album, he's offering a private yoga class and tarot session to 5 supporters. Dedicate some time to introspection and self care while supporting our music! This perk also comes with the album on vinyl or digital. 

$75 - Music Lesson

Learn from Gramps The Vamp! Pick any band member to give you a 1 hour individual lesson. If you don't live close to Chicago, we can do a video chat. Includes the album on vinyl or digital.

  • Maxx McGathey: Keys and Composition
  • Kevin Holt: Bass 
  • Mike Novak: Guitar 
  • Stevenson Valentor: Drums
  • Justin Howe: Tenor Sax 
  • Nick Bush: Alto Sax 
  • Peter Gillette: Trumpet 

$80 - Monster Movies with Maxx

Our keyboardist Maxx loves monster movies. With this perk Maxx will set up a projector outside on a warm summer night, make some popcorn, and screen a classic monster movie for you and your friends. 

$90 - Attend Our Listening Party & Jam

It's always a special experience getting to hear your music in vinyl form for the first time. We want to share that experience with you. When we get our records back from the manufacturer, we'll get the band together in Chicago to take a full listen and toast our milestone with some drinks and food. Any person that donates $90 or above is invited to join us for this celebration of the new music! You'll be one of the first people to hear it. A jam is sure to break out, so bring your instruments. Includes a shirt and the album on vinyl or digital.

$100 - Test Pressing

Own a part of the record making process! Test pressings are the records that the manufacturing plant sends us to make sure they got everything right before they press the full run. These are super limited- only 5 will be made. This perk also includes a regular copy of the record so you don't miss out on all the awesome album art. 

$150 - Complete Merch Package

All 3 of our vinyl records, 3 shirts, 2 posters, and a Gramps The Vamp sticker! 

$250 - Your Personal Theme Song

Gramps The Vamp will write and record a 20-30 second original theme song just for you (or as a gift for a friend). Make it your ringtone. Have people play it when you walk into a room. Includes a shirt and the album on vinyl or digital.

$300 - Test Pressing Discography

You get test pressings from ALL THREE of our vinyl records. Only 3 exist from each of our earlier records (and we're keeping one for ourselves). Also you get a regular copy of the new album on vinyl. 

$400 - Request a Cover

Request any song for Gramps The Vamp to cover. We'll either perform it at a live show with you there, or we'll make it into a little video. Supporters in the past have used this as a gift for loved ones, though it would also make a fine prank... (rickroll anyone?). Includes a shirt and the album on vinyl or digital.

$666 - Your Secret Message on the Vinyl

During the record making process, artists can choose a short "secret message" to be etched onto the mold that makes the discs, thereby transferring the message to every single copy. We usually use this spot for an inside joke (see our first two records), but this time you get to choose the message! A dedication to a loved one? A great one liner? you choose! (We will want to approve whatever goes on there, but as long as it isn't vulgar, mean-spirited, or political, we're cool with it). Includes a shirt and the album on vinyl or digital. 

$750 Book Gramps The Vamp for Your Event 

Book Gramps The Vamp for your event! We'll show up with all the necessary equipment and play 90 minutes. Only available for locations within a 2 hour drive of Chicago. If you want to hire us outside of the Chicago area, shoot us an email and we can work something out: grampsthevamp@gmail.com Includes a shirt and the album on vinyl or digital.

 

The Impact

By funding this campaign, you will undoubtedly have a big impact on our career:

You make releasing a record possible! As an independent band, we get $0 from record labels to help us offset the costs of releasing an album. Frankly, if we didn’t crowd fund our record releases, they just wouldn’t happen. By getting your copy of the album here, you’re allowing this music to be published! 

You make touring possible! We can’t stress enough how important selling vinyl is to our bottom line when on tour. Selling vinyl turns music sales directly into gas and food money on the road, without which we could not make touring work. By funding this album you’re helping us spread the word about our music!

You make earning a living as a musician possible! In order to save up enough money to pay for vinyl record manufacturing ourselves, we’d have to take a big pay cut at our shows for probably several years. Having the album funded by our fans allows us to collect our full cut from the gigs we play, which in turn helps us pay the bills as professional musicians.

 

Risks & Challenges

This is not our first time releasing an LP on vinyl. We know what to expect in this process and are confident we can get a great album out to you. The biggest risk to the project would be delays during the manufacturing process. Sadly, this is a more likely possibility this time due to a devastating fire that recently destroyed Apollo Masters, one of the main plants that supplies the industry with lacquers (an important part used to make vinyl records). As a result, there are expected to be delays in the vinyl manufacturing process. We’re not exactly sure how this will effect our project, but we will be sure to keep you updated on the expected release date. Currently, we think a safe estimate for the release date is August, 2020. 

There's a smaller risk that one of our three shirt designs might not generate enough interest to be profitable for us to make. If that is the case, we'll reach out with the options of a different shirt or a refund. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that sometimes donating your hard earned cash is not an option. If you can’t donate but you still want to help out, please give the campaign a share on social media. The more that people visit this page, the better chance we have at reaching our goal.

story:
Candy in a Nutshell (so like... honey roasted pistachios?)

Riah here, the self-appointed spokesperson of The Penny Candies. My colleagues and I are on a mission to bring our whimsical-indie-folk-pop-with-a-new-orleans-flair music to life in a very happy-go-lucky Frankenstein kind of way. Why would we want to do that? Because we're creators, it's in our bones to want to make music and share it! And if you're like me, maybe you're tired of only finding our/my music on YouTube (aside from our single, I Do What I Want, of course). Either way.  "It is time!" -Rafiki

And schucks... It's been a long time comin'. For our new fans and followers, that may seem like *fiction* because The Penny Candies are technically a new band which makes us musical babies... but if you rewind roughly 12 years, you'd see the 20-year-old version of myself with a handful of songs and a dream. Rewind 17 years before that and you'd see an ACTUAL musical baby. Singing "You're Cheatin' Heart" into a spoon in my living room. But that was then. And this is now.

And now... this army of ONE has become an army of SIX (I have the best bandmates everrrrrr who breathe life into all of my songs!) and we're ready. We're ready but we need your help!

Ingredients List:  

Over the years I've written over 100 songs and we've narrowed it down to roughly 30 that we're really into as a band. And if with your contributions we get the opportunity to professionally record 10 of those, then hecks! Hecks yeah that would be a dream come true! The ugly truth is that it is not a cheap process, making an album. The beautiful truth is that we have a really amazing team on our side, ready and able to make some musical magic once they get the call. From producers to studio musicians to artists of every kind, I've never felt more confident in our ability to create dazzling, professional-grade songs that kind of punch you in the face. In a good way. 

  • So what do we need? 

We're asking for $10,000 to produce our debut full-length album. So... We need $1. Ten thousand times.

  • Where does all that money go?

Between paying for studio time and bringing musicians in... collaborating with producers and then sending the songs off for their final varnish (the mixing and mastering process) it boils down to roughly $1000-$1200 per song, conservatively. So if we're real smart about it, which we will be, then that number paints a very realistic picture. We've been preparing for this our whole lives and we don't wanna blow it if you know what I mean? And we want to make sure your pennies are being used in the most effective way.

  • What if we don't reach our goal?

Well, we'll still head into the studio and produce as many legit songs as we possibly can with whatever funds we DO raise!

  • What if it exceeds expectations?

We do have some "stretch goals" for such an occasion, with MORE and NEW and EXCITING perks for our donors... and of course... we would just record more songs, and have an even longer/better album than originally planned and that does not sound half bad, my friends. 

Calories:

So. What do you get out of it? Well, you'll get some hel-la sweet and tasty songs, for one thing. Like, really fun and unique jams that add color and flavor to the world. Some of it pulls your heart strings and makes you feel like a Lost Boy in Neverland. Some of it speaks peace to your soul. And some of it makes you feel like a kid at a carnival trying to shoot targets that are shaped like clowns... and then possibly get the feeling that said clowns are following you on your walk home. 

Also! Perks. We've got some fun rewards and perks for our FUNders! (And to my BFF in Australia, you can be our Funder Down Under!) From vintage-inspired shirts and stickers to original art to house shows and beyond... we've got some tricks up our sleeves and we're super excited about them! We're excited about the whole dang thing! We'd love it if you joined The Penny Candies family for a really fun adventure!

Miscellaneous:

Thanks for taking a gander. If you can't personally contribute... don't sweat it! You can still help! Just share our campaign with your friends and family and co-workers and dog groomers and help us get the word out!

And that's all there is to it.

Love, 

Riah, Dallin, Shannalee, Jake, Callie and Dylan

Either way.  "It is time!" -Rafiki
And schucks... It's been a long time comin'. For our new fans and followers, that may seem like *fiction* because The Penny Candies are technically a new band which makes us musical babies... but if you rewind roughly 12 years, you'd see the 20-year-old version of myself with a handful of songs and a dream. Rewind 17 years before that and you'd see an ACTUAL musical baby. Singing "You're Cheatin' Heart" into a spoon in my living room. But that was then. And this is now.
And now... this army of ONE has become an army of SIX (I have the best bandmates everrrrrr who breathe life into all of my songs!) and we're ready. We're ready but we need your help!
Ingredients List:  
Over the years I've written over 100 songs and we've narrowed it down to roughly 30 that we're really into as a band. And if with your contributions we get the opportunity to professionally record 10 of those, then hecks! Hecks yeah that would be a dream come true! The ugly truth is that it is not a cheap process, making an album. The beautiful truth is that we have a really amazing team on our side, ready and able to make some musical magic once they get the call. From producers to studio musicians to artists of every kind, I've never felt more confident in our ability to create dazzling, professional-grade songs that kind of punch you in the face. In a good way. 
So what do we need? 
We're asking for $10,000 to produce our debut full-length album. So... We need $1. Ten thousand times.
Where does all that money go?
Between paying for studio time and bringing musicians in... collaborating with producers and then sending the songs off for their final varnish (the mixing and mastering process) it boils down to roughly $1000-$1200 per song, conservatively. So if we're real smart about it, which we will be, then that number paints a very realistic picture. We've been preparing for this our whole lives and we don't wanna blow it if you know what I mean? And we want to make sure your pennies are being used in the most effective way.
What if we don't reach our goal?
Well, we'll still head into the studio and produce as many legit songs as we possibly can with whatever funds we DO raise!
What if it exceeds expectations?
We do have some "stretch goals" for such an occasion, with MORE and NEW and EXCITING perks for our donors... and of course... we would just record more songs, and have an even longer/better album than originally planned and that does not sound half bad, my friends. 
Calories:
So. What do you get out of it? Well, you'll get some hel-la sweet and tasty songs, for one thing. Like, really fun and unique jams that add color and flavor to the world. Some of it pulls your heart strings and makes you feel like a Lost Boy in Neverland. Some of it speaks peace to your soul. And some of it makes you feel like a kid at a carnival trying to shoot targets that are shaped like clowns... and then possibly get the feeling that said clowns are following you on your walk home. 
Also! Perks. We've got some fun rewards and perks for our FUNders! (And to my BFF in Australia, you can be our Funder Down Under!) From vintage-inspired shirts and stickers to original art to house shows and beyond... we've got some tricks up our sleeves and we're super excited about them! We're excited about the whole dang thing! We'd love it if you joined The Penny Candies family for a really fun adventure!
Miscellaneous:
Thanks for taking a gander. If you can't personally contribute... don't sweat it! You can still help! Just share our campaign with your friends and family and co-workers and dog groomers and help us get the word out!
And that's all there is to it.
Love, 
Riah, Dallin, Shannalee, Jake, Callie and Dylan

story:
The Campaign to Fund "Any Kind of Angel"

 Hi! I'm a singer-songwriter and guitarist from New England who has lived in Austin, TX since 2003. I have been writing songs since I was in high school. My first CD, "Colored in Poetry, " was released in 1998 and received a Boston Music Award Nomination. Since then I released two other recordings: "Bet on the Wind" (2001) which features Mary Chapin Carpenter guitarists Duke Levine and Kevin Barry, and "Next To You" (2008), which features Ruthie Foster, Scrappy Jud Newcomb, Warren Hood, and Rock n' Roll Hall of Fame Inductee Ian McLagan.

The next CD is going to be called "Any Kind of Angel" after a song I wrote about desperate farmers needing any kind of help they could get. I didn't know it at the time, but I needed that kind of help too.

I'm Going to Tell You the Whole Truth

I don't know how to tell you why I need help without making this personal.

I began this recording project in 2012, and currently it is about 70% finished. The whole thing was put on hold in 2013 because everything in life was put on hold when my wife, singer-songwriter Kerry Polk, began experiencing late symptoms of Progressive Supranuclear Palsy. We began seeing early signs of the disease in 2008 but they were largely invisible. We kept it to ourselves. But the symptoms just kept getting worse and eventually we had to be public about what was happening. I became her caretaker until she passed away in late 2017.

What I Have Learned

Love Wins: Thanks to the U.S. Supreme Court Kerry and I were married. And she left this world knowing she was loved by many, especially me.

Despite What Happened, Kerry and I Are Actually Very Lucky: We endured the whole experience rich in love and friendships that still give me courage today.

Since Kerry's passing I have been trying to fund the recording myself and have gotten pretty far. But there are a few more songs and instrument parts to record, and after that there are production and publicity costs such as mixing and mastering the recording and streaming (Spotify) promotion.

Finishing this project is the best way I know to anchor a new life. I want to keep playing.

I began this project funding it myself and could continue to do so. But it will be at least another year to get it done, and that will mean a 12 year gap between recordings. With your help it will be released sooner and it will be a better recording.

 

Here's What I'm Going to Do When "Any Kind of Angel" is Finished

Release downloads: Wanna single? I'm planning on releasing downloadable singles as they are completed. No more waiting for a whole CD. When 10-12 singles are done, I'll release a collection of them.

Gig more: New recordings give venues new reasons to book me for shows. Yay!

Travel more: Spotify and traditional radio promotion may garner enough attention for me to book shows in other cities, including places in New England where my family is. I also plan to attend Folk Alliance next year to reconnect with industry professionals and book more shows.

Write more: My life slogan is "Work hard. Be nice. Keep moving."  Physics says a body in motion stays in motion. An active writer writes more. Playing more means writing more.

 

What I Need...

Here is a breakdown of what your contribution will help cover:

  • Studio costs, such as recording engineer expenses and musicians like Jaimee Harris, Warren Hood, BettySoo and Scrappy Jud Newcomb!
  • Publicity: I'm going to use social media of course. And I'm going to get advice from professionals about how to get the word out. Why? It's a noisy world.
  • Traditional radio and Spotify promotion: I want to get the songs out there. Why Spotify? Where do you listen to CDs?
  • CD manufacturing costs and shipping expenses to mail them to radio stations
  • If I don't reach the final goal I will scale back the post-recording plans and probably not do traditional radio promotion. The music will get out there via Spotify, social media and word of mouth.

 

What You Get...

  • If you donate $12 you get a physical copy of the "Any Kind of Angel" CD and a download of it
  • Donate $25?  You get a download and a signed copy of the "Any Kind of Angel" CD
  • Donate $75? You get all of my CDs, "Colored in Poetry*, " "Bet on the Wind*," "Next To You*" and "Any Kind of Angel" plus a download of "Any Kind of Angel." (*While supplies last. Some of these are in my garage, There's a lot.)
  • Donate $100? You get all of the above, plus a handwritten lyric sheet for one of my songs

 

You May Have Helped Me Raise Money Before

You guys have a history of helping me help others. And I keep my promises.

  • Crowd funding campaigns in Austin have helped me run Williams Nite: A Kinda Annual Tribute to the Music of Hank and Lucinda Williams that raises money for The SIMS Foundation (Thank you! Stay tuned for Williams Nite 2019). Williams Nite 2018 raised more than $4,000 for The SIMS Foundation!
  • Way back in 1999-2000-ish, I was an associate producer of a grassroots project called  "The Respond CD," a 2-CD set of Boston-based female singer-songwriters including Patty Larkin and Lori McKenna. Proceeds from the sale of the CD went to Respond, a shelter for battered women in the Boston area. We got the attention of Rolling Stone magazine and raised well into 6 figures for programs that assist battered women nationally, There was even "Respond 2" which features Dolly Parton, Ani DiFranco and Sarah McLachlan. Donations from the community got this project going and kept it going.

Risks & Challenges

Life happens. Believe me I know. Here's what could prevent this project from a successful fruition:

  • More acts of God: Don't worry. I don't drive like a Bostonian and my health is good.
  • Traditional radio and Spotify promotion are never guaranteed to bring good results. As much as I am going to try to the get the music out there, whether or not I actually get on playlists is beyond everyone's control. For what it is worth, I am currently on Spotify and have been played on folk stations across the country.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign!
  • Do you like the songs I write? Tell people. If you don't like my music please don't tell anyone.
  • Stay in touch: Email me, come to shows. If there is a house concert or venue in your area that you think I should play please let me know. Keep in mind long-distance trips require a cluster of shows that pay well enough to support the trip, so let's be in touch and develop something.

Thank you for reading this far, and for your support. Together we can keep independent music independent, and keep the artists who produce it in our communities, doing what we love.

Jenny Reynolds

Austin, TX

story:
"THE TALE BEGINS"

Award winning vocalist Stephanie Adlington & Aaron Lessard are thrilled to announce the creation of their debut EP. This Americana duo found it's inception in late 2018 when Stephanie & Aaron traveled to Memphis, TN to perform a songwriter's series. Once receiving a generous reception from listeners, they felt it was time to start a project together. Ever since, the two have been working endlessly for this announcement; compiling a collection of songs that will capture the essence of prohibition, murder, love, and personal stories. 

"So much of our early growth and development has been attributed to the friends and folks who have supported us this last year. The folks who have allowed us an opportunity to perform for them, and those who have given us the chance to perform in their venues in the early stages of our career together. We feel as though this project has always and will always be connected with those who have been with us since the beginning. We now ask for that support and effort to become part of this new Tale."

 

MAKING THE RECORD

We understand the generosity and commitment that goes into a crowdfunding campaign. We would first like to say thank you for reading our story, and we hope our detailed breakdown of our goals helps clarify any questions. Our debut EP will be a collection of 5-7 songs. This is dependent on overall budgeting. There will be one cover song on the record. 

 

OVERALL GOAL: $8,000.00

  • We currently do not have an exact outline of recording costs, but we are assuming the higher end of Nashville standard per song rates (Anywhere between $1,000.00 - $3,000.00). That being said, here is an outline of some typical expenses associated in the recording process:
  • Recording Studio (Space) Rate
  • Engineer/Producer Rate
  • Session Musician's Rate
  • Tracking
  • Mixing/Mastering
  • Album Artwork/Photos/Video
  • Digital/Physical Release 

 

PERKS

Not only will your generous contribution help create the record, but you will be receiving special goodies from us!! I SAID GOODIES NOT BOURBON. 

For specific tiered perks, please review an extensive breakdown on the right side of your computer screen... right over this way! ------------ keep going... ---------->

Perk Rewards Include: 

  • A Very Special Thank you!
  • Digital/Physical Copy of the Record 
  • A Tale of Two | T-Shirt (Women & Men's Cut)
  • A Tale of Two | Flask with Logo
  • Signed Hard Copy of the Record
  • Limited Printed Poster
  • Free tickets to the next closest performance near you.
  • Exclusive Bonus Track 
  • "Free One Song Concert" via Skype
  • House Concert ANYWHERE in North America (travel outside TN must be compensated)
  • For Musicians: Free 30 Minute Vocal/Guitar/Songwriting Lesson 

 

CHALLENGES

Our goal is a large sum of money. We understand the difficulty in hitting this number. We also understand (being broke musicians who have a bourbon problem) donating towards a campaign is not only an emotional investment, but a financial one that may be difficult for some. 

That being said, we do not want to go over the list of difficulties experienced when failing to raise enough funding. Our record will be released one way or another, and we feel that the biggest risk associated is simply asking for your kind contribution and support. 

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We understand the financial sacrifice one makes when supporting a campaign such as this one. If someone is unable to make a financial contribution, we kindly ask to help support us in one of the following ways in order to help us reach our goal: 

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign by copying the URL, and pasting it to all social media available. This will help us reach folks we may not have direct contact with. 
  • Let us know about any opportunities to spread the word. If you know of any direct influencers, or sites/blogs to post on, let us know! 
  • WORD OF MOUTH! Tell your friends and family, especially if they know us! Share our social media and campaign URL. We would love to hear from them! 

 We sincerely thank all of you for helping us get one step closer to making our debut record a reality. Taking the time to view our campaign and support means the world to us. Even if we raise $1,000.00, That is still one step closer. We love each and every one of you! 

- Aaron & Stephanie

- Aaron & Stephanie

story:
Dark. Aggressive. Full of special guest collaborators.

Ghostfeeder's new album is currently in production.

I have been in the process of creating an album that encapsulates, celebrates, and elevates Ghostfeeder's sound while also paying tribute to many of the incredibly talented and generous people that I have been fortunate enough to have worked with and now call friends. I am humbled and amazed by their contributions to this new record, and I can't wait to share what we've been working on. 

Amir Derakh (Julien-K, Orgy, Dead By Sunrise): mixing

Galen Waling (Lords Of Acid, PIG): additional drum performance

Neal Reed (Peter Turns Pirate): guest vocals

Owen Mackinder (The Birthday Massacre, A Primitive Evolution): synths

Brett Carruthers (A Primitive Evolution, The Birthday Massacre): guest vocals

Ryan Shuck (Julien-K, Orgy, Adema): guest vocals

Gen (Genitorturers): guest vocals

Steph Misayo Seki (A Primitive Evolution): cello

Alex Gonzales (By an ion, Julien-K): guest vocals, synths

...more contributors to be announced...

Do you know of someone you think Ghostfeeder should work with? Are you that someone? Feel free to reach out and I'll see if there's an appropriate fit. You're in excellent company!

Instead of holding onto all of these songs until the album is finished, I am going to sporadically release singles throughout the year as they are completed. This way, I will have a continuous flow of new material to share with you as opposed to just one splash. This method will also allow us to continue to direct new fans to this IndieGoGo campaign as well as add perks and potentially more guests as the year goes on.

Once all of the tracks for the album are completed, physical versions of the record will be available on LIMITED CD, LIMITED BLACK NES CARTRIDGE, and, for the first and possibly only time ever, on VERY LIMITED VINYL. 

I don't have all of the music completed yet. I don't have all of my guests announced yet. While I have a significant head start on this, much of the outcome will be determined by you! The more resources I am able to raise with this campaign, the more I will be able to pack into the final product. More guests. More songs. More Ghostfeeder.

NOTE ABOUT THE CORONAVIRUS AND CURRENT EVENTS:

At the time on me writing this (3-17-2020), the world is in a weird, confusing state. I had considered and, honestly, more or less decided to completely cancel this campaign and rethink/re-conceptualize this album in the midst of all of this. However, after polling friends and fans, I was (incredibly) unanimously told that a distraction from the world at large right now would be welcome, and I have been encouraged to continue as planned for the time being. While lives and schedules are being rearranged and disrupted, I still have every intention of bringing this new material to you. I will be paying very close attention to the wants and needs of my friends, fans, and contributors as current events unfold. We're in this one together.

I encourage you all to follow Ghostfeeder on Facebook and Instagram, as the state of the world has also determined that I will be engaging more directly and more frequently with you across social media, live streaming as I build songs, answer questions, or perform.

This album is a tribute to the people that have allowed me to realize incredible things, and have been such an integral part of my life over the last few years. If you're reading this, that means you. Thank you so much.

story:
Who are we?

We are Court & Country, an a cappella vocal ensemble from the greater Chicago area. Our main repertoire is medieval and renaissance choral music. Our group’s name indicates our desire to showcase early music from all stations and styles, from the courts of nobility, to chapels and churches, to public taverns.  Our mission is to bring early music to popular audiences who don’t normally hear it. We’ve also adapted a handful of modern pieces to serve our more eclectic audiences. We offer education in our entertainment, include humor in our presentation, and focus on research to support everything we do.

 

Why do we need your help?

We’ve celebrated our 10th anniversary in 2019. In celebration of this milestone, we recorded songs for our second album, titled “Both Kinds of Musick.” We are working very hard to make our second album even better than our first album (“Journey Through Time”). To do everything to the level we hope for requires more funds than we currently have. In addition, we could not have celebrated more than 10 years as a performing group without the support of our fans and friends—so we want to make you an important part of this celebration too.

 

The songs are already recorded, so the primary work for the album is already complete.  But we need your help for the production costs. With your assistance, we can resolve copyrights for sheet music and lyrics, reward our dear friends who worked for free or low cost, enhance the recordings, commission professional artwork, expand the liner notes, etc.

 

What you can get:

Our reward options include:

  • Public acknowledgements of your gift;
  • Electronic and physical copies of the album--including signed copies;
  • Bundles of this album with our first album; and
  • Various Court & Country logo items.

 

How much we seek: $2,500

 

Where the money goes:

  • Payment for the sound engineer;
  • Donations for the venues where we recorded the music;
  • Mastering the audio files;
  • Licensing costs for any published sheet music;
  • CD production costs;
  • Purchasing the crowdfunding perks;
  • Payment for the videographer;
  • Custom cover art;
  • Enhanced liner notes; and
  • Live recording of the 10th anniversary concert.

 

What we’ve done so far:

  • Held numerous planning meetings;
  • Selected repertoire for the CD;
  • Held three recording sessions;
  • Recorded and mixed 77 different files of 24 possible album tracks;
  • Listened to and evaluated all 77 files;
  • Selected mastering services;
  • Drafted cover art;
  • Wrote, recorded and edited the promotional video; and
  • Ordered samples of rewards for evaluation.

 

Timeline:

Our goal is to have everything for the album ready for production by the end of the year so that the CDs can be manufactured in early 2020 with delivery in February-March 2020. Electronic files will be available a little earlier when the album is mastered and ready for manufacture.

 

Risks and Challenges:

The music is already recorded. We are working on preparing it for mastering. The main risk is unforeseen delays in remixing a couple of the tracks, mastering all the tracks and manufacturing the album, but the timeline should accommodate moderate delays. There may also be delays in delivery of the rewards, but we believe we've chosen a vendor who is reliable vendor both for quality and delivery times, to mitigate that risk. We will keep everyone informed should anything come up to affect the album or the rewards.

 

More information About Us:

If you would like to know more about us, see the following social media and contact sites:

            Website: http://courtandcountry.com

            Email: courtandcountry@gmail.com

            Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CourtAndCountry

            Twitter: @courtandcountry

            Instagram: @courtandcountry

 

Live Performances if You Like What You See:

If you are a new friend, we hope you like what you hear and also seek us out in our 2019 live performances, such as:

 

  • WindyCon Convention on Sunday, November 16  at noon at the Westin in Lombard, IL;
  • RavenStone Castle in Harvard, IL on Saturday, December 14 at 2:00 pm; or
  • 10th Anniversary Concert on Friday, December 20 at Grace Lutheran Church in River Forest, IL.

See our website or Facebook page for more information on all three concerts or contact us via email or social media. 2020 performances are in the planning stages.


Thank You

We are truly grateful for anything you can contribute, no matter the amount. We value the support of our friends and fans very highly and could not have succeeded in our musical journey without you.

Hello!

Hey everyone, I'm Rosi aka Faultress. You're hopefully here because you like my music, you like me or if I'm very lucky indeed, you like my music AND me. For the uninitiated...

 

PAST to PRESENT

  • I'm an electronic singer songwriter and I write about women's issues (no, not periods... okay, one song about periods) and mental health. I've won 5 semi-finalist, special mentions or highly commended awards at the UK Songwriting Contest, featured on BBC6 music several times and been called 'a songwriter with incredible control' by Clash Magazine.

 

PRESENT TO FUTURE

  • I've written and recorded my debut album - Nocturnes - about those half-hours in the night when you can't sleep and you imagine all the monsters under your bed. What are those monsters when we're all grown up?

 

THE TRUTH

  • As you know, it's a tough time for every musician on the planet and, in short, I can't afford to release this music out into the world without your help. 100% of my music income has gone due to not being able to perform, facilitate or teach. As for my songwriting, these songs have been brewing in me for up to 10 years and a lot of time and energy has gone into their making - so you'll be helping me realise something very deeply personal and to release something I'm very proud of.

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need £3000 for all the bits involving with running a campaign... photography, a music video, PR support, vinyl release and overheads for the live gig - GOD I can't wait for the live gig bit!
  • There are so many bespoke perks you could buy, like a cover song of your choice, a live gig in your front room or a private streamed gig. There's also great deals on packages like e.g - whole back catalogue!
  • If we can't make the whole £3k, I'll focus my attention on releasing this in a quieter manner and putting money towards my next release to try and keep working sustainably!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute with money, that's totally okay! Instead, perhaps you can still help me make some noise about the campaign, by sharing on social media, word of mouth and most importantly by joining my mailing list.

Thank you so much, your help really does mean the world,

Rosi xx

story:
Hello there...

Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign in support of my new studio album, "Ozark Symphony"!

I personally invite you to join me on the ground level of this record's creation. Your support (both through the years and now) means so much to me, and I look forward to sharing the heart and soul of this experience with you in the days ahead! 

Read on to learn more about me, this project, and producer Dirk Powell...

 

About Me:

I am a Kansas City-based Folk/Americana musician with a penchant for old instruments (especially the banjo variety) and the kinds of soulful stories and songs that seem to live  inside of them.

I was born into a musical home in Memphis, TN and grew up around an eclectic mix of influences ranging from old-school country, 60s folk, bluegrass, and delta blues to jazz, opera, and classical music. After graduating college, I rambled around for a few years in search of a career before moving to Kansas City, MO and finally embracing my life-long love of music as my profession.

I released my debut album "Even the Sparrow" in May 2019 along with my long-time musical collaborator, Staś Heaney. With the help of our manager Al Berman, Staś and I spent the bulk of 2019 on the road, touring in support of the album, which—to our great surprise and delight—was nominated as a finalist for The International Folk Music Awards "Best Album of 2019"! 

Spending so much of last year on the road, touring from coast to coast, was a beautiful new chapter in my musical journey. Now a new leg of that journey has begun, with production officially underway for the making of my sophomore album, "Ozark Symphony."

 

About Dirk Powell:

In addition to being an acclaimed producer, Dirk Powell is a musician with deep roots in several rural American traditions. He learned banjo and fiddle from his Kentucky grandfather, James Clarence Hay, and has been a part of the thriving Cajun/Creole music community in Louisiana since his early 20s. 

Recognized as a leading expert in Appalachian fiddle and banjo, Powell has won 4 GRAMMYS; appeared on the Today Show & David Letterman; recorded & toured with the likes of Rhiannon Giddens, Eric Clapton, Loretta Lynn, and Joan Baez; and has also contributed to various film scores and soundtracks. Additionally, Dirk's solo records, which often combine a traditional foundation with a wide-ranging commitment to emotion and original expression, have had impact around the globe.

Dirk runs his own studio on the banks of Bayou Teche near Breaux Bridge, Louisiana. His latest recording, “When I Wait For You,” was released to wide-spread acclaim on Compass Records in September 2020. 

 

About this Record:

I have appreciated Dirk's work (both his original work and his work as a producer and recording engineer) for years now. I had the good fortune of crossing paths with him at the Folk Alliance International Conference in New Orleans in January 2020, and a few months later, we approached him about collaborating with us on this record.

In August, Staś, Al, and I met up with Dirk in the heart of the Ozarks for a weekend brainstorming session. Over the course of those few days together, our vision for the record came naturally and beautifully into focus. "Ozark Symphony" was selected as the title track, as it seemed to set the tone for the record as a whole. The songs on this album chart a course from the Ozark Mountains, through my hometown of Memphis, and down into Cajun country and back again. These songs are born of the people, places, and stories that are nearest and dearest to my heart, and which have shaped the contours of my very life and being.

Dirk—with his varied  background in Appalachian, Celtic, and Cajun music traditions—is bringing such vibrance and musical depth to these songs, both as a producer and multi-instrumentalist. My dear friend and long-time duo partner, Staś Heaney, is also a multi-instrumentalist and integral collaborator on this record. Additional members of the studio ensemble include a talented cast of musicians lending percussion, reeds, strings & keys. A veritable Ozark symphony...

At the end of September, we journeyed down to Bayou Teche to record the basic tracks for the album at Dirk's Cypress House Studio. In the weeks and months ahead, we will finish recording and move on to mixing, mastering, and finalizing the album for release in Spring 2021.

The funds raised by this campaign will make it possible for us to make this record the best that it can possibly be. This has truly been a next-level experience for us and a pinnacle moment in our musical journey thus far. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your encouragement, your goodness, and your generous support in helping to bring our creative vision for this album fully to life. 

 

Perks of Supporting:

  • Advance signed copy of the album (CD)
  • Early access to the entire line of merchandise (signed lyric book, screen-printed t-shirt, limited-edition signed poster, special-edition sticker & deluxe postcard)
  • Hand-made needlepoint banjo key fob (every stitch made with love by Kelly, her sisters & her mom)
  • Deluxe postcard pack (designed by Kelly herself! A set of a dozen premium postcards, each one featuring a different tour photo accompanied by original verses)
  • Hand-written song lyrics & sheet music (for a surprise selection of one album song)
  • Access to exclusive, behind-the-scenes content (including in-studio video footage, photos, bonus tracks & insights into the making of the record!)
  • Album credit for sponsorship (the listing of your name in the official album credits as a sponsor of the record)
  • Private concert (both duo & full-band format)
  • Deluxe digital download package (high-res digital downloads of the full-length album, album art & lyric book)

 

Campaign Breakdown:

The making & release of this record will cost an estimated $37,000 inclusive of:

  • Studio time for approx. 7 full days of recording
  • Producer fee (pre-production/production)
  • Engineering (recording, mixing & mastering)
  • Studio musician fees
  • Travel costs, accommodations & incidentals (for the duration of recording and mixing)
  • Publicity (US, UK & Europe)
  • Radio Promotion (US, UK & Europe)

 

Risks & Challenges:

Unforeseen costs and challenges often arise during the course of making and releasing an album. Especially during these COVID times, when gig revenue is severely limited, the usual financial risks of making a high-caliber studio album are greatly exacerbated. With your valued support, we hope to minimize those risks while also ensuring that this album is of the utmost quality and fully reflects our artistic intentions.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We totally understand if you would like to support but are unable to make a financial contribution! There are several other ways to lend support should you so desire:

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign on your social media pages or tell a friend who might be interested in supporting.

  • "Like" and "Follow" us on Facebook & Instagram @kellyhuntmusic!

  • Join our "News from the Nest" mailing list to hear about our latest ventures and upcoming gigs (See email sign-up form at https://www.kellyhuntmusic.com)

 

Please be assured of our heartfelt gratitude for your generous support! You make what we do possible, and we don't take that for granted. 

We look forward to sharing this beautiful experience (and the fruits of our labors) with you in the days ahead!

 

XOXO,

Kelly

story:
INTRODUCTION:

Hello friends,

Welcome to my IndieGoGo. Thank you very much for taking the time out to visit. My name is Owen, and I make music under the alias of "Owsey." I've been writing music for over a decade now, ranging from Ambient & Cinematic, all the way to more contemporary Pop/Singer-songwriter. The overarching theme that ties all of this music together is a kind of atmospheric melancholia, and inspiration taken from my own life experiences and stories is what keeps it going. The vast majority of you already know this, so allow me to explain the purpose of this campaign:

I recently finished and released a new album titled "Atlas and The Cruel World," 5 years on from my 1st album "To The Child Drifting Out At Sea." As happy as I am with the new album, I felt like in retrospect a lot of things were left unsaid, and I want to use this platform to create a brand new and elaborate grand sequel album to Atlas. This new album will be much bolder in its scope, and will tell the ending to the story in a way that is more emotive and impacting.

 

 

WHY HELP OUT?

I'm creating this IndieGoGo campaign so that I can confidently devote all of my time to creating this album. With the almost unbelievable success of my first campaign and a huge 18 track album that followed, I'm confident that this time around things will be even better. Any and all contributions will have an impact by providing me with the opportunity to create an album to the highest quality possible. These contributions will allow me to invest in new instruments and tools to strengthen the overall sound of my music in a very tangible way. Financing equipment has always been a limiting factor as it tends to be very expensive. I'm truly excited for the prospects this could open up, and for the difference it would make to my music. So by supporting this campaign, you'll become a part of what will ultimately be my strongest work so far.

What I Need:

I'm hoping to secure £7000 worth of funding. This will mostly cover manufacturing of physical goods, shipping and processing fees. It will also allow me to comfortably devote the next 3-4 months to actually creating this album without having to rely on freelance and lengthy commission work. As mentioned above, I will also be able to purchase new equipment that will lift my sound up to greater heights by using much more effective tools. You might wonder why I'm not asking for as much funding as the previous IndieGoGo campaign if this album is to be stronger in every way - this is mainly because my skills have improved in that time, and I no longer have to hire the likes of session musicians to perform some of the instrumentation. Because this will all be down to me, I can lower the costs significantly. I can also take care of the artwork and some of the merchandise without outsourcing.

What You Get:

I'm going to be offering quite an extensive range of perks. such as:

- CDs

- Access to Walkthroughs and Project Files

- The opportunity for me to write an exclusive song for you

- The opportunity for me to name a song after you

- Collaborate with me

- Let me Remix your song, or someone else's song

- Artwork Packages

- Handwritten Thank You Notes

- Critical Appraisal

- Stickers

- Digital Copies

- Access to 10 Unreleased Tracks

- Postcards

- & more!

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to contribute that's perfectly fine - any shares or spreading of the campaign would be well and truly appreciated.

To Conclude:

I would be endlessly grateful to anyone who wishes to support this campaign, and will endeavour to make sure that the perks and album you receive in return will be well worth your investment. Making music really is my life - I spend most of my days and nights creating it, and I would love nothing more than to continue doing this, and to grow as an artist and a person along the way, sharing songs consistently with all of you. I truly hope you'll consider joining me on this journey. Thank you very much for stopping by, and if there is anything at all that I can help you with, please message me either here, on social media (links below) or by email: owseymusic@gmail.com

 

A thousand thanks,

Owen

--------

I will rollout Surprises/Content as we hit all of the major goalposts at 25%, 50%, 75% and then at 100%. 

SOCIAL MEDIA:

http://www.instagram.com/owseymusic

http://www.twitter.com/owseymusic

http://www.facebook.com/owsey

http://www.youtube.com/owseymusic

http://owseymusic.com

http://www.owsey.bandcamp.com

http://www.soundcloud.com/owsey

- Handwritten Thank You Notes
- Critical Appraisal
- Stickers
- Digital Copies
- Access to 10 Unreleased Tracks
- Postcards
- & more!
 

Other Ways You Can Help:
If you are unable to contribute that's perfectly fine - any shares or spreading of the campaign would be well and truly appreciated.
To Conclude:
I would be endlessly grateful to anyone who wishes to support this campaign, and will endeavour to make sure that the perks and album you receive in return will be well worth your investment. Making music really is my life - I spend most of my days and nights creating it, and I would love nothing more than to continue doing this, and to grow as an artist and a person along the way, sharing songs consistently with all of you. I truly hope you'll consider joining me on this journey. Thank you very much for stopping by, and if there is anything at all that I can help you with, please message me either here, on social media (links below) or by email: owseymusic@gmail.com
 
A thousand thanks,
Owen--------

I will rollout Surprises/Content as we hit all of the major goalposts at 25%, 50%, 75% and then at 100%. 


SOCIAL MEDIA:
http://www.instagram.com/owseymusic
http://www.twitter.com/owseymusic
http://www.facebook.com/owsey
http://www.youtube.com/owseymusic
http://owseymusic.com
http://www.owsey.bandcamp.com
http://www.soundcloud.com/owsey

story:
ABOUT SABRINA CHAP

Hi! I'm Sabrina Chap, a NY based cabaret artist and songwriter who's hoping to produce my third studio album, 'Make Way for the DJ'. This collection of songs inspired by my time writing for burlesque, circus and cabaret is eight years in the making. From heartbroken ballads to the delightfully perverse, this album will be a testament to the joy of live performance in it's many forms.
 

I've been touring for years, and unfortunately, less and less people buy music. As album sales flounder, I'm turning to my audience, fans and friends - old & new - to support the songs I've sung on cabaret stages from Iceland to LA. 

 

WORDS OF PRAISE FOR MY WORK!

★★★★★ ‘Like a piano player in brothel or a chanteuse at an orgy, Sabrina Chap is the fallen woman of cabaret….’ – Broadway Baby

★★★★★ ‘...intoxicating -  a must see for cabaret fans.’ – Deadline News‘A burlesque Jerry lee Lewis’ – The American Magazine

‘Think Eartha Kitt. Think female Tom Waits. Think nihilistic Cole Porter.’ – Somna Theatre

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am shooting for a funding of $5,000, even though I know I will probably need around $8,000 to truly make this project heard. All of this money would go to hiring musicians, engineers, studio time and paying fellow artists (photographers, designers) to create the final product.


PERKS!

  • Downloads or Physical copies of 'Make Way for the DJ'

  • A print of the final album cover, featuring contortionist, Ekaterina and taken by photographer, Maike Schulz.

  • A small booklet of lyrics from each album, as well as the stories behind the songs.

  • A small booklet detailing my 'Worst & Best Gigs' from 10 years on the road.

  • Piano/Songwriting lessons

  • I will write a song with or for you.

  • Postcard from me on the road.

  • One insane perk is that I am using all of the sales from another unreleased project, 'Postcards from the Rearview Mirror' to fund this studio album. 'Postcards' is an electric guitar based abstract musical telling the tale of two queer teens who leave the violence of their Florida homes for the bright lights of Hollywood. This musical departure has acted as a palate cleanser to my collection of funny, cabaret tinged songs. It is fully orchestrated, with great performances by some incredible musicians, and was engineered in my bedroom by me. It's good, I promise. ;)
     

If I don't reach my entire goal - all the money will still go to funding the album. It is in my heart to get this music out there, and everything I raise will go towards the release of these songs, inspired by cabaret, burlesque, circus and the joy of live entertainment.
 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • By donating, you are supporting an independent solo female artist with a fiercely feminist voice. 

  • You are also supporting a touring musician who has written this album as a testament to the power of live entertainment. 

  • I have carried my piano across the US and the UK to bring these songs to stages, live. Your support  gives me confidence in my work and voice to do that. Your support is why I lift that goddamn piano.
     

Risks & Challenges

The hardest thing about being an independent songwriter these days is that very few people buy albums anymore, making it impossible to fund new work by counting on album sales. For this reason, it took me 8 years to self-produce 'Postcards from the Rearview Mirror'. I really rely on the small number of fans I've cultivated in touring the US & UK for over 8 years in hoping to fund the songs I've written to entertain. 

  • My greatest hope is that this album will be funded by fans, allowing my work to be heard by a greater platform.

  • I am hoping to tour this album and book greater gigs from it, spreading my songs to the weird and wonderful people I feel are my intended audience. Please help me get my music out there so that this can happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please spread the word about this project!

  • Indiegogo has many share tools - please help me get this project seen by those who don't know my work!

story:
THE ALBUM "ALPHA & OMEGA".

Greetings! The music industry is changing and it's been a hard year for all musicians and bands, but hopefully things will change for the better.

Your help means everything! Together many people can make things happen.

Being a small band with your own little lable is very hard and expensive. Even though Gaia Epicus has sold a lot of albums and had almost only great reviews on all albums, it is still hard to manage to make new music and release it on cd.

There has been a demand for this album to be available on cd, and therefore we are trying out this crowd funding campain.

On this campain the prices are set a little high, and there are no fancy gifts like t-shirts, posters, stickers etc... All this costs money! And to include stuff like that the total amount we need would be higher. The lowest cost is also a little high and the reason is so that we need less people to have a successful resault. If we have 60 people buying the lowest reward then we have reached our goal and the cd will be printed. Of course if we also have some Keepers Of Time and Wizards out there we will need less people.

 


Why is the goal 1500 euros?

Printing an album is very expensive, and there are other related costs also.
One of them being shipping wich is very expensive.


Wait... what happens if we don't reach our goal?

Everyone gets a refund.

 

Also check out the campain for the cd's "Dark Secrets" and the

Helloween/Gamma Ray tribute HELLORAY.

 

If you decide to support Gaia Epicus and this project we will be very greatful.

Thank you very much, love and respect!

Official Webpage - Facebook - Youtube - Instagram - Bandcamp

story:
Hi!  I'm Laura Tsaggaris, an independent singer and songwriter based in Washington, DC.  Like many folks, this pandemic year left me starving for connection  --  and for me, that connection often comes through live music.  While I really enjoyed a quiet holiday season with my immediate family in 2020, this year I put my energy towards creating an album and show that would bring people together for the next holiday season (and seasons to come). This project really came into focus when I added the perfect team and wrote my own holiday original song, “Get In The Mood.”  I can’t wait to share it with you!

With this support, you are single-handedly changing the landscape of how people appreciate music.  CDs are dead.  Digital streaming is king, but indie artists make very little from it.  You are placing a value on the art you like and the musicians who make it.  You are supporting not just me, but a  host of other talented musicians who helped make this album and will benefit from playing this music every holiday season.  That is a special thing.  You are special!  Yeah!

So... thank you.  Please make a donation and help us spread the word to your friends and other music lovers.  Let's get in the mood!

And be sure to SAVE THE DATE:  Sunday, November 28, 2021 @ The Hamilton Live in Washington, DC for the release show!

If you would like to make a fully tax-deductible donation, please follow this link:  https://fundraising.fracturedatlas.org/get-in-t....

story:
Hi everybody, I’m Don Merckle. I’m a singer/songwriter based out of Charleston SC and I need your help finishing my new album so I can get it out into the world and HOPEFULLY into your hands.

   I am REALLY excited about this record. I wanted to stretch my legs creatively, get outside of my comfort zone, and work with talented new people that I’ve never worked with before and grow as an artist. I wanted to challenge myself to make something new and different from my previous albums, a record that if you’ve followed my music in the past, you probably wouldn’t expect from me. I’ve never been more excited or proud of anything I’ve made as I am about the songs I’m recording right now, and I can’t wait for you not just to hear them, but to experience them. And I really need your help to get me to the finish line. 

 

 

   But wait there’s more! The creative thread doesn’t end with just the record. It extends to a visual component, which for me, are VIDEOS! So far, I’ve been able to make 3 videos for singles that are going to be on this record, with almost no budget at all. I just had some ideas and some talented friends that could help me make them into something cool. So, I’ve been able to do this with almost no resources. I really believe that with a little bit of money behind it, we could make at least 3 more videos. And with the additional funding behind them, that we could do something really amazing.  I mean, if we can make what we have so far with almost nothing, imagine what we could do with your help! 

 

 

   So a video for me isn’t just a visual representation of the song, it’s more like a short film, a story or a journey of what the song looks like to me.  When I make a video, I’m trying to use visual images that help connect you guys to the feelings and emotions that I was experiencing when I wrote the song, or when I was recording it, because my other passion besides music is filmmaking. So, the songs are like the soundtrack to the movies playing in my head. I can’t think of a better way to share that experience with you than to make a really cool and creative video that is not only visually stimulating but also something you haven’t seen 100 times before. Something with a creative point of view.

 

 

   I hate asking talented people to do stuff for free. But I have. A lot. Probably too much at this point. And I feel like I have called in all the favors from my amazing and creative friends that I can. It would be incredible to actually give them a little something for all the time and energy that they give to these projects for me. I assure you, they are more than worth it.

 

   So please check out the perks and options. If you would like to just straight donate that would be AMAZING (just hit the BACK IT button at the top) but there are many perks to be had because it’s important to me that you are not giving me something for nothing! It is also important to me that you know that any donation you make to me will go COMPLETELY TOWARDS THE WORK AND TO MAKE MORE AND BETTER CONTENT FOR YOU!

 

Thank you so much, guys! I will give updates as we go along!

story:
Climate change.

It has never been more urgent, and it's time for us to step up. All of us.

Climate change hurts everyone, of course, but especially those who are least responsible for it: the poor, our children, and generations yet to be born. This is a serious injustice, and Christians are called to respond -- with faith, hope, and love. With prayer, and with action.

Like all movements for justice, we need songs to guide us, sustain us, and inspire us. That’s why we are proud to announce that, together with The Porter's Gate Worship Project, we are creating the first, major Christian worship album to focus on our climate crisis. Top artists have already signed on, and they have been busy writing world-changing songs.

Now we're ready to record, and we need your help to pay for the album...but it's not just about the album. This is music for the movement to end our climate crisis.

Once recording is finished, we plan to premiere select songs at the #ClimateVigil launch event, a global candlelight vigil and virtual concert on November 6, scheduled to coincide with the UN Climate Change Conference (COP26) in Glasgow, Scotland. Tickets to this virtual event are included in every funding level.

Light a candle with us.

  • Be the SPARK, FLAME, CANDLE, LIGHT, or LIGHT OF THE WORLD!

  • Give what you can. Better yet, give what you think is necessary to end our climate crisis. Just know that we will honor your generosity by putting it to the highest possible use in this movement.

  • Donors already contributed $15,000 toward our $70,000 goal. Now we need to raise the rest: $55,000 to fund the #ClimateVigil album and launch event.

Let's make music (and history) together.

  • The album will drop in Spring 2022, and our supporters will have early access to new songs, music videos, album art, photography, and more.

  • Later in 2022, we plan to take #ClimateVigil on tour to share it with as many people as possible. Every week in a new city, our goal is to stage a massive concert, a candlelight vigil, and an educational festival highlighting actions that make a difference.

  • In 2023, we plan to organize the largest candlelight vigil in history to end our climate emergency. Imagine millions of people filling capital cities across the globe with music, light, and inspiration for action. Will you be there?

Remember, you are the light.

If you can't make a financial contribution right now, it's okay. We also value your time, talent, and tenacity. Please share our Indiegogo link with everyone you know (https://igg.me/at/climatevigil). Then visit ClimateVigil.org and tap JOIN US to plug into the #ClimateVigil movement.

Thank you so much for your support.

Still curious how we will use the money? Check the FAQs for a list of our principal costs for the album, launch event, and beyond.
