story:
*Vidéo en français: youtu.be/oTFsv2njFxs*

*Texte en français en-dessous*

Welcome to my crowdfunding campaign!

My name is Florian Grobéty and I’m a professional Circus artist and musician from Switzerland, currently living in Finland. I studied Circus in Québec City and for the past few years I’ve been combining my two passions on stage, going from playing the doublebass to jumping on a trampoline.

For years I’ve been thinking about recording a solo album. I started my musical career with the electric bass, and later on learned to play the scottish bagpipes, the guitar, the irish whistle and the double bass. I never imagined that my first solo album would be mainly on acoustic guitar but Covid-19 and all the lockdowns gave me the unexpected opportunity to delve deeper into the fingerstyle world and provided me with the tools and inspiration to write new music. Since the beginning of 2021, I’ve been working on a 10-original-compositions album, entirely played on acoustic guitar, with other instruments like bass guitar or low whistle added on some tracks. The music you hear in the background of the campaign’s video is going to be in the album, and you can find more samples on my instagram account @floriangmusic.

The album will be named "Polar Eclipse" and, as you maybe guessed, it was inspired by climate and environmental issues. There are no lyrics in the album but every track was inspired and named after an environmental topic, but I will let you discover all about this when the album comes out.

I knew from the moment I started playing fingerstyle guitar by covering Antoine Dufour’s musics that I was going to need a high quality professional guitar. Since I live in Finland, I looked for Finnish guitar makers and I found the amazing Olav Loef from Loef Guitars. Olav has been making acoustic guitars for 40 years, and his guitars are true works of art. Very pleased by their sound and their look, I got mine in the beginning of 2021, which also contributed to the inspiration for this album. You can find out more about this guitar in this video : www.youtube.com/watch?v=FSdaqQDFVfc

And if you want to have a look at Olav’s work: www.loefguitars.fi

Analog recording

I'm not sure if it was pure luck or the universe sending me a message that I stumbled on a very unique recording studio, Astia Studio, in the city I had recently moved in. This studio is special in the way that the founder, Anssi Kippo, decided to go against the trends and went back to recording music on magnetic tape, just like everyone was doing 30 years ago. He did so because he discovered that analog music (music that hasn’t gone through a digital processor, like a computer) has unique properties. That’s mostly why a lot of people say that vinyls sound better, or "warmer". If you’re interested to know more about the difference between analog and digital, I invite you to read this article written by Anssi himself: astiastudio.fi/vinyl-records-and-how-to-improve-enjoying-music/

Since then, I’ve been focusing on having the best sound quality possible and I invested a lot in high quality analog gear. I will record the whole album on tape and release it on vinyl (and also digitally of course). Vinyl records being the only analog way to listen to music (besides cassettes), you will be able to get a full-analog signal path from my guitar to your speakers to ensure the best sound quality possible.

I will go in studio in the beginning of October, and the release date of the album will be somewhere around mid-november. It won't be entirely available on streaming platforms (Spotify,...).

The album will happen in any case, whether I reach the campaign goal or not, and you will get your perk in any case as well.

 

Feel free to get in touch with me if you have any questions by Instagram or Facebook!

 

Thank you for reading and all the best to you!

 

Florian Grobéty

 

Links:

Instagram: www.instagram.com/floriangmusic

Facebook: www.facebook.com/floriangmusician

Loef Guitars: www.loefguitars.fi

My Loef Guitar: www.youtube.com/watch?v=FSdaqQDFVfc

Astia Studio: astiastudio.fi/astia-studio/

Vinyl records and analog music: astiastudio.fi/vinyl-records-and-how-to-improve-enjoying-music/

 

FRANÇAIS

 

Bienvenue sur ma campagne Indiegogo!

Je m’appelle Florian Grobéty et je suis un artiste de Cirque et musicien professionnel originaire de Suisse maintenant établi en Finlande. J’ai fait ma formation en arts du Cirque à Québec et j’ai passé ces dernières années à combiner mes deux passions sur la scène, passant de la contrebasse au trampoline.

Pendant plusieurs années, j’avais l’envie d’enregistrer, un jour, un album solo. J’ai commencé ma carrière musicale en jouant de la basse électrique, puis j’ai appris la cornemuse écossaise, la guitare, le irish whistle et la contrebasse. Je n’aurais jamais imaginé que mon premier album solo serait principalement à la guitare acoustique, mais la pandémie et les confinements m’ont donné l’opportunité inattendue de plonger plus sérieusement dans le monde du "fingerstyle" et m’ont donné par la suite les outils et l’inspiration nécessaire pour écrire des nouvelles musiques. Depuis le début de 2021, j’ai travaillé sans relâche à l’élaboration d’un album de 10 compositions originales, toutes jouées à la guitare acoustique, avec de la basse ou du low whistle sur certaines pistes. Toute la musique que vous entendez en fond de la vidéo sera présente sur l’album, et vous pouvez écouter d’autres extraits musicaux sur ma page Instagram @floriangmusic. 

L’album sera intitulé "Polar Eclipse" et, comme vous l’avez sûrement deviné, il a été inspiré par les récentes problématiques climatiques et environmentales. Il n’y aura pas de paroles ou de chant dans l’album, mais chaque musique a été inspirée et nommée après différents sujets tous liés à l’environnement.

Dès que j’ai commencé à apprendre le fingerstyle en jouant des musiques d’Antoine Dufour, j’ai su que j’allais avoir besoin d’une guitare professionnelle de haute qualité. Étant donné que je vis maintenant en Finlande, j’ai cherché parmi les luthiers finlandais et j’ai découvert les magnifiques guitares de Olav Loef de Loef Guitars. Olav fabrique des guitares depuis plus de 40 ans et ses guitares sont des vraies oeuvres d’art. J’ai été tout de suite charmé par leur son et leur esthétique et, quand j’ai reçu la mienne début 2021, elle m’a énormément inspiré pour cet album. Vous pouvez en découvrir plus à propos de cette guitare dans cette vidéo: www.youtube.com/watch?v=FSdaqQDFVfc

Et je vous invite aussi à visiter le site web d’Olav: www.loefguitars.fi

Enregistrement analogique

Peut-être était-ce la chance ou un message de l’Univers, j’ai découvert un studio d’enregistrement unique, Astia Studio, dans la ville où j’ai récemment emménagé. Ce studio se distingue par le fait que son fondateur, Anssi Kippo, a décidé il y a quelques années d’aller à rebours des tendances actuelles et de revenir à un enregistrement 100% analogique sur bandes magnétiques, comme tout le monde le faisait il y a 30 ans. Il a découvert en effet que la musique analogique (toute musique qui n’est pas passée par un processeur digital, comme un ordinateur) a des propriétés uniques. C’est d’ailleurs pourquoi beaucoup de personnes préfèrent écouter des vinyles et que l’on observe un grand retour des vinyles aujourd’hui. Si la différence analogique/digitale vous intéresse, je vous invite à lire l’article (en anglais) écrit par Anssi à ce sujet: astiastudio.fi/vinyl-records-and-how-to-improve-enjoying-music/

Depuis cette découverte, je me suis concentré sur la qualité de mon son et j’ai investi dans du matériel analogique haut de gamme en prévision de cet enregistrement. Je vais enregistrer l’album au complet sur bandes magnétiques et je vais le sortir en vinyle (mais aussi en version digitale, bien sûr). Le vinyle étant le seul moyen actuel de conserver un signal analogique (à part la cassette), vous pourrez avoir un signal 100% analogique de ma guitare jusqu’à vos enceintes et donc la meilleure qualité sonore possible.

Je vais rentrer en studio au début du mois d’octobre et la date officielle de sortie sera au courant du mois de novembre. L'album ne sera pas disponible entièrement sur les plateformes de streaming type Spotify.

Dans tous les cas, même si cette campagne n’atteint pas l’objectif de financement, je vais produire cet album et vous recevrez vos récompenses.

 

N’hésitez pas à me contacter via Facebook ou Instagram si vous avez des questions!

 

Merci de votre attention et tout de bon à vous!

 

Florian Grobéty

 

Liens:

Instagram: www.instagram.com/floriangmusic

Facebook: www.facebook.com/floriangmusician

Loef Guitares: www.loefguitars.fi

Ma Loef Guitare: www.youtube.com/watch?v=FSdaqQDFVfc

Astia Studio: astiastudio.fi/astia-studio/

Vinyles et musique analogique: astiastudio.fi/vinyl-records-and-how-to-improve-enjoying-music/
story_txt: *Vidéo en français: youtu.be/oTFsv2njFxs**Texte en français en-dessous*Welcome to my crowdfunding campaign!My name is Florian Grobéty and I’m a professional Circus artist and musician from Switzerland, currently living in Finland. I studied Circus in Québec City and for the past few years I’ve been combining my two passions on stage, going from playing the doublebass to jumping on a trampoline.For years I’ve been thinking about recording a solo album. I started my musical career with the electric bass, and later on learned to play the scottish bagpipes, the guitar, the irish whistle and the double bass. I never imagined that my first solo album would be mainly on acoustic guitar but Covid-19 and all the lockdowns gave me the unexpected opportunity to delve deeper into the fingerstyle world and provided me with the tools and inspiration to write new music. Since the beginning of 2021, I’ve been working on a 10-original-compositions album, entirely played on acoustic guitar, with other instruments like bass guitar or low whistle added on some tracks. The music you hear in the background of the campaign’s video is going to be in the album, and you can find more samples on my instagram account @floriangmusic.The album will be named "Polar Eclipse" and, as you maybe guessed, it was inspired by climate and environmental issues. There are no lyrics in the album but every track was inspired and named after an environmental topic, but I will let you discover all about this when the album comes out.I knew from the moment I started playing fingerstyle guitar by covering Antoine Dufour’s musics that I was going to need a high quality professional guitar. Since I live in Finland, I looked for Finnish guitar makers and I found the amazing Olav Loef from Loef Guitars. Olav has been making acoustic guitars for 40 years, and his guitars are true works of art. Very pleased by their sound and their look, I got mine in the beginning of 2021, which also contributed to the inspiration for this album. You can find out more about this guitar in this video : www.youtube.com/watch?v=FSdaqQDFVfcAnd if you want to have a look at Olav’s work: www.loefguitars.fiAnalog recordingI'm not sure if it was pure luck or the universe sending me a message that I stumbled on a very unique recording studio, Astia Studio, in the city I had recently moved in. This studio is special in the way that the founder, Anssi Kippo, decided to go against the trends and went back to recording music on magnetic tape, just like everyone was doing 30 years ago. He did so because he discovered that analog music (music that hasn’t gone through a digital processor, like a computer) has unique properties. That’s mostly why a lot of people say that vinyls sound better, or "warmer". If you’re interested to know more about the difference between analog and digital, I invite you to read this article written by Anssi himself: astiastudio.fi/vinyl-records-and-how-to-improve-enjoying-music/Since then, I’ve been focusing on having the best sound quality possible and I invested a lot in high quality analog gear. I will record the whole album on tape and release it on vinyl (and also digitally of course). Vinyl records being the only analog way to listen to music (besides cassettes), you will be able to get a full-analog signal path from my guitar to your speakers to ensure the best sound quality possible.I will go in studio in the beginning of October, and the release date of the album will be somewhere around mid-november. It won't be entirely available on streaming platforms (Spotify,...).The album will happen in any case, whether I reach the campaign goal or not, and you will get your perk in any case as well. Feel free to get in touch with me if you have any questions by Instagram or Facebook! Thank you for reading and all the best to you! Florian Grobéty Links:Instagram: www.instagram.com/floriangmusicFacebook: www.facebook.com/floriangmusicianLoef Guitars: www.loefguitars.fiMy Loef Guitar: www.youtube.com/watch?v=FSdaqQDFVfcAstia Studio: astiastudio.fi/astia-studio/Vinyl records and analog music: astiastudio.fi/vinyl-records-and-how-to-improve-enjoying-music/ FRANÇAIS Bienvenue sur ma campagne Indiegogo!Je m’appelle Florian Grobéty et je suis un artiste de Cirque et musicien professionnel originaire de Suisse maintenant établi en Finlande. J’ai fait ma formation en arts du Cirque à Québec et j’ai passé ces dernières années à combiner mes deux passions sur la scène, passant de la contrebasse au trampoline.Pendant plusieurs années, j’avais l’envie d’enregistrer, un jour, un album solo. story:
Club d'Elf's new studio album!

Greetings and Salutations! Mike Rivard here - founder and bassist for the band Club d'Elf. The pandemic has had an enormous impact on everyone, and musicians in particular have taken an especially heavy hit. When the economy shut down we were the first ones to go, and will be the last to come back. The loss of gigs and our income streams has been devastating financially. Before the world changed and Covid-19 altered everyone's lives, D'Elf started recording a new studio album. I've covered the costs for the studio time and everything up til this point, but now with the tracking done and the mixing process underway, completion funds are necessary. Your help is greatly needed for us to bring this music into the world. 

While the project is very much a group affair, the album was conceived in personal darkness, trauma, and ultimately healing through the spirit of music. In 2015 I suffered a health crisis while on isolated retreat in the Amazon jungle. This experience led to struggles with depression, and a journey that eventually resulted in creating the original songs on this album. That journey from darkness to light is imbued in the fabric of the music, and as the world around us has never seemed more dark and chaotic, my hope is to bring some of this light into the world. I feel really connected to the music that burst forth in these sessions, and working on it has been a rudder of positivity amidst times that have otherwise been pretty bleak.

If you're not familiar with us, Club d'Elf is an ever-evolving, shape-shifting collective of musicians who love to improvise and create spontaneous cinematic soundscapes, without regard to idiomatic boundaries. It’s hard to categorize our music, and you’ll hear jazz, dub, hip hop, Gnawa, funk, electronica and psychedelia all swirling about in the mix. Gas music from Jupiter? Stoner Jazz? Queasy Listening? Call it what you will, but simply put, it's all about creating trance, exploring invisible landscapes, and losing track of time.

Sessions for the album began with the whole band gathered at a studio north of Boston - playing live and sharing sweat, hugs and laughter, summoning the spirits and creating the sort of interplay that only comes when musicians inhabit the same physical space. We even recorded onto an ancient analog 2" tape machine, on instruments ranging from Moroccan sintir to vintage Mellotron. Then came the pandemic, which put an end to our gigs for the time being, but not to our passion to keep the project rolling.

On this album we pay tribute to some of the musicians and music that inspired us and got us playing in the first place: Miles Davis, Frank Zappa, Gnawa, Joe Zawinul, and the legendary Moroccan band Nass el-Ghiwane. Joining me are D'Elf regulars Dean Johnston, Brahim Fribgane, Paul Schultheis and Mister Rourke. We are fortunate to have some very special guests as well, including John Medeski, Duke Levine, Kevin Barry, David Fiuczynski, and Amit Kavthekar. The music was lovingly recorded at Chris Rival's Middleville Studio, and Grammy-winner Danny Blume is mixing the record. We are very excited to share it with you!

Our goal of $17,000 will cover the remaining expenses: Mixing, mastering, artwork and design, manufacturing of vinyl and CDs, and promotion. In return for your contribution we are offering some cool perks including T-shirts, signed posters, CDs and vinyl, lessons with band members, personal items from my collection of weird books (psychedelia, music, occult, PKD), personalized videos, farm-to-table dinners, and house concerts. Everything has been tweaked to take social distancing into consideration and to keep everyone safe.

We know it’s a difficult and uncertain time and there are many in need. If you are in a position to support us we would be extremely grateful for your contribution and belief in the future of this band. If monetary support isn’t possible for you now, spreading the word to your friends and family or sharing our music on Spotify would also be a great help. We'll be releasing some live-in-studio videos, interviews and other content throughout the campaign until we can trance with you in person again. No matter what, we are committed to making this record a reality.  Thank you for your consideration, and we appreciate your support!

LINKS

Club d'Elf
Club d'Elf on Spotify
Mike Rivard
Moroccan sintir
Gnawa
Nass el-Ghiwane
Dean Johnston
Brahim Fribgane
Mister Rourke
Paul Schultheis
John Medeski
Duke Levine
Kevin Barry
David Fiuczynski
Amit Kavthekar
Chris Rival/Middleville Studio
Danny Blume

story:
What is this about? 

Every year when it snows, I have a tradition of listening to a song that to me, encapsulates the feeling of winter and snow. I got the idea to write instrumental songs of my own that also expressed that and it became a 4-song EP called Gift of the Night Flurries. The album also features a bonus track of a Christmas Carol mash-up that I released a few years ago.

After letting Monica Molina listen to the songs, she got the idea to turn it into a dance collaboration. So, on December 11th, we will not only be releasing the album, but also having a World Premiere dance performance to Gift of the Night Flurries by IndoRican Multicultural Dance Project, choreographed by Teresa Cuevas. For those who can't make it to the release event, we will also be holding a livestream of the pre-recorded performance at a later date to be announced. 

What We Need & What You Get

Producing an album can get expensive! We have album production costs including musicians, mastering, and physical album printing. For the release event, we also need to pay for the venue, dancers, costumes, any catering we might have (dependent on what's allowed at that time), and miscellaneous costs that come up in putting on such an event. Any money will go directly to paying for all of these items, priority going to paying the people making this happen. If we make anything over our goal, it would be split between the dancers, choreographer, and musicians. 

In order to raise the money, we have a ton of rewards! You can get:

-Tickets to the event (in-person or the livestream)

-A copy of the album (digital or a signed physical copy mailed to you)

-An 8x10 print of my photo: Gift of the Night Flurries signed or unsigned, up to you!

-A copy of the event poster signed by the dance company

-Producer or Executive Producer credit for the event

-Meet & Greet after the event

-An invitation to a rehearsal!

Why do this? 

By having this event, we are not only releasing music, but supporting and opening the doors to future collaborations between musicians and dancers for this project. There has already been talk of potential for an additional event down the road in a completely different part of the US, which would be amazing. Seeing the impact and getting feedback from where things are right now gives me a lot of hope about where this could go. And it's only just beginning! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that's okay! It's been a hard year and a half for a lot of people and I completely understand. Spreading the word helps tremendously regardless of whether or not you've financially contributed and helps us get closer to our goal!

story:
Reencuentros

For my first solo album, I decided to go to the roots of my musical upbringing, and share with you where it all started. I have always been impressed by the beauty and sophistication of Latin American songs, which I heard in my mother's voice since I was a kid. When I put together the repertoire for the album, I noticed that most of the existing recordings were made around the 80's, so I found myself with the mission of reviving these musical jewels and bring them to you in a refreshed way. 

Every time I sing Latin American songs in front of an audience, I always get the question: Have you considered recording an album with this music?  This idea has been growing in my mind, and now I am happy to offer it to you, and make it a reality, with your support. 

Who is in my team?

As you see in the video, I will be working with a great group of people. I have worked with all of them in the past, and I can say that their expertise and reputation gave me the confidence of wanting to record this album.  I want to mention two wonderful additions to this team, -not mentioned in the video- that make this album even more valuable.

Blanton Alspaugh, Producer.

He is a multiple Grammy-Award record producer. I had the honor of meeting him when I recorded as a soloist in the Grammy-Winning album Duruflé: The Complete Choral Works, which he produced. 

David Hanlon, Music Arrangements. 

Composer, conductor, and a long time colleague and friend, David will arrange some of the songs. He will give them a new life, and I can't wait to show you what he comes up with. 

What We Need & What You Get

For this project, my goal is to raise 15,000 that will help me cover the main expenses of the production. 

The Impact

Promoting these Latin American songs goes beyond the mere desire of sharing their beauty as pieces from the past, but reaching out to new audiences, and singers that would like to include these pieces in the Spanish repertoire. Just like we enjoy a jazz standard, I want to show people how much more music it is out there that we can also embrace and appreciate. Promoting Latin American repertoire is one of my main goals as a singer. 

Budget Breakdown

$5,400 Fees

$3,000 Manufacturing

$2,200 Photography, Video, and Design

$2,900 Musical Arrangements

$1,500 Studio Recording and Mixing

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Although every dollar really counts, I'd love it if you could help me share this campaign to let people know about this! Send it to friends that enjoy this music genre, or tell those that have never heard these songs.
story_txt:
Reencuentros
For my first solo album, I decided to go to the roots of my musical upbringing, and share with you where it all started. I have always been impressed by the beauty and sophistication of Latin American songs, which I heard in my mother's voice since I was a kid. When I put together the repertoire for the album, I noticed that most of the existing recordings were made around the 80's, so I found myself with the mission of reviving these musical jewels and bring them to you in a refreshed way. 
Every time I sing Latin American songs in front of an audience, I always get the question: Have you considered recording an album with this music?  This idea has been growing in my mind, and now I am happy to offer it to you, and make it a reality, with your support. 
Who is in my team?
As you see in the video, I will be working with a great group of people. I have worked with all of them in the past, and I can say that their expertise and reputation gave me the confidence of wanting to record this album.  I want to mention two wonderful additions to this team, -not mentioned in the video- that make this album even more valuable.
Blanton Alspaugh, Producer.
He is a multiple Grammy-Award record producer. I had the honor of meeting him when I recorded as a soloist in the Grammy-Winning album Duruflé: The Complete Choral Works, which he produced. 
David Hanlon, Music Arrangements.

Promoting Latin American repertoire is one of my main goals as a singer.

story:
AUG 21, 6:00pm Pacific Time

ABNEY PARKS SUMMER SURPRISE CONCERT WITH SPECIAL GUESTS!

(This is a show you don't want to miss) 

This is a live streaming concert you watch at home, on your tv, computer or device. 
There will be cheap tickets for people just watching, a deluxe package for people who want to download the video to watch later, and a super deluxe package including live concert album, downloaded video, and live ticket!

It's been over a year and a have since we had any live concerts, due to this pandemic. And even though the whole band is vaccinated, we still can't perform to real crowds. Thank god (and thank you!) these streaming concerts are so much fun, and so successful! 

SO WHO ARE THE SPECIAL GUESTS?

THE CAST OF THE ABNEY PARK MUSICAL, SINGING SONGS FROM THE ABNEY PARK MUSICAL! The cast will perform songs from the musical, as well as join Abney Park on classic Abney Park songs. (If you've been missing female vocals on our songs, now your opportunity!)

Meet the cast:

Morgan Roberts plays young Effie Winters. 

Casey Raiha plays the adventurous young Amos Quinn. 

Jeremy Steckler plays Hammet Bryant, Esq. 

Skye Warden plays Hania Khoalek.

Lise Yellen plays Mary Parks

 Robert Brown plays Robert Winters, and the  Evil Charles Foster Quinn! 

 

This is going to be SO much fun, and you are going to LOVE these new songs. This is a once in a life time opportunity to see the cast before the musical is released, or hit the stage. DON’T MISS OUT!

 

VIP AFTER PARTY

The Seedy and Disreputable VIP After Party!​

"With a crew of Drunken Pilots, we're the only Airship Pirates!"

After the main concert, we always have our VIP after party. This is a deluxe package, and wow, things get crazy. 

It's sort of like that TV show Drunk History, but if it was a concert. You see, Abney Park will play a whole additional show, but this time we do shots in between songs!  So with each song we get progressively more drunk, until the songs devolve into something a bit more...unexpected? (I even did a 5 minute rap at one... and it was horrible!)

 

Oh, and by the way, VIP ticket comes with ALL downloads. Video, Audio, etc. 

This is more of an "adult" experience.

story:
ABOUT US

We are Sympuls-e band. This year we marked the tenth anniversary. All those years we are trying our best to do high quality heavy music.

 

Official discography:

2012 - Destroying The Barriers (LP)

2013 - Generate Reincarnation (Single)

2015 - Solarstorm (LP)

2016 - System Duality (Single)

2017 - Mirror City (LP/Remake)

story:
*PLEASE, READ THIS:
EU shipping already includes VAT for EU customers. VAT is calculated for each item and is already included in the shipping.

 

We are a small custom guitar shop Badstroke with great passion for use of exotic woods and expert craftsmanship. Our mission is to bring beautiful high quality guitars  or the lowest possible prices.

Come take a look at some of the work we have already done on our famous Semi-Customs. They heavily influenced how your very own Fiend Series may look like. Please bear in mind that some aspects of each guitar may vary depending on your specific configurations. Now let's get you introduced...

 

 

 

 


Due to COVID, past months were hard on musicians around the world. As we see guitar lovers and artists often struggle financially, we thought about what we can do for the community we feel to be part of.

We need YOUR help to start a production of a new Fiend Series that will be of highest quality for absolutely the lowest possible price. How low? about 60-70 % cheaper than most custom shops you probably know. To be able to do all this, we need to move to new bigger workshop and buy a lot of new tools to be able to deliver on our promises. Right now, we need your help and we offer  more than just a mere thanks in return.

 

 

Your name will be engraved into our Tablet of Fame in shape of guitar placed in our custom shop headquarters in Prague. Also, you will be the first to know updates about this Indiegogo campaign!

 

FIEND SERIES are high quality guitars and basses in astounding handcrafted quality. Inspired by the best of the best ever sold in Badstroke Guitars custom shop. This is where all the magic starts! 

Let's get to it!

1. Choose your favourite!

 

 

* MODERN + HEADLESS ARE MULTISCALE BY DEFAULT

 

 

 

 

* MODERN + HEADLESS ARE MULTISCALE BY DEFAULT

 

2. Pick a color!

 

 

3. Select your pickups configuration!

 

 

 

 

Full Custom Badstroke guitars are what we've been known for in the past 5 years! This reward is for the most demanding and ambitious guitarists. For this pledge we will build together your dream piece with almost no limitations (one of the factors being your imagination)! As a special thank you for support us on this endeavour to Fiend Series we give you 10 % off your specific build. Now,  look at some of the pieces that we were able to build within Full Custom pledge price range!

 

Build your very own guitar, we'll show you how! And of course, help you do it in a way to uphold Badstroke's highest standards. We'll talk everything through and prepare all the materials in advance. After that your one week stay in beautiful historical Prague can begin. You would be visiting our new workshop with us and work on your very own custom guitar and we'll build it with you from scratch. This pledge is for the most interested guitar enthusiasts who want to know it all and we are ready to share all the secrets and answer all your questions to your satisfaction.

 

Since you, the backers, are those who are making this all possible, we've decided to give you the oportunity to upgrade the very first Fiend Series that will see the light of this world. Those extra add-ons will make you forever stand out amongst Fiend Series owners all around the world.  This opportunity will not repeat and will not be available in the next open Fiend Series batches! This is a thank you from us to all of you making the Fiend Series possible!

 

Stated prices are without VAT

EU countries will have VAT automatically added to the shipping cost for each item

story:
Who I Am // Where I Come From

I am a rabbi, musician, and mother in love with nature. I grew up in an observant household that hikes on Shabbos and sings blessings in three part harmonies. Throughout my life I have sought out ways to merge my love of music, Judaism and the outdoors. These passions led me through rabbinical school and musical residency with the Rising Song Institute.  

Since the pandemic began, Joey Weisenberg and I have been recording and producing my first Rising Song record. With the finish line in sight, I am raising funds to complete the project and put this earth-based Jewish music out in the world. 

Why This Album?

Ruach Neshama is a collection of 9 original tracks which celebrates the connection between music, nature and Jewish wisdom. The songs employ traditional texts, lyrical midrash and the meditative practice of the niggun—the wordless melody—to open our hearts to the ever-present guidance within us and around us.  They paint the wisdom and words of our ancestors on a canvas of body and nature, and they ask our innermost questions:

What is my soul calling for? What teachings do Earth and Song, Tradition and Spirit offer me?

As we emerge from a year of isolation, loss, innovation and reflection, we are asking new questions and demanding new answers. We've taken a step back from our lives for long enough to see what we are missing, and we are ready to intentionally step back into community, song and ritual together. These tracks offer guidance in this process, and encourage our own healing and re-integration.

Where You Come In! 

This album requires the labor of so many talented and dedicated musicians.  Raising $14,000 will allow me to  compensate the musicians, artists, and engineers for their much needed time to complete this project, and so I am asking for your help. 

This fundraising isn’t just for this album. It is for the musicians who are contributing to Jewish music across the country, and building a more spiritually robust Jewish life for all of us.  

Ruach Neshama Album Team:

Joey Weisenberg: Musical Director & Recording Engineer /  Percussion, Bass, Guitar, Baritone Ukulele, Piccolo, Drum Programming, Vocals 

Kendra Root Wolpe: Vocals

Deborah Sacks Mintz: Vocals

Jon Mitchell: Recording Engineer / Vocals, Percussion

Will Robertson:  Bass 

Eliyahu Sills:  Flute 

Don Godwin: Mixing & Mastering Engineer

Sol Weiss: Album Art & Graphic Design

Rising Song Institute Vocalists: Rena Branson, Rebekka Goldsmith, Eitan Kantor, Gedalia Penner, Sam Tygiel, Batya Levine, & Gayanne Geurin 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can afford to support the creation of this album, please donate. Any amount that you can give is incredibly helpful. Donations are tax deductible.

If financial support isn't feasible for you, you can help out by sharing this campaign. Thank you for supporting this music. 

I hope these songs offer you the inspiration you seek, deeper access to Jewish Wisdom, and connection with the Divine Breath flowing through you and all of creation.

story:
hello loves! <3

i am in the process of releasing my first full-length album! with that, i am bringing two of the singles into life with music videos. i'm grateful to have the opportunity to work with dear friends who are skilled in the arts of videography & animation. as an independent artist, i'm going to need some help from my community so that i can fairly compensate the creators.

the funds raised from this page will go directly to:

- the film crew for 'Wildflower' music video

- post-production of 'Wildflower'

- food for cast & crew members

- the animator for 'baby blue'

 

any additional funds will go towards making merch for the album!

 

thank you for your time, energy, & for believing in this project!

 

cheers,

kyra skye

story:
LITTLE BROWN JUG BRASS 

Who We Are

Little Brown Jug Brass Band, is a quirky, joyful, exuberant brass band which revels in providing a fun and unique perspective on dance tunes and who take pride in ensuring our audiences have a fantastic time – with a few laughs along the way!

Founded by Jevon Hills who got his music degree in Tuba Performance (yes, you read that right) we are a multi-generational group of musicians with fine arts degrees, music degrees, and post-secondary music training who insist on working within a fun, co-creative, collaborative environment.  We focus on enjoying the best gifts music has provided us – camaraderie, light-heartedness, connection, and laughter.  https://littlebrownjugbrass.com/meet-the-band/

Why It’s Important For Us To Make Our EP

By late spring of 2020, and after many socially distanced band get-togethers, we recognized that the Coronavirus had not only affected us emotionally, but had really taken its toll out on our community as well. At a time when Calgary usually flourishes with outdoor festivals and live concerts, not even our beloved world-renowned Stampede & Rodeo could survive the fallout and was cancelled for the first time in 100 years.

We decided then and there that we would perform outdoor social distancing concerts, and were blown away by the response.  Initially imagining we would play our “Boulevard Brass Parties” for a few households, the requests poured in!  Birthday parties, block parties, Pride gatherings, community family festivals; no matter where we played, neighbours ranging in ages from toddlers to great grandmothers would be attracted to the party.  Heck, we even stopped a city bus in the middle of the street when the driver stopped to open his window and listen for a few minutes!  Everyone was as hungry as we were to safely connect, enjoy music, and have their spirits raised. 

We recognize our community is much larger than just Calgary.  Many of us heard from friends and family from all over the world who fervently wished they could hear us play.  We would love to bring our cheerfully eccentric music to a wider audience so that they too might be able to dance gleefully, if even for a moment. 

Our Project

Our crowd-pleasing Boulevard Brass Parties illustrated to us how truly popular our musical viewpoint is with so many different demographics.  Everything ranging from our unique arrangements of covers to our own compositions were so well-received that we collectively made the decision to pool all the funds raised from our “Covid Tour 2020” and put them towards booking a recording studio in the new year.  (With safety protocols in place, of course.)  We are planning to record (budget depending) between 3-6 songs for our first EP. Good news – we already have enough for the studio fees!  It would be greater news if we could:

  • Hire a professional Producer who ‘gets brass’ to work with us in the studio
  • Hire a quality sound engineer who also ‘gets brass’ to mix and master
  • Get the mechanical rights to some of our favourite covers
  • Hire a videographer to capture the recording process, and create a video of one of our original compositions
  • Craft beer  - OK, scratch that.  We’ll pay for our own beer


We’ve already raised enough to get in the studio.  And, we’ve set it up so that if we don’t reach our entire goal, we can still create a fun product that we can share with a global community at a time when we could all use a light-hearted distraction.  But, your help would go towards our ability to release a much higher quality product, and allow us to introduce ourselves to a larger audience on multiple media platforms. 

Your support means the world to us.  Literally.

 

How You Can Help & How We Can Thank You

We’re looking to raise $3,000 to create a 3-6 song EP and Music Video

Sponsorship Levels

Love Bucks:

For supporting this project and being part of our legacy you’ll receive an email offering our eternal gratitude!

Howler:

For supporting this project and being part of our legacy you’ll receive an email offering our eternal gratitude and your name will be listed in the credits of the Album as a Howler!

Growler:

Are you ready for new music?
For your pledge you’ll receive:

  • a  digital download of our new album,
  • our eternal gratitude, and
  • Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as a Growler!

Jughead:

Our fans show their true nature when they become Jugheads.  If you have to ask "Am I a Jughead?" then you aren't one.  Jugheads know who they are.

As a Jughead you'll receive:

  • an Official LBJB Covid-19 Tour T-Shirt,
  • a digital download of our new album,
  • our eternal gratitude, and
  • Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as a Jughead!

Kit Brewer:

Do you love Beer as much as you love sweet merch?  Do you plan on being in the Calgary area? Then look no further. 

As a Kit Brewer you'll receive:

  • 2 Passes for a brewery tour at Tool Shed Brewing in Calgary
  • 2 Official LBJB Covid-19 Tour T-Shirts
  • 2 digital downloads of our album
  • 2x our eternal gratitude, and
  • Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as a  Kit Brewer!

Extract Brewer:

Do you love drinking Beer and talking to Musicians?  Then this is your level.  Hang out with  members of LBJB at Tool Shed Brewing in Calgary for an exclusive tour and tasting.

As an Extract Brewer you'll receive:

  • 2 Passes for a brewery tour at Tool Shed Brewing in Calgary
  • 2 Official LBJB Covid-19 Tour T-Shirts
  • 2 digital downloads of our album
  • 2 Official LBJB Growlers filled with your choice of a Tool Shed Brew
  • 2x our eternal gratitude, and
  • Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as an Extract Brewer!

 

All-Grain Brewer:

Do you love sweet merch, music, and yard parties?  Do you want all your neighbours to know how cool you are?  Pick your date for Spring/Summer 2021 and LBJB will come to your house to  put on a show with one of our signature Boulevard Brass Parties.

As an All-Grain Brewer you'll receive:

  • 5 Official LBJB Covid-19 Tour T-Shirts
  • 5 digital downloads of our album
  • an exclusive Boulevard Brass Party with LBJB for you and your guests
  • 5x our eternal gratitude, and
  • Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as an All-Grain Brewer!

Patron

Want to sponsor us while showing your clients how awesome you are? Want us to promote your business? Other ideas? We're flexible!

As a Patron you'll receive:

  • An exclusive Promotional Performance by LBJB 
  • Advertising of your business on our Social Media
  • Our UNDYING eternal gratitude! And
  • Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as a Patron!

Other Ways You Can Help

Wanna help us out but don’t have the funds?  Or do have the funds and want to go above and beyond?  Please help us get the word out.  Tell your friends.  Share on social media.  It’s easy, just use the Indiegogo share tools!

Little Brown Jug Brass Band, is a quirky, joyful, exuberant brass band which revels in providing a fun and unique perspective on dance tunes and who take pride in ensuring our audiences have a fantastic time – with a few laughs along the way!Founded by Jevon Hills who got his music degree in Tuba Performance (yes, you read that right) we are a multi-generational group of musicians with fine arts degrees, music degrees, and post-secondary music training who insist on working within a fun, co-creative, collaborative environment.  We focus on enjoying the best gifts music has provided us – camaraderie, light-heartedness, connection, and laughter.  https://littlebrownjugbrass.com/meet-the-band/

Why It’s Important For Us To Make Our EP
By late spring of 2020, and after many socially distanced band get-togethers, we recognized that the Coronavirus had not only affected us emotionally, but had really taken its toll out on our community as well. At a time when Calgary usually flourishes with outdoor festivals and live concerts, not even our beloved world-renowned Stampede & Rodeo could survive the fallout and was cancelled for the first time in 100 years.
We decided then and there that we would perform outdoor social distancing concerts, and were blown away by the response.  Initially imagining we would play our “Boulevard Brass Parties” for a few households, the requests poured in!  Birthday parties, block parties, Pride gatherings, community family festivals; no matter where we played, neighbours ranging in ages from toddlers to great grandmothers would be attracted to the party.  Heck, we even stopped a city bus in the middle of the street when the driver stopped to open his window and listen for a few minutes!  Everyone was as hungry as we were to safely connect, enjoy music, and have their spirits raised. 

We recognize our community is much larger than just Calgary.  Many of us heard from friends and family from all over the world who fervently wished they could hear us play.  We would love to bring our cheerfully eccentric music to a wider audience so that they too might be able to dance gleefully, if even for a moment. 
Our Project
Our crowd-pleasing Boulevard Brass Parties illustrated to us how truly popular our musical viewpoint is with so many different demographics.  Everything ranging from our unique arrangements of covers to our own compositions were so well-received that we collectively made the decision to pool all the funds raised from our “Covid Tour 2020” and put them towards booking a recording studio in the new year.  (With safety protocols in place, of course.)  We are planning to record (budget depending) between 3-6 songs for our first EP. Good news – we already have enough for the studio fees!  It would be greater news if we could:

Hire a professional Producer who ‘gets brass’ to work with us in the studio
Hire a quality sound engineer who also ‘gets brass’ to mix and master
Get the mechanical rights to some of our favourite covers
Hire a videographer to capture the recording process, and create a video of one of our original compositions

Craft beer  - OK, scratch that.  We’ll pay for our own beer

We’ve already raised enough to get in the studio.  And, we’ve set it up so that if we don’t reach our entire goal, we can still create a fun product that we can share with a global community at a time when we could all use a light-hearted distraction.  But, your help would go towards our ability to release a much higher quality product, and allow us to introduce ourselves to a larger audience on multiple media platforms. 
Your support means the world to us.  Literally.

 
How You Can Help & How We Can Thank You
We’re looking to raise $3,000 to create a 3-6 song EP and Music Video
Sponsorship Levels
Love Bucks:
For supporting this project and being part of our legacy you’ll receive an email offering our eternal gratitude!

Howler:
For supporting this project and being part of our legacy you’ll receive an email offering our eternal gratitude and your name will be listed in the credits of the Album as a Howler!
Growler:
Are you ready for new music?For your pledge you’ll receive:

a  digital download of our new album,
our eternal gratitude, and
Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as a Growler!


Jughead:
Our fans show their true nature when they become Jugheads.  If you have to ask "Am I a Jughead?" then you aren't one.  Jugheads know who they are.
As a Jughead you'll receive:

an Official LBJB Covid-19 Tour T-Shirt,
a digital download of our new album,
our eternal gratitude, and
Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as a Jughead!


Kit Brewer:
Do you love Beer as much as you love sweet merch?  Do you plan on being in the Calgary area? Then look no further. As a Kit Brewer you'll receive:

2 Passes for a brewery tour at Tool Shed Brewing in Calgary
2 Official LBJB Covid-19 Tour T-Shirts
2 digital downloads of our album
2x our eternal gratitude, and
Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as a  Kit Brewer!


Extract Brewer:
Do you love drinking Beer and talking to Musicians?  Then this is your level.  Hang out with  members of LBJB at Tool Shed Brewing in Calgary for an exclusive tour and tasting.As an Extract Brewer you'll receive:

2 Passes for a brewery tour at Tool Shed Brewing in Calgary
2 Official LBJB Covid-19 Tour T-Shirts
2 digital downloads of our album
2 Official LBJB Growlers filled with your choice of a Tool Shed Brew
2x our eternal gratitude, and
Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as an Extract Brewer!


 
All-Grain Brewer:
Do you love sweet merch, music, and yard parties?  Do you want all your neighbours to know how cool you are?  Pick your date for Spring/Summer 2021 and LBJB will come to your house to  put on a show with one of our signature Boulevard Brass Parties.As an All-Grain Brewer you'll receive:

5 Official LBJB Covid-19 Tour T-Shirts
5 digital downloads of our album
an exclusive Boulevard Brass Party with LBJB for you and your guests
5x our eternal gratitude, and
Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as an All-Grain Brewer!


Patron
Want to sponsor us while showing your clients how awesome you are? Want us to promote your business? Other ideas? We're flexible!
As a Patron you'll receive:

An exclusive Promotional Performance by LBJB 
Advertising of your business on our Social Media
Our UNDYING eternal gratitude! And
Your name will be listed in credits of the Album as a Patron!

Other Ways You Can Help
Wanna help us out but don’t have the funds?  Or do have the funds and want to go above and beyond?  Please help us get the word out.  Tell your friends.  Share on social media.  It’s easy, just use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who is Jordan Micheal Peterson?

I am a piano entertainer who has been playing at Jellyrolls, the dueling piano bar on the Disney Boardwalk for the past 4 years, but COVID changed all of that!

When I was younger, I would write music all the time. It would consume me, and it's all I could think about. I never thought I'd feel that again, but something good has come out of this pandemic. I am inspired, and the songs have been pouring out of me!

Over the last few months I have been recording an album of all original music, but I need your help!

 

How to Help

I am determined to make this album happen. I have made some amazing friends who also happen to be incredible musicians and deserve to be paid for their work. The majority of the money raised will be used to pay them what they deserve and you will also be helping out of work musicians pay the bills!

The rest of your contribution will go toward recording at a professional studio, mixing and mastering the album, and production/distribution of CD's and vinyl.

 

Risks & Challenges

Vinyl records will take approximately a month longer to ship due to the nature of the format, but you will still receive a CD and an early digital copy of the full album. There is a slight risk to vinyl sound quality, but I am a vinyl lover, and it's my dream to have my own LP, so I am having a separate master prepared to ensure a great product!

All photos are mockups. Final products will slightly differ.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I can not thank you enough for being part of this community and for your overwhelming support during this process!  You can continue to help by telling everyone you know, sharing this page, and following me on Facebook and Instagram!

www.facebook.com/JordanMichealPeterson

www.instagram.com/jordanmp_music

story:
Why Tapestry Road?

Tapestry Road is a magical place, where fairies ride fireflies in the night and tree frogs sing in chorus for their delight. Where the bees buzz with the coos of doves, and trees sough and sway, in rhythm with the wind along the way. Where the yellow brick road hides nearby, and for those who walk with a wild heart, Journey’s End is just the start.

Hi I’m Liza B :) 

Allow me to introduce myself. Deeply spiritual, I'm a firm believer in magic and miracles. I’m a mom, wife, friend, volunteer, leader, entrepreneur, tattooed rebel, student of ontology and Life, teacher and sky-painter. 

My website is Lizab.band, and my FB page is www.facebook.com/LizaBSinger. 

For as long as I can remember, I’ve been singing. When I was a baby, I would crawl into my mom’s lap and sing with her, as she sang rocked me and sang lullabies. Her gentle voice, and music in general, offered respite in a tumultuous childhood. Music brought healing, when I thought my heart was broken, reminded me to trust in love and gave me an outlet to express myself through the words of others. That soundtrack of life elicits joy, daring, flights of fancy and the courage to be vulnerable.

Originally from the beaches of Los Angeles, I now live in the burbs of New York City - both meccas for dreams coming true. I’m blessed to begin this musical journey here in NY (the Land of Oz), and I look forward to sharing this experience with friends, new and old, along the way. As my grandfather used to say, “I never met a stranger, only a friend I had yet to meet.” I believe that success not shared, is just a hollow and lonely victory.

As they say, teamwork makes the dream work. Therefore, I’m inviting you to join my team, the Daydream Believers. We are the dreamers and doers. As the campaign progresses, I'll introduce you to the team of musicians and others, who's talents are helping bring Tapestry Road to life.

I'm honored to share the creation of this album with my daughters, Anneli (album art) and Amanda (vocals) and my husband Anders (guitar) on the lullaby we used to play to them. Just as other artists have contributed to the soundtrack of my life, I am offering these heartfelt songs, to be part of the soundtrack of yours. May they make you laugh, cry, sing along, bring healing and most of all inspire you. 

The Impact

It’s hard to express the impact your partnership will make, other than to say this is a lifelong dream, being fulfilled with your help.

On the other hand, it is also beyond my understanding, to know how my songs will impact others. I hope my songs bring joy and healing to millions.

What You Get

Perks: 

Special thanks to Isabelle Schuyler for helping come up with these names. We had so much fun!

Sunday Driver - Get a personalized note and a taste of the album, without spending much.

Easy Rider - Spend a little more, get alot more.

Fast Lane - Get early access and signed merchandise.

Daredevil - Get all of the above, plus a *private performance of your favorite song.

Monster Truck Rally - Feeling bold and adventurous? Get all the other stuff, honorary mention on my website, plus a *private performance of the album.

-------------------------------------------

What I need

  • The musicians will cost $3000.
  • The album photography will cost $5000, including location fees, permits, makeup, etc.
  • The initial order of 300 cd's & 100 posters will cost $2200. The 2nd batch of 300/100 will cost a little over $620. If there's enough of a demand, we'll order 1000 cd's, with posters for $1000. Wouldn't that be awesome?! (The larger the order, the greater the discount.)
  • Each video will cost $2000-$5000, dependent upon variables, such as permit fees, location fees, videographer editing, and other services and costs. (A vital part of marketing music, videos are often key to the success of a project.)
  • The first batch of 200 vinyl records, will cost $4000, and will take about 16 weeks, so this is a much slower process. A 2nd run will cost $3200. (If we're not able to raise enough money for everything, vinyl will be the first thing cut from the project. We can always revisit it later.)

Special Thanks

Thank you to Damian Tichenor and Isabelle Schuyler for help with heavy lifting, endless videos, scripts, ideas and food runs. Thank you to John & Roma Tichenor for making me laugh and being great friends. Thanks to Roseanne & Peter Schuyler for always being there and bringing joy and laughter along with them. Thank you to Mark & Carol Kutsos for love and inspiration. Thank you to Bernadette Dockerty for bringing fairies and light.

Thank you to Peter Calo for taking me on, showing me the ropes, and for providing water, Claritin and tissues ?. But more than anything, thank you for helping me write music and bringing my songs to life. 

THANK YOU to my husband, Anders for saying Yes to my dreams. And THANK YOU to Anneli & Amanda for taking part in this process, but most importantly for being just who you are. I love every breathe you take. 

Other Ways You Can Help

No money? No worries. There’s other ways you can help. I would be thrilled for you to join my team of Daydream Believers. You can share my campaign with friends, do a TikTok video, play it on your podcast, the radio, etc. Feel free to contact me, or comment here. 

Help me get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Let's blast the roof off this party!

And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools. 

We are the dreamers of dreams. We are the music makers.

Let's make music my friends. 

Liza B

story:
Dream Big, Work Hard, Have Faith...

That's not just something I say. I've lived by those words for a long time!

I've dedicated my whole adult life to making music. When I was fresh out of college, I moved to Nashville (my first BIG leap of faith) I didn't know, at the time, what my music career would look like, I just knew I had this need to write and sing! After a short gig as an intern at Arista Records, I got my first publishing deal.  I spent every day writing songs with some of Nashville's very best writers. I was also in the studio (a lot) singing my own demos and singing demos for other writers. I'm so grateful to be able to say that some amazing artists have chosen to record some of my songs! When I got the call that Reba McEntire was gonna cut one of my songs, I pretty much freaked out! When I got the call inviting me to come sing on the record, I completely freaked out! :) Reba couldn't have been kinder to me in the studio, that day spent at Starstruck studios was definitely one of the highlights of my music career so far!

For the last several years, I've been recording and touring as an independent artist. It's the hardest, most rewarding and fulfilling thing I've ever done. Actually, "independent artist" is not entirely accurate. I am independent in that I don't have to answer to (or have the financial backing or promotional power of a label) but I'm totally DEPENDENT on the folks who like the music enough to buy our CDs and downloads, book us to perform and support us in so many other ways! My husband Sam & I are completely independent artists, we are our own label, our own publishing company, our own promoters & you got it, I'm my own manager. I've always been a little bit of a rebel, so, the INDIE label suits me well;) BUT...that brings me to this campaign. I'm chomping at the bit to record and release a new collection of songs! But, the truth is, producing, manufacturing and promoting a new project is expensive (more expensive than I can afford on my own) so I'm hoping you'll consider becoming a part of our team in helping to bring this project to life! I want & would be SO GRATEFUL for YOU to be part of #TTsBelieveTeam!!=)

Why $20,000?

We'll spend around $10,000 producing this record. That will include studio time, engineers, musicians and a little bit for us to buy groceries during the process. We expect the initial manufacturing cost to be between 3 and 5 thousand dollars - depending on the number of pre-orders. The rest will be used for promotion. There's no sense in making a great record if no one knows about it so we'll hire a publicist to help get the word out. If we exceed our goal, We'll aim toward shooting and promoting another music video. If, for some reason, we don't make our goal, we'll still make the record and you'll still get your perks. It'll just take a bit longer.

Y'all make all the difference

Last year we reached out to the folks who know about and support our music to help us launch our "When I Get That Pony Rode" music video. Y'all showed up BIG TIME and because of your emails, texts, phone calls and views, the video was #1 on CMT.com in it's first week and aired on GAC's Daily Countdown show for two months! I'm so honored that so many of you are on our team and, with your help, we'll get this record made and out to the world! It makes perfect sense to me now to call this new album, "Get That Pony Rode"! When we made & released our video, we were blessed to find a place for it on TV & on the internet & now, in making this new record, thanks to YOUR support, the version of the song you hear in our video will have a place on this new "Get That Pony Rode" CD!

Other Ways You Can Help

It's so important to the success of this campaign that we get the word out. PLEASE help us let other folks know about what we're up to! I KNOW to my SOUL we’re gonna REACH & go BEYOND our fundraising goal, ALL thanks to YOU, my SUPER supportive Indiegogo funders!:)

BIG, BIG LOVE, HUGS & GRATITUDE, Y'ALL ROCK!!!!!

dream big * work hard * have faith & let's get this record made!!!

templeton thompson:)

 

*tt's FAQ's:

1.  When will I receive my perks? 

Funders will receive some perks almost right away, i.e. the 2 song downloads in the $5 perk...perks like some of my download cards & past CDs can be sent out right away, especially if you're wanting them in time for theYee~Halidays! some perks i.e. the Voice/guitar lesson, Third Thursday Sessions,  "girls & horses" video special, Associate & Executive Producer levels, etc. can possibly be scheduled & received within the month of December but certainly by January 2015; however the record won't likely be done until at least February 2015 & maybe even later. I'll be communicating with funders as the rewards are claimed. Perks like T~shirts & dog tags will be sent about 2 weeks after the campaign deadline, possibly sooner or later. As for the new tt CD & the download of new CD, we're workin' on it, we cannot THANK y'all enough for your support & we can't wait for y'all to hear our new material! 
 

2.  When does the money I pledge to this project come out of my account?

Right away as this is a flexible funding campaign. 

 

  • Contributions from Pay Pal come to us immediately.
  • Contributions from Credit Cards are charged immediately; however, we will not receive those funds until ~15 days after our campaign deadline.

3.  If the goal isn’t met, will I still receive my perks?

Absolutely, we’ll follow through with EVERY perk in the timeliest fashion possible:) 

hippie chic cowgirl philosophy

As for the new tt CD & the download of new CD, we're workin' on it, we cannot THANK y'all enough for your support & we can't wait for y'all to hear our new material!  
2.  When does the money I pledge to this project come out of my account?
Right away as this is a flexible funding campaign. 
 

Contributions from Pay Pal come to us immediately.
Contributions from Credit Cards are charged immediately; however, we will not receive those funds until ~15 days after our campaign deadline.

3.  If the goal isn’t met, will I still receive my perks?
Absolutely, we’ll follow through with EVERY perk in the timeliest fashion possible:) 
hippie chic cowgirl philosophy

story:
Helion Prime comes to vinyl...

For those unfamiliar with us we are a power metal band from the United States and former AFM Artist! We have three full length albums and have done several tours and festivals in the united states! We are excited to finally announce our latest album "Question Everything" is getting a make over for a vinyl release! It will be completely remixed/remastered for vinyl and include a brand new song - Wash Away!

We will be releasing a digital version on October 8th, 2021 (Roughly a month from today) to honor the one year of the album's original release. The digital release will also include a bonus disc (see below). The bonus disc will only be available in digital format but anyone who pre-orders a vinyl will be given a link to download the bonus disc! Produced by Jason Ashcraft and Alex Nasla. Mixed, Mastered and all keys by Alex Nasla 

The goal is to release the vinyl in February because vinyl manufacturing takes up anywhere from 3/4 months. Once the Pre-Order ends and we can put in the order we will be able to give an accurate date of release for the vinyl! 

Check out this remixed/Remastered version of "The Final Theory" here:

Video Link here: https://youtu.be/hLf0Y1cHYy0

Also watch the video for "Reawakening" - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M9EsONK8ixQ

Re-Release Information:

The album art got a sweet makeover!

Album Disc/Vinyl:
01: Wash Away*
02: The Final Theory 
03: Madame Mercury 
04: Prof
05: The Gadfly 
06: Photo 51
07: E Pur Si Muove 
08: Words of the Abbot
09: The Forbidden Zone
10: Question Everything
11: Reawakening 

Bonus Material:
01: The Drake Equation (Re-Recording)
02: Moon - Watcher (Re-Recording)
03: Atlas Obscura (Re-Recording)
04: The Human Condition (Re-Recording)
05: Question Everything (Mary Only)
06: Angel's Don't Kill (Children of Bodom Cover)**
07: The Pharaoh Sails to Orion (Nightwish Cover)***

*Wash Away is a brand new song continuing the theme of "Question Everything" and written about Ignaz Semmelweis, the doctor who discovered the disease-fighting power of hand-washing in 1847. This new song will also include a brand new music video!
**Guest guitar solo by Garrett Peters
***Features guest vocals by Carlos Zema (Immortal Guardian) and guest solo by Garrett Peters 

WHAT ARE WE OFFERING? - All packages will include a digital download of the bonus material! Digital download and bonus material will be available October 8th when the digital release comes out! 




#1: Digital Download Package - $10
-Vinyl isn't for everyone! Want to support but don't want the vinyl just get yourself a digital copy!

#2: T-Shirt Package - $30
-Just going to listen on Spotify? Well okay, but how about a limited edition shirt?

#3: Vinyl Package - $40
-This is why we are here. Be one of the first to get your hands on the first pressing of our first ever vinyl!

#4: Digital Download + T-Shirt Package - $35
Want to own the album and a shirt but still not into vinyl? This one is for you!

#5: T-Shirt + Vinyl Package - $65
Get your hands on the vinyl and limited edition T-Shirt!

#6: Digital Download + T-Shirt + Vinyl Package - $70
Go ahead and snag all three items! 

#7: Signed Test Pressing - $180
These will be in short supply and only offered to a few. Get your hands on some of the test pressings that will be signed by the band!

#8: Ultimate Fan Package - $1000
-Free entry to any Helion Prime (not including major festivals)
-Lifetime subscription to all future Helion Prime Merch (this includes any limited edition items we may run on future Kickstarter or even Patreon) 
-All previous perks (besides signed testing pressing)

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We're EJ Olson and Chancelor Reeder, two childhood best friends who grew up playing music together in Portland, OR. We came together in 2019 to create 09 [OH-NINE]---a passion project at it's core, meant to be a celebration of everything we love as artists. We decided early on to forgo having a permanent front-person, and instead use this music as an outlet to create with some of our favorite singers!

 

What We Need & What You Get

For over a year, we've been working on writing and recording a series of singles, with the ultimate goal of releasing a full length album. So far, we've been completely self funded, and we're proud of what we've been able to accomplish on our own. However, the pandemic changed things for us back in March, when we both found ourselves suddenly out of work. Our plans for the album were pushed back, but we've continued to write music and collaborate remotely with some amazing artists! 

In order to finish the record, we're going to need a little help crossing the finish line. For studio time, mixing, mastering, manufacturing, distribution, featured artist costs, PR, music videos and other promotional material, we're looking at an additional cost upwards of $19,000. With this campaign though, we're asking for your help in funding our studio time, mixing, and distribution costs, so we can get this record finished the right way and into your hands ASAP!

The Costs:
Studio Time: $5400
Mixing & Mastering Costs: $2220
CD Manufacturing & Distribution: $850
Indiegogo Perks: $1140
Taxes and Fees: $840

The Album:
Our full length album will feature twelve tracks---remasters of our five previously released singles, as well as seven brand new songs! It will be produced, engineered, and mixed by the legend himself---Justin Abel.

Featured artists include:

  • Kellin Quinn (Sleeping With Sirens)
  • Rory Rodriguez (Dayseeker)
  • Malia Endres (Glacier Veins)
  • Cove Reber (ex-Saosin, Dead American)
  • Matty Mullins (Memphis May Fire)
  • Chris Ratzlaff (Fallstar)
  • Andrew Serino
  • Jamie Currie


We have several more incredible singers lined up for this record (yay!), but for now, they have to remain a secret (boo!).  Note that if we don't meet our goal, the funds we raise will still go directly toward studio time. If we exceed our goal, that money will go towards funding additional songs for the record!


 

The Perks

Everyone who chooses a physical perk will have their name appear in the album's liner notes!  (Note: Please reach out to the band if you are interested in purchasing the 'Featured Singer' perk, we'll work the details out together before commitment is needed from either party.)

 

Impact

Crowdfunding is a powerful tool that gives us as artists agency over what we create, and a platform to use our own voices, uninhibited by the workings of the music industry. By backing this campaign, you're putting the power back in the hands of creators! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough right now, and we understand that many folks are struggling due to the pandemic. If you're a fan of our music, but aren't able to back the cause, don't sweat it! If you still want to support the band, please share this campaign and tell all your friends who the heck we are!

story:
Click the "Back It" Button or Select One of the Amazing Perks From the Menu!

 

Who is Zoë Skye?

Zoë Skye is a 17-year-old singer-songwriter from St. Petersburg, FL.

While quarantined in 2020, she wrote a collection of songs that addressed the isolation and disconnection she (and her friends) experienced during the worldwide pandemic.

What We Need 

We need to raise $4,000 to cover various expenses, including:

  • Recording, mixing, and mastering the songs in a professional recording studio that employs the engineers and technicians that are vital to bringing these songs to life
  • Additional guest musicians, including piano, violin and trumpet
  • Photographers and graphic designers that will make Zoë (and the album) look amazing
  • Printing of a zine/booklet that will contain Zoë's journal of the writing and recording process, hand-written lyrics, illustrations and photography from the studio

 

What You Get

We really need your help in raising the funds for this project, and no amount is too small, but for those who can donate a little more, we have made some really special perks available, including:

  • Access to all final tracks (including bonus audio content) in a high-resolution MP3 format
  • Hand-drawn artwork inspired by the songs on the album
  • Ready-to-frame hand-written lyrics
  • A beautiful hand-made zine/booklet containing lyrics, illustrations and photography
  • And, a custom-written song for you by Zoë featuring the names, characters and story of your choice! 

 

Why Donate?

"Zoë Skye writes songs about love, distance, tension and growth that are cinematic in scope and delivered with an unnerving amount of soul. She's a multi-instrumentalist whose hooks and vocal melodies recall the classics of the Laurel Canyon era."

Not only do Zoë's songs need to be heard by the world but she will be gaining valuable experience in the studio, learning how to hire contractors, create and spend to a budget, manage a crew and lots of other moving parts, as well as produce an album from concept to completion.

 

Next Steps

  • Donate today.

  • Take advantage of some of these fantastic perks.

  • Most importantly, share this fundraiser with everyone you know. Every donation helps!

story:
WHO IS ROOKIN AND WHY DO THEY NEED ME

Rookin is a band of five friends who make historical folk-rock music and not much money. Some call it Americana; some call it dad-rock; and some call us from blocked numbers in Indiana demanding we pay off our debts or lose our knees. We began this journey awhile ago with a class project, a song cycle about the American civil war. At that point, we knew we would become very famous people. So we made some EPs, and released our debut LP, Unionism, on indie label Medical Records last year. And we thought, surely, by this point, we would be rich. We were mistaken.

It has come to our attention that Rookin is not a money-making proposition. In fact, quite the opposite. In July alone, we made $0.58 apiece. In the eyes of the IRS, Rookin is a puzzle. If we are audited, it will be because some money-minded man at the IRS simply wants to know why we have not filled the grievous money sink hole at the center of our wallets with cement and gone on to lives of purely compensated labor. And yet, Mr. Moneyman, here we are -- we are still compelled to make Rookin music, so much so that, less than a year after releasing Unionism, we had a whole other album's worth of material ready to go. So we went to New Hampshire, to an A-Frame house on a lake, a studio called Xanadeux. There, with ride-or-die producers Alex Allinson & Joe Dusenbury, synth guru Tony Norton, and bassist Z Hayes, we recorded the beginning of a record. We've been calling it Infinite Georgia.

We've been recording it in Boston since then; and in Brooklyn with producer Jeff Fettig. It sounds very different than Unionism. It took us three years to make that record, and in that time we became a proper band that plays together and isn't afraid to make things sound weird and wild. Some of the songs are brand new; some have been around for a long time and are only now ready to record; some of them we wrote live in the studio. We're very excited to share this music with everyone. 

INFINITE GEORGIA, FINITE CASH

We need to raise about $5,000 to cover the initial studio fees, money for our production team, and some of the money it will cost to get the record mastered. We will try to make this record even if we don't reach our goal, but we could use the help, and want to make this a process to be celebrated and shared. We came up with a bunch of things we'd like to give away to our friends and loved ones, and have priced them out here. We would be glad to have you join us on this never-ending journey to bring the long-held dream of Rookin closer to its fullest fruition.

story:
free is a collection of songs that explores the cycles, spirals and circles of life, death, love and nature. Looking back on the songs, I can feel that each one is an invitation, a doorway, to a world outside of binary thinking – a world full of nuance, magic, tension, and a full spectrum of color.

UPDATE: APRIL 15, 2021

Wow. After two months of crowdfunding (and a couple late contributions from a folks who just missed the end of the campaign), we raised just under $8,200 to fund the release of my new album “free”. I am in absolute awe and filled to the brim with gratitude. Thank you just doesn’t cut it. If you purchased a perk with your contribution, keep your eyes peeled for an email from me next month with more details!

Making and releasing music is an exhausting, exciting, overwhelming, terrifying, empowering, liberating, draining, fulfilling, lonely, and joyous process (to say the least). The experience exists far beyond the boundaries of binary thinking - there is no one box or word or category that can encapsulate its multifaceted magic. And then, when you add a village of incredible humans who say “yes let’s make this happen”, the whole thing takes on new depth and meaning.

The support this project has received from all of you - my incredible community of fans, friends, family and fellow musicians - is deeply humbling. I am incredibly honored and forever grateful for your support! Thank you so much to everyone who contributed to or shared the project.

These songs mean a lot to me, and I cannot wait to get them out into the world. This will be my very first vinyl release!!! Eee!! I wiggle with excitement every time I think about putting the needle down on my own record! And it’s all thanks to YOU!

Sigh… THANK YOU

Oh! And stay tuned for announcements coming your way next week about the first single from the album ... everyone who contributed to the campaign will get a sneak peak listen to the song!

- - - - - -

UPDATE: MARCH 22, 2021

Holy cow. We’ve made it to 100% funded! Thank you thank you thank you! We still have three weeks left on the campaign, so I’m now setting my sights on a stretch goal of $9,000. If we make it there, the extra $2,500 will be used to cover the cost of pressing vinyl!!

  • $2,000 to press vinyl
  • $500 to ship the LPs

If you’ve already contributed and chosen a perk that includes a physical CD, keep an eye out for an email from me very soon with info about how to upgrade your perk to vinyl!

For everyone else, there are two new vinyl related perks for you to choose from: The Vinyl Vixen and The Vinyl Bundle! Check em out!

I am just absolutely overflowing with gratitude. Thank you all so much for helping me make this happen. Anything that happens from here on out is just icing on an already magnificent cake.

With all my love and gratitude,
Mally

- - - - - - - - - -

ABOUT THE PROJECT

I recorded the album in February 2020 with the help of Evan Hamilton and Mike McKenzie. Holed up in a wee flat outside Edinburgh, Scotland, the three of us dove deep into the music, arranging and producing each song as we went. The process was intuitive, collaborative and organic – full of missteps, laughter, happy accidents, and moments of pure brilliance. I am so proud of what we captured during those six days.  

Now, a year later, I am in the throes of creativity - collaborating with photographers, artists, videographers, and sound engineers to bring the music and art of free to life. I cannot wait to share it all with you!

But I need your help to make it happen!

What your contributions mean…

Making an album is an incredibly expensive endeavor – it takes time, courage, faith and a pretty big chunk of change. By contributing to my campaign, you’ll be helping me to pay for:

  • Musician fees
  • Recording & production expenses
  • Artwork & photography
  • Music videos
  • Marketing & promotion
  • Printing the album
  • Merchandise

If we surpass our goal of $6,500, I may even be able to print vinyl (a lifelong dream)!! There are lots of great perks to choose from, or you can simply donate.

I know from past experience that it takes a village to bring a project like this to life, so I hope you will consider donating and being a part of my village!
