story:
Hi! I’m Annie, and I’m an independent singer/songwriter from upstate NY. I pursue music because I love it, but recording and releasing music is a very expensive process. My debut album, Garden Bed, was just released, and I am hoping to raise enough money to cover merch, physical copies, mixing/mastering services, copyright registration, and PR. Anything you can give is greatly appreciated!

 

Why Contribute?

For those of you who are unfamiliar with the music industry, record labels supply their artists with the resources to produce an album. As an independent artist, I am responsible for funding all of the above on my own. I hope to raise enough money to cover the high costs that go into producing a record.

 

What You'll Get

Here are some of the perks you could receive!

  • Signed CD
  • Signed Vinyl
  • Garden Bed T-shirt
  • Long Sleeve Shirt
  • Limited Edition Debut EP
  • Handwritten Lyric Sheets of your choice
  • Garden Bed Stickers

 

About Me

Music has been my passion since I began classical piano training at 6 years old. Around that time I started writing jingles, which eventually evolved into songs. I’m heavily influenced by rock n' roll classics, such as the Beatles and the Rolling Stones, and alternative artists like Lana Del Rey and Lorde.

 

I  began recording my first EP, 'Dreams Like This' with Nashville producer, David Flint in 2015. The EP featured five original tracks and was released on January 1, 2017. That same year, I began my freshman year at the College of Saint Rose as a music industry major. There, I formed a band to back up my original music. Since then,  I have played at popular music venues, including the Hollow and the Low Beat. 

 

In 2018, I was awarded the Producer's Choice for the 'Celebration of Music' PBS special in Troy, NY, hosted by Ethan Bortnick. I was rewarded with a trip to LA where I was taped performing my original song, 'Andy Warhol'. The recording will be aired internationally in 2021. 

 

On March 26th, 2021, I dropped my debut indie-pop album Garden Bed. I wrote all the songs, and produced all but one track. I also played several instruments, such as the trumpet, piano, guitar, and ukulele, while arranged string quartet scores for strings in "Kaleidoscope" and "Ashamed." So far the album has been widely praised by American Songwriter, the Times Union, and NYS Music.

One month later, I was voted the best local performer in New York's Capital Region by readers of the Times Union. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, that's okay! Other ways you can help include streaming my music, following me on social media, and sharing my music. You can also sign up for my newsletter on my website to stay in the loop!

story:
You can be part of new art

After seven years of touring across Canada and the United States, I took some time off in late 2019/early 2020 to reset, reflect, and recover from the chaos of being on the road. In those winter months, I wrote most of the songs that have gone on to become my fifth full-length album. These are introspective, personal songs, bold and honest, raw and vulnerable.

I had no idea that we'd all be spending our days at home just a few months later, looking for connection, wrestling with our quiet thoughts that suddenly became loud in the absence of activity.

I had one main goal for this album - Make something beautiful.

I wanted to showcase these songs in lush, gorgeous soundscapes. Songs that call out in moments of fear, anxiety, and loneliness. And songs of celebration, hope, healing, and renewal. The gold in the grey.

Don't have a CD player anymore? In addition to CDs and digital tracks, this album will also be released in a postcard format.

I created an 11x14-inch acrylic-on-canvas painting inspired by each song on the album and one that will be featured as the album cover art. Images of these paintings will be made into postcards (each with a download code for the song or album included).

So much of the writing and production process for this album felt...painterly...where songs and sonic landscapes came together first as washes of colour, melodies and poetry, musical brushstrokes, gradually detailed and refined. It felt natural to continue that conversation on canvas. And you'll get a little bit of original art to go along with the music.


How you can help

Making an album is expensive. I'm an independent artist trying to make something new in a world of Spotify playlists, Facebook ads, and YouTube video monetization.

I don't want to make an album for them. I want to make an album for YOU and I would love for you to be a part of it.

Your contributions will get me to the next production milestones - mixing, mastering, and manufacturing - so I can bring you new music in Spring 2021.

Perks include: Being among the very first to hear the new album, one-of-a-kind original artwork, personalized song dedications, and more!


Best laid plans

Like many plans in 2020, this project didn't quite roll out as expected. COVID-19 threw a few surprise challenges my way and delayed the album production, so I wanted to wait until I knew the project was back on track before launching this campaign. I'm delighted to report that after a lot of waiting, observing all public health protocols, and with the help of some innovative technology, I have been able to record this album the way I'd hoped, with the dream team I always wanted.

The first part of this project was largely made in isolation, but now I can bring you along on this ride. I want to share what's been happening at kitchen tables, in tiny sound booths, and over fragile WIFI connections. After months of feeling alone, let's move forward together. Let's make something beautiful.


Your good word goes a long way

I know money is tight right now. If you can't support this project financially, you can still help by spreading the word about the campaign - share the link to this page on your social media, or email your friends about it!

Something really helpful you could do for me that is totally free: Subscribe to my YouTube Channel! If I get 1000 subscribers, I can start offering live-streamed content through the platform using my mobile device.

story:
If you're reading this, you probably know that Shearwater has always lurked on the fringes of what's sometimes called "the music business"; and that the rise of streaming services, and the decline of physical sales, have made it hard for bands like us to keep making and releasing music. 

We've worked with some excellent labels over the years—but we've never escaped the cycle of needing advances to pay for the production of albums that never recoup; we haven't seen any profit, for example, on any of the albums we've released since 2005.  And making an income from streaming royalties requires an audience in the millions, if not tens of millions— a goal I don't expect we'll ever meet. (I'm not sure, to be honest, that it's a good goal in the first place.)  

But this album is different, because we're no longer under contract. So we're asking our friends and allies to help us make it. 

We're trying to raise at least $50k to write, record, mix, master, press, design, distribute, and publicize a new full-length Shearwater album, for release in late 2020—an effort that will take months of work by many people. 

Record-making costs less than it once did; but to create an LP that meets the standards of our best work, this is the minimum we need. It would let us work with our friends and heroes, and grant us the most important freedom of all: the freedom to make missteps, and correct them.

If we can raise more than this, the quality of the record will improve, and new sonic adventures will be possible. (For an idea of what this means, scroll down to the bottom of this page, where we've used our crystal ball to predict the album's reviews based on its budget.)

But above all:

Thank you for reading, listening, and being here. 

—JM/SW

 

Perks we're offering to encourage your support:

[Note: if these numbers seem steep, bear in mind that this isn't an album pre-sale; it's a fundraising effort to make the album in the first place.  If we can raise enough to make it, there'll be a more traditional pre-sale later on.] 

$25 - Incorporeal Music - a 24-bit, lossless digital download of the new album before its physical release in late 2020, made available to you before anyone else. (Image by Kahn and Selesnick, from City of Salt.)

$50 - Incorporeal Music, Metaphysical Artifact - a digital download of the new album, plus access to an exclusive Instagram page documenting the making of the record in late 2019-early 2020.

$75 - Ones and Zeroes Complete - all above, plus access to a personal video diary by JM from the new album sessions.

$100 - Indelible Artifact (CD/Vinyl LP) - all digital incentives above, plus a signed CD or vinyl LP  of the new album (your choice). 

$150 - "Drowning World" Poker Deck - all digital incentives above, plus Kahn and Selesnick's beautiful, limited-edition panoramic poker deck, which inspired their album cover for Rook.  This is no ordinary deck; each suit can be laid end-to-end to form a panorama of K&S's whimsical vision of a world under water.  

$200 - Jet Plane & Oxbow: First Edition LP - all incentives above (ie. all except the K&S poker deck), plus one of the last few copies of the limited first run "Loser" Edition of Jet Plane & Oxbow on beautiful colored vinyl. US Edition. Sealed.

$200 - Shearwater plays Lodger LP - all incentives above (ie. all except the K&S poker deck), plus one of the last few copies of the Shearwater Plays Lodger (2016) vinyl LP and a tote bag from the Berlin Trilogy performances in 2018. 

$250 - Standard Immortality* - all digital incentives above, plus *your name listed in the album credits as an Executive Producer, a signed, personalized vinyl LP or CD of the album upon its release,

$275 - Deluxe Immortality* - all digital incentives above, plus *your name listed in the album credits as an Executive Producer, a signed, personalized vinyl LP of the album upon its release, and one of the last physical copies of Missing Islands, a collection of demos and outtakes from  Rook, The Golden Archipelago, and  Animal Joy. 

 

Physical items (which include all digital perks above, your name in the album credits, and a signed vinyl copy of the album):

 

$350 - Berlin Trilogy Grab Bag - A commemorative tote bag from our 2018 live performance of David Bowie's 1977-79 "Berlin Trilogy" of Low, "Heroes", and Lodger for WNYC, containing a program from the shows, a download code for the entire set, printed sheet music we used for the instrumental songs (transcribed by Emily Lee), the harmonica JM played on "A New Career In A New Town," and one of the last sealed vinyl copies of 2016's Shearwater Plays Lodger.  

$400 - The Last Golden Dossier - The last unclaimed copy of the Golden Dossier, a 75-page unbound book we produced to accompany The Golden Archipelago (limited edition of 300). It’s an intricate collection of images and artifacts from around the world, sealed in an envelope decorated with handmade rubber stamps designed by Nicholas Kahn. Signed & numbered.

$400 - Beyond The Last Golden Dossier - Update! Since the last copy sold out almost immediately, a friend of the band has donated his personal copy of the Golden Dossier to assist the campaign.

$400 - Beyond Beyond The Last Golden Dossier - Update! Since the last last copy sold out almost immediately, another friend of the band has donated her personal copy of the Golden Dossier to assist the campaign.

$400 - Beyond (x3) The Last Golden Dossier - Update! Since the last, last, last (!!!) copy sold, another friend of the band has donated her personal copy of the Golden Dossier to assist the campaign.

$400 - Shearwater with Will Johnson Poster - this unframed, 11x17 silk-screened poster from 2004/2005, created by artist Mark Pedini, comes from the early days of the band, before the Matador or Sub Pop albums, before the Island Arc.  Probably created for the premiere of Winged Life, though I can't be entirely sure.  Signed. (JM)

$500 Hand-typed Lyrics by JM -  A complete, unique set of hand-typed lyrics from the new album, typed on the same Smith-Corona Coronet Super 12 JM used to make the credits, lyrics, and other ephemera from The Golden Archipelago.  Guaranteed to include unique, authentic typographical errors and corrections in pen.  Signed and numbered—and limited to five copies. 

$500 (CD) / $750 (LP) - The Complete Island Arc Box Set -  A few years ago, we made a set of 100 Complete Island Arc "digital box sets". At the time, a few people asked for a physical box set too. We finally made a handful - 3 CD and 1 LP. They include the hand-made wood download code plank, the segment of Rook master tape, and most importantly the bonus recordings included in the 2016 limited edition of 100. See our website for the full contents of the digital bonuses package.

[A note on the "test pressings" below: A "test pressing" is a standard, 12" vinyl LP produced by the pressing plant from, sent to the band for final approval before the full run of LPs is made as a quality control measure; in short, they're the first vinyl copies of the albums to be produced, and have a blank center label.] 

$500 - Shearwater Plays Lodger Test Pressing - JM's vinyl LP test pressing of 2016's live performance of Bowie's Lodger. Mastered by Greg Calbi. Signed. 

$650 - Winged Life Test Pressing - JM's vinyl LP test pressing of 2004's Winged Life, first issued on vinyl in 2011. Signed.   

$1000 - Rook Studio Notes - this item, generously donated by a dear friend of the band,  consists of a unique sheaf of studio notes and ephemera from the sessions for 2008's Rook album.  Includes a few track sheets, a hand-drawn stage plot for the New York premiere of the album, and a  o-do-list of overdubs for every track recorded during the session (including outtakes), color-coded according to a system I no longer understand. (JM)

$1000 - A New JM Instrumental - JM will compose and record a unique 5 minute (or more, at his discretion) instrumental piece for you, delivered to you as a digital file—and you may choose up to three adjectives to guide, inspire, or confound him.  (JM wanted to call this "Musical Dunk Tank").

$1000 - Animal Joy Test Pressing - JM's vinyl LP test pressing of Animal Joy.  Mastered by Greg Calbi. Signed.  

$1000 - Jet Plane and Oxbow Test Pressing and Tour Posters - JM's 2x vinyl LP test pressing of Jet Plane and Oxbow.  Mastered by Greg Calbi. Signed. Includes a JPOB European tour poster and an art-print poster from our show at Vera in Groningen, NL.

$1500 - Framed Rook Premiere Poster - A silk-screened, limited edition poster by artist Mark Pedini from the  2008 Austin premiere of Rook, in a museum-quality frame hand-built by Sam Sanford.  This is the only extant copy of this poster, to our knowledge.  Signed by  Mark Pedini, and by JM. (Pictured here without frame; poster dimensions ~22"x ~22"). 

$1500 - Live Recordings, Demos, And First Editions: Smash and Grab - This is a 32-disc  stack of live recordings, demos, and first-edition copies from my personal archive, from radio sessions, board feeds, etc.  I can't vouch for all of these performances—the thought of listening to them fills me with dread—but I'm certain there are  gems in there; and these are the only existing copies of this material.  This package also includes signed, first-edition copies of Buteo Buteo (my 2004 handmade solo release), Shearwater is Enron (instrumental music by the Golden Archipelago lineup), and Bursera graveolens (demos from Palo Santo). (Note: This is for your ears only; you may not publish or otherwise release it; see FAQ). (JM) 

$2000 - The Island Arc Guitar - My nylon-string acoustic guitar, bought in Tasmania in 1997 and used to write Palo Santo in the Galápagos in 2006, Rook in 2008, and The Golden Archipelago in 2010.  Played on Palo Santo, The Golden Archipelago, "A Wake for the Minotaur" (my duet with Sharon Van Etten from Fellow Travelers), and a few non-SW releases.  It's a fragile, humble instrument, but it's been a true friend for 23 years, and many thousands of miles. Also includes a CD copy of Missing Islands: a collection of demo recordings and outtakes from Rook, The Golden Archipelago, and Animal Joy.  (JM)  

 

Plus one truly bonkers option:

 

$150,000 - A Fateful Choice  

("Two Streets" Image by Kahn & Selesnick, from City of Salt. )

For this amount, we will write, record, mix, master, and press TWO full-length albums.  We'll then send both to you, and you will choose the one we release. The other will remain only with you, for the enjoyment of you and those in your presence. 

There are a few restrictions: you may sell your single copy if you wish, but SW retains publishing and master rights to the songs and recording, and if you or anyone else leaks the album to the internet, we reserve the right to sell it ourselves in any format.  But so long as you keep it close, we won't. (See the FAQ for more details.)

 

Last but not least: fake (but likely) reviews for a new SW album, by budget:

 

$10k -  "Meiburg & Co. sound frantic and disorganized, as if everything was done in a great hurry."

$20k - "A serviceable Shearwater record is welcome enough, as far as that goes; but does anyone really need it?"

$25k - "Once again, Shearwater's reach exceeds their grasp.  You can hear them straining to pull off something grand and remarkable, but it never takes flight."

$30k - "There are glorious ingredients in this album, but they often fail to cohere; as if too many big decisions were made at the last minute. You wonder what might have happened if they'd been able to take it further." 

$35k- "Shearwater sound as if they forgot to step back and consider what they were making, until it was too late."

$50k - "The album bears the marks of work and risk, of time and care, of surfaces buffed to a high gloss, considered, and joyfully roughed up again. Absorbing, fascinating, powerful." 

$75k - "Achieves a depth and breadth of sound (and vision) very rare in pop music these days."

$100k - "Shearwater were always a promising band, one that seemed as if they were about to do something extraordinary.  Friends, this is that album."  

$150k - "Some bands treat orchestral textures as a crutch, or ponderous filigree, but Shearwater make them an integral part of this singular album".

$200k - "The grand gestures finally connect. Shearwater conjure entire worlds and landscapes, enveloping and surrounding the listener, and consistently (and happily) surprise. Magnificent and fearless." 

$250k -  "This album is not for everyone; but some listeners will want to be buried with it."

$300k - "Meiburg sounds strangely abstracted, as if he's become a little too unconcerned with the cares of this world."

$500k - "The wildly successful crowdfunding campaign for this album raised hopes (and eyebrows) everywhere. But where did all that money go? What the hell is this album?"

$600k - "Two words: AIR Lyndhurst". 

$750k - "I honestly do not know how to describe this record.  Is that a good thing?"

$1000k - "Dear God. This album broke me. Someone, please, make it stop."
story_txt: If you're reading this, you probably know that Shearwater has always lurked on the fringes of what's sometimes called "the music business"; and that the rise of streaming services, and the decline of physical sales, have made it hard for bands like us to keep making and releasing music. We've worked with some excellent labels over the years—but we've never escaped the cycle of needing advances to pay for the production of albums that never recoup; we haven't seen any profit, for example, on any of the albums we've released since 2005.  And making an income from streaming royalties requires an audience in the millions, if not tens of millions— a goal I don't expect we'll ever meet. (I'm not sure, to be honest, that it's a good goal in the first place.)  But this album is different, because we're no longer under contract. So we're asking our friends and allies to help us make it. We're trying to raise at least $50k to write, record, mix, master, press, design, distribute, and publicize a new full-length Shearwater album, for release in late 2020—an effort that will take months of work by many people. Record-making costs less than it once did; but to create an LP that meets the standards of our best work, this is the minimum we need. It would let us work with our friends and heroes, and grant us the most important freedom of all: the freedom to make missteps, and correct them.If we can raise more than this, the quality of the record will improve, and new sonic adventures will be possible. (For an idea of what this means, scroll down to the bottom of this page, where we've used our crystal ball to predict the album's reviews based on its budget.)But above all:Thank you for reading, listening, and being here. —JM/SW Perks we're offering to encourage your support:[Note: if these numbers seem steep, bear in mind that this isn't an album pre-sale; it's a fundraising effort to make the album in the first place.  If we can raise enough to make it, there'll be a more traditional pre-sale later on.] $25 - Incorporeal Music - a 24-bit, lossless digital download of the new album before its physical release in late 2020, made available to you before anyone else. (Image by Kahn and Selesnick, from City of Salt.)$50 - Incorporeal Music, Metaphysical Artifact - a digital download of the new album, plus access to an exclusive Instagram page documenting the making of the record in late 2019-early 2020.$75 - Ones and Zeroes Complete - all above, plus access to a personal video diary by JM from the new album sessions.$100 - Indelible Artifact (CD/Vinyl LP) - all digital incentives above, plus a signed CD or vinyl LP  of the new album (your choice). $150 - "Drowning World" Poker Deck - all digital incentives above, plus Kahn and Selesnick's beautiful, limited-edition panoramic poker deck, which inspired their album cover for Rook.  This is no ordinary deck; each suit can be laid end-to-end to form a panorama of K&S's whimsical vision of a world under water.  $200 - Jet Plane & Oxbow: First Edition LP - all incentives above (ie. all except the K&S poker deck), plus one of the last few copies of the limited first run "Loser" Edition of Jet Plane & Oxbow on beautiful colored vinyl. story:
Short Summary

Shelterheart was born out of Christ-centered community. The songs bear testimony to God's work in my life through His Church, and especially through a few of my closest friends in a particularly trying season. I didn't dream of these songs being recorded so soon until September 2020 when I connected with the talented Asher Peterson out in Nashville. I was so blown away by his project NAMO as well as his work with his siblings Aedan and Skye in Wake Low that I made quick haste (quicker than your usual haste) to connect through email. We connected via phone and set up studio time set in Nashville with him as producer. 

(It's worth mentioning that Asher is the son of a guy named Andrew Peterson, who you probably know a little about if you know me well, as I talk incessantly about the impact of Andrew's music on both my art and in my walk with Christ.)

With Asher at the helm (and some extra help from my longtime collaborator and full-time friend Allen Odell), I believe these songs have the potential to encourage a lot of people. My greatest desire is to serve you with them and help you realize you're not alone in your hurt, nor should you be alone. I hope these songs move your heart to lean into both the heart of Jesus and into the hearts of those who lean into the heart of Jesus. Don't believe the hype. All is not relational desolation in this post-COVID world, circa 2021. I hope this record can bear witness to that and prime your heart for the Better Country on the road we were made to walk together. 

When I think of this record, I don't think about an art project. I just think about my friends.

What We Need & What You Get

Of course, this brings me to why I'm starting a campaign. To make the best record I can possibly make, it requires a little thing called money, which is a little thing I'm personally short on. Asher and I have talked figures and he's given me a generous offer of $6,000 (far lower than the average price for a record of this magnitude) to mix and master the record for the entirety of August. This feels like a lot to ask for, as I've never asked anyone for money apart from family and close friends, but I believe that the perks of contributing will be more than worth it for you. Among other perks, you'll receive:

  • The full 15-song album when it releases (approx. Nov. 2021) 
  • An exclusive, stripped-down 8-song companion EP of entirely new songs included with the November album release before it goes to streaming platforms next year (approx. Nov. 2021)
  • A deluxe edition including two B-sides, two demos, two covers, and two alternate versions of previously released tracks (est. Nov. 2021)

The goals of this record are threefold:

  • Firstly, to create a dynamic, yet cohesive album listening experience that's fresh and unique... I believe this entire volume of songs to be the strongest I've written in my short career and that it communicates my heart as well as anything I could make... My hope for this record is that 20 years down the line, if the Lord extends both my years and my career, listeners will point newcomers to this record as the best place to start.
  • Secondly, and most importantly, to encourage the listener with the hope of the Gospel, specifically as it relates to Christ-centered community... This album is full of personal stories of friendship that I hope can be a counterpoint in this age of social media chaos and COVID-wrought isolation... I pray you can find yourself in these stories and be moved to run into the arms of the Savior Who lives to be with you at your most alone. And I pray you find yourself some comrades on this wartime side of eternity. 
  • Finally, to ultimately build a bigger platform (if even slightly) to better champion other indie artists and friends who are trying to bless as many people with their music as possible... If I desire for my voice to be amplified through this record, it's only to amplify the voices of those around me. There is incredible music being made by incredible people that I intend to push as much as (if not more than) my own music. Yes, I want my own music to be heard, but I really want my friends to be heard. If this record can expand my reach so I can pester those new listeners with the incredible work my friends are doing, that would be insane.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially in these crazy times, there are a few other ways to contribute:

  • Spread the word on this project via social media platforms
  • Donate however much or little as you desire... The perks are preset, but you can still donate... If you can't give a dollar, feel free to give a cent...
  • Please pray for us as we work on this project, that the Lord would provide what we need to make it, and that He would use the record to grow His people and encourage those who are reeling from the chaos and isolation of the last year... My chief desire is that these songs would provide a shelter for people, true to its name, and make them aware of the presence of Jesus... Pray especially to that aim.

 

Keep going,

Ben

Shelterheart

1. Green Again

2. There Are Others Here

3. Stormbound (Only Way Out)

4. You Lift My Head

5. Pour Me Out

6. In Arms

7. There's a Darkness

8. God in the Flesh

9. Strange Roads

10. Hartsfield 

11. Newhall Song

12. 73 in Silence

13. Shelterheart

14. Jesus in the Valley

15. Better Country

The songs bear testimony to God's work in my life through His Church, and especially through a few of my closest friends in a particularly trying season. I didn't dream of these songs being recorded so soon until September 2020 when I connected with the talented Asher Peterson out in Nashville. I was so blown away by his project NAMO as well as his work with his siblings Aedan and Skye in Wake Low that I made quick haste (quicker than your usual haste) to connect through email. We connected via phone and set up studio time set in Nashville with him as producer. (It's worth mentioning that Asher is the son of a guy named Andrew Peterson, who you probably know a little about if you know me well, as I talk incessantly about the impact of Andrew's music on both my art and in my walk with Christ.)With Asher at the helm (and some extra help from my longtime collaborator and full-time friend Allen Odell), I believe these songs have the potential to encourage a lot of people. My greatest desire is to serve you with them and help you realize you're not alone in your hurt, nor should you be alone. I hope these songs move your heart to lean into both the heart of Jesus and into the hearts of those who lean into the heart of Jesus. Don't believe the hype. All is not relational desolation in this post-COVID world, circa 2021. I hope this record can bear witness to that and prime your heart for the Better Country on the road we were made to walk together. When I think of this record, I don't think about an art project. I just think about my friends.

What We Need & What You Get
Of course, this brings me to why I'm starting a campaign. To make the best record I can possibly make, it requires a little thing called money, which is a little thing I'm personally short on. Asher and I have talked figures and he's given me a generous offer of $6,000 (far lower than the average price for a record of this magnitude) to mix and master the record for the entirety of August. This feels like a lot to ask for, as I've never asked anyone for money apart from family and close friends, but I believe that the perks of contributing will be more than worth it for you. Among other perks, you'll receive:

The full 15-song album when it releases (approx. Nov. 2021) 
An exclusive, stripped-down 8-song companion EP of entirely new songs included with the November album release before it goes to streaming platforms next year (approx. Nov. 2021)
A deluxe edition including two B-sides, two demos, two covers, and two alternate versions of previously released tracks (est. Nov. 2021)


The goals of this record are threefold:

Firstly, to create a dynamic, yet cohesive album listening experience that's fresh and unique... I believe this entire volume of songs to be the strongest I've written in my short career and that it communicates my heart as well as anything I could make... My hope for this record is that 20 years down the line, if the Lord extends both my years and my career, listeners will point newcomers to this record as the best place to start.
Secondly, and most importantly, to encourage the listener with the hope of the Gospel, specifically as it relates to Christ-centered community... This album is full of personal stories of friendship that I hope can be a counterpoint in this age of social media chaos and COVID-wrought isolation... I pray you can find yourself in these stories and be moved to run into the arms of the Savior Who lives to be with you at your most alone. And I pray you find yourself some comrades on this wartime side of eternity. 
Finally, to ultimately build a bigger platform (if even slightly) to better champion other indie artists and friends who are trying to bless as many people with their music as possible... If I desire for my voice to be amplified through this record, it's only to amplify the voices of those around me. There is incredible music being made by incredible people that I intend to push as much as (if not more than) my own music. Yes, I want my own music to be heard, but I really want my friends to be heard. If this record can expand my reach so I can pester those new listeners with the incredible work my friends are doing, that would be insane.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute financially in these crazy times, there are a few other ways to contribute:

Spread the word on this project via social media platforms
Donate however much or little as you desire... The perks are preset, but you can still donate... If you can't give a dollar, feel free to give a cent...
Please pray for us as we work on this project, that the Lord would provide what we need to make it, and that He would use the record to grow His people and encourage those who are reeling from the chaos and isolation of the last year... My chief desire is that these songs would provide a shelter for people, true to its name, and make them aware of the presence of Jesus... Pray especially to that aim.

 
Keep going,BenShelterheart
1. Green Again
2. There Are Others Here
3. Stormbound (Only Way Out)
4. You Lift My Head
5. Pour Me Out
6. In Arms
7. There's a Darkness
8. God in the Flesh
9. Strange Roads
10. Hartsfield 
11. Newhall Song
12. 73 in Silence
13. Shelterheart
14. Jesus in the Valley
15. Better Country

story:
Overview

Ookla the Mok's Rand Bellavia is releasing a solo album of short songs.  Over 40 Songs in Under 40 Minutes!

Short Summary

Hi everyone.  Rand here.  I've been writing and performing songs for over 35 years in bands like Ookla the Mok and Via Bella.   If you're a fan of Dr. Demento you've heard my stuff.  Ookla the Mok had the most requested song on Dr. Demento in 2012 ("Tantric Yoda") and 2013 ("Mwahaha"), and the songs "F. People" (2003) and "Stop Talking About Comic Books or I'll Kill You" (1998) appeared on Dr. Demento albums.  My voice is the first thing you hear on the Gym Class Heroes' hit "Cupid's Chokehold," and I co-wrote the theme to Disney's Fillmore.  

But enough about me.  Let's talk about my quarantine album!  This will be a true solo album, meaning that all the songs were written, produced, and performed by me.  I'm not even using drum loops or programming.  For better or worse, the guitar, bass, and drums were physically played by me.

The album will be mixed and mastered by Jeff Thomas, whose production work can be heard on Ookla's Oh Okay LA and Via Bella's The Way of Beauty.

Most of the music for this project was written over the last year, but a lot of the lyrics were written a decade ago as part of the online Instapoem project I did with my friend Debbie Ridpath Ohi.  These poems were conceived and written in under five minutes (inspired by reader-supplied prompts), which explains why they (and the resulting songs) are so short. 

The track listing is still coming together, but it's will definitely have over 40 songs.  Here's a baker's dozen of the song titles:

  • I Lost a Pun Contest
  • Jazz Drawers 
  • The Shining
  • Unpopular Star Wars Character in an Unsecured Vessel
  • Our Children Will Abandon Their Bodies
  • Will Smith
  • I Don't Know Why: A Short Play for Two Actors (Woman and Fly)
  • Who Watches the Watchmen Watchmen
  • FiveFourSeasons
  • N
  • Wild Whirled
  • Uncle Ar
  • Squirm Dirty Worm

What You Get

You can pre-order the album (digitally or as a physical CD) and you can also support the project by availing yourself of the following perks:

  • Demos, process tracks, alternate mixes, and other bonus tracks
  • An eBook containing the lyrics in their original poetic form, along with track-by-track liner notes
  • Access to a Zoom listening party where you can hear the entire album before it is released and ask me whatever questions you might have about it
  • Zoom concerts
  • Your short poem or lyric set to music by me

...and more!

What I Need

This project has already been recorded, which means a.) no budget is needed for recording, and b.) turnaround should be fairly short! 

Here's the budget:

$1,000 -- Mixing

$300 -- Mastering

$1,500 -- Duplication (compact disc/digipak)

$750 -- Graphic Design (CD package and PDF eBook)

$350 -- Registration/Distribution/Promotion

$100 -- Crowd-Sourcing Fees

Total Goal: $4,000

If I exceed the goal, I will create a more elaborate package and expand the promotional campaign, but please know that you will receive the perks you select even if the budget is not met.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? That doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out by sharing my campaign on social media! 
  • Indiegogo's share tools make spreading the word super convenient! You can just copy the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update, or click on the share icons to share through your social media networks.

story:
Mei Tehom // Waters of the Deep
I am a rabbinical student, musician and mythweaver who draws on the rich narrative and musical traditions of Judaism to create emotional openings for people to discover connection, curiosity and healing. Mei Tehom is a two song EP that reflects my study of Jewish mythology and my own personal journey with grief, healing and mental health. The goal of this fundraiser is to raise money to cover the costs of making the EP and also give tzedakah (charity) in honor of my late father, Jules Tygiel. The money from this fundraiser will be split equally between the artists who worked on the album and the Bay Area Jewish Healing Center, a non-profit  dedicated to providing Jewish spiritual care to those living with illness, to those caring for the ill, and to the bereaved. Mei Tehom will be released on Thursday August 5 alongside a special musical storytelling event on zoom at 7pm EST exploring themes of grief and trauma healing through the lens of Jewish mythology.  

The World Hangs in the Fins of the Leviathan
In addition to representing my Jewish musical voice, this album represents my fascination with and explorations of the vibrant world of Jewish mythology and storytelling. Encircling the music of this EP are hidden stories of the creation of the world, King David’s encounter with the Waters of the Deep, tears both Divine and human and an unlikely anchor for the world that surrounds us. In order to bring some of these subterranean stories to the surface, I am partnering with Hadar's Rising Song Institute to host a special EP release event on August 5th that will draw on these influences. The event will weave together ancient stories alongside personal reflections on my own journey with grief, mental health and healing into a musical ritual helping to transition from the pain and sorrow of Tisha B’Av towards the healing and reparative work of Elul and the High Holidays. Click here to register for the event! 

Supporting Healing 
To honor the importance of ongoing healing work in the Jewish world, half of the proceeds from this fundraiser will go to the Bay Area Jewish Healing Center (BAJHC), an amazing organization who helped provide spiritual care for me and my mother following my father’s death when I was a teenager.  Your support will help the BAJHC provide spiritual care and healing for many others in my hometown of San Francisco Bay Area.  

Collaborators
My artistic collaborators helped turn this EP into something really special and the other half of the donations will allow me to compensate those artists for their amazing work. Vocalist and producer Eitan Kantor sang harmony, helped develop the arrangement and porduced produced and helped imagine the arrangement for Eitz. Master vocalist and improvisor Rebekka Goldsmith also wrote parts and lent her voice to Eitz. Finally, the incredible artwork, blending themes from Jewish mythology that inspired the music, was created by Unknown Relic (Stephen Wilson).

 

Please note that donations to this campaign are not tax-deductible. Since this project is totally independently produced and the funds from this campaign are being split between the artists and a separate non-profit, Indiegogo isn't able to issue tax receipts for donations. If you would like to make a ttax-deductible contribution to the Bay Area Jewish Healing Center, visit their website at https://jewishhealingcenter.org/get-involved/do...

story:
Sharing stories through music

We're proud to present the new look Lights And Lines, a music collective and record label where curation sits at the heart of everything we do. 

Members of this group have self-released music, managed bands, booked tours, worked on PR campaigns, written reviews, hosted podcasts, put on gigs, run festivals, and loads more. We've been talking about setting up a label for years and now is the time to seize the moment.

Our intention is to share amazing stories through music.

Stories have the power to conjure up feelings of hope or despair and choose to bring us light or darkness. They can be based on fiction or fact, some are poignant, some are sad, some are inspiring. Whatever the function or outcome of a story, the idea of narrative is an innate part of what makes us human.

In 2021 we believe that in a world where everything is digital it can be rewarding to have something to hold...

We’re working with artists to offer something tangible and physical to listeners - like CDs, Tapes, and Records. We'll then enhance these with digital assets such as ezines, downloadable artwork and podcasts - creating some truly unique, hybrid listening experiences along the way.

What we need & what you get

We have a number of releases in the pipeline and we're keen to make an impact straight away. The money raised in this campaign will go towards producing best quality physical releases, and help us amplify our collective voice in more places. In return you've got 3 great options to choose from, and a couple of combinations / variations - we have kept these MEGA simple to start off with but are happy to add more if in demand....

  • Option 1: Antisocial Tee. By popular demand, the joint winner of our design vote a few months back, probably mostly because of the swearing! Buy a tee, support the label, look awesome while you do - job done.
  • Option 2: Collective Tee. The other joint winner racking up the same percentage of votes was this brilliant Collective definition Tee. We’ve gone so punk with these we didn’t even bother putting our own logo on them so you better wear them and tell people about us!
  • Option 3: The big one. A very reasonably priced 12 month subscription. If we release a CD, you’ll get one. Cassette Tape, you’ll get it. You get 1 of everything! Plus you get all the digital stuff too! Oh and we’ll throw a tee in!

What's in the pipeline for option 3?

Based on what we know so far the proposed package includes:
 
1 x Tee (Choose from 2 options)
2 x EP (CD)
2 x Albums (CD)
2 x Albums (Cassette)
Download options for all
Sticker & Button Badge

As we get into this we might find we release more, or that the mix changes depending on the artists requirements. Whatever happens we will make sure you get at least your money's worth and no doubt more!!  

Note on Vinyl - although it's unlikely we will pursue this in Year 1,  if Vinyl becomes a viable option it's not currently in scope of this reward due to cost, We'll think of something else amazing when that comes along...

Risks & Challenges

It's the music industry, delays could happen with logistical things like recording or contracts, or on the creative side - bands can split up, inspiration never comes, etc. If the option 3 subscription doesn't meet its value in year 1 for reasons like these that are beyond our control we'll simply extend its length.

T-Shirts have very little risk other than manufacturing delays due to further unplanned COVID shutdowns. 

Other ways you can help

Hey - not everyone can help with money and that's ok! If you like what we do but can't afford to be involved right now that's ok. If you still want to help out why not share some posts on social media, or tell a friend!

story:
SPRING FEVER SOUNDTRACK ON VINYL

All the music you heard and loved in the movie SPRING FEVER is coming to vinyl, with your help! The album will include all the music contributed by the following local Quad Cities bands and artists:

  • Malcolm Simon
  • The Archimedes Death Ray
  • 5th Dawn
  • DTOUR
  • Crater
  • Dead Ginger
  • Morphine Dream
  • Axen Province

Featuring crazy cool perks like signed copies of the album by contributing artists, Spring Fever merch, movie props and more! Contributing to this campaign supports the local music and movie arts, so why wouldn't you?!?

Funds & Perks

Here's what we need, and what you get:.

  • We want to have a limited run of 200 vinyl albums made, and it's going to take $1835 to make it happen. If we make our goal, we have stretch goal perks like a limited run of CDs!
  • Signed copies of Spring Fever on DVD and Blu-ray, signed movie posters, screen used puppets, signed copies of Spring Fever: The Album by contributing bands, and pop-culture character magnets handcrafted by Izzy Sutton are just some of the awesome perks!!!
  • IF somehow we don't manage to make our goal, the funds will be saved in an account until enough are accumulated to make the vinyl run, and everyone who contributed will still get a copy. It's a win-win.

YOU MATTER

Everyone who contributes adds another piece to the puzzle, and we hope to add a limited-run-of-a-kind vinyl album to the faithful and hardcore collectors:

  • As the late, great Robert Z'Dar once said, "There's Nothing Like Spring Fever" and he couldn't be more right. Now you can own a small piece of film & movie history with this limited edition of Spring Fever's awesome soundtrack.
  • It's people like you who made the Spring Fever Post Campaign successful, and it's people like you who will make this one a success as well. Family, friends, and those with a common interest are the ones who make these projects happen, and we couldnt do it without you.
  • Let's support the local film & music scene and make this thing real. Let's hear Spring Fever, on vinyl. \m/

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this awesome campaign!
  • Share this campaign on your social media!

Spring Fever: The Album. It's Catchy!

story:
hello again! 

indiegogo fam, it's been three years since we came together for HEART OF GOLD!

as you know *everyone* who backs this campaign and pre-orders the album will be a part of the thank you/liners on the finished product! 

you. make. this. possible.

 

so! this is album number six (I can hardly believe it!), it's on six strings (I've been so busy learning again!) and as always (this is also campaign no.6!) this is when and where I need your help:

 

  • if $1000 raised: my first ProTools update in 10yrs!
  • if $2000 raised: full body guitar, case & customized picks!
  • if $3000 raised: mechanical licensing for these epic covers!
  • if $4000 raised: mastering & ultra lim.edition (eco friendly) CD!
  • if $5000 raised: professionally engineered studio & feature musicians!
  • if $6000 raised: professional composer & complete string quartet feature!
  • $6000 USD GOAL INCLUDES: Indiegogo, PayPal and extra postage fees*

 

about this goal...

 

these are the immediate needs to get this project off the ground and moving forward, in a bare-boned-indie manner.

however... after having made house music for 20 years now, i genuinely don't know who will want to explore this nostalgic and mostly acoustic journey with me... but while this 'unknown' humbles me already, I am completely committed to the gifts you contribute towards. i love the music and i truly love being able to share it with you. i can't wait to see where this project goes and i'm grateful for the chance to grow in front of you all.

to the friends who gave me the courage to do this, you know who you are.

i love you.

 

about this music... the long, short...

 

about the album... the long, not short...

 

 

what i've created in this video music sampler, is my most honest offering of what i can do "on my own", of course with the help of homies around me (our continual labour-of-love and bartering nature between fellow heartists) it could be lifted further. but with the help of my community - true supporters who have been here for me, some, 5 albums and counting - old friends who make me who i am, some, since "1990-something!" - and of course, treasured family (since the day I was born!) - this music could be elevated to its full potential. these covers and songwriters are KING. i want so much to do them j u s t i c e . . .

 

[BLACK DOG STRING QUARTET • Sunrise Studios, Vancouver, BC • HEART OF GOLD, 2017]

. . . which means i also envision the opportunity to work with a professional composer and a full string section again - these songs, the lyrics, the melodies, the artists that i respect so much - they call for that level of musical magic. we've done it before, so i am truly manifesting what may come next if we manage to meet or exceed this initial goal.

 

 

small scream! first single out n o w !

 
New York City's Vibe Boutique Records EP "DON'T STOP" is the first single from the album, including an unreleased house remix by N'DINGA GABA (album-exclusive) the original deep house cut by Switzerland's MONODELUXE, and my own acoustic cut: 
 

 

 
the full remix ep, including a floor friendly mix by NYC's Mark Francis, is on TRAXSOURCE xx

 

 

 

indie army! I love you...

    for those who simply can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • you can spread the word and make some noise about this campaign!
    • you can share my music with any of your fellow music lovers!
    • you can sing along and know I'm with you in spirit!

       

      while the track list isn't complete...

      while the recordings aren't complete...

      while the album title and any finalized artwork are yet to be explored...

      I'm most excited that the music is made together with all of you now, please know, i wouldn't want it any other way. n a m a s t e 

       

      prayers up!

       

      feeling blessed to have the support of my family, my friends, the deep house community and a music circle that spreads across the world. so i hope the music makes you smile as much as you make me b e a m.

      and if any of you are still reading, please send a prayer my way. 

      i need, feel and appreciate them most.

       

      soul size love x
story_txt:
hello again! 
indiegogo fam, it's been three years since we came together for HEART OF GOLD!
as you know *everyone* who backs this campaign and pre-orders the album will be a part of the thank you/liners on the finished product! 
you. make. this. possible.

 
so! this is album number six (I can hardly believe it!), it's on six strings (I've been so busy learning again!) and as always (this is also campaign no.6!) this is when and where I need your help:
 


if $1000 raised: my first ProTools update in 10yrs!


if $2000 raised: full body guitar, case & customized picks!


if $3000 raised: mechanical licensing for these epic covers!


if $4000 raised: mastering & ultra lim.edition (eco friendly) CD!


if $5000 raised: professionally engineered studio & feature musicians!


if $6000 raised: professional composer & complete string quartet feature!

$6000 USD GOAL INCLUDES: Indiegogo, PayPal and extra postage fees*


 
about this goal...
 
these are the immediate needs to get this project off the ground and moving forward, in a bare-boned-indie manner.
however... after having made house music for 20 years now, i genuinely don't know who will want to explore this nostalgic and mostly acoustic journey with me... but while this 'unknown' humbles me already, I am completely committed to the gifts you contribute towards. i love the music and i truly love being able to share it with you. i can't wait to see where this project goes and i'm grateful for the chance to grow in front of you all.
to the friends who gave me the courage to do this, you know who you are.
i love you.

 
about this music... the long, short...


 

about the album... the long, not short...

 

 
what i've created in this video music sampler, is my most honest offering of what i can do "on my own", of course with the help of homies around me (our continual labour-of-love and bartering nature between fellow heartists) it could be lifted further. but with the help of my community - true supporters who have been here for me, some, 5 albums and counting - old friends who make me who i am, some, since "1990-something!" - and of course, treasured family (since the day I was born!) - this music could be elevated to its full potential. these covers and songwriters are KING. i want so much to do them j u s t i c e . . .

small scream! first single out n o w !
 
New York City's Vibe Boutique Records EP "DON'T STOP" is the first single from the album, including an unreleased house remix by N'DINGA GABA (album-exclusive) the original deep house cut by Switzerland's MONODELUXE, and my own acoustic cut: 
 


 

 
the full remix ep, including a floor friendly mix by NYC's Mark Francis, is on TRAXSOURCE xx
 

 
 
indie army! I love you...


for those who simply can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

you can spread the word and make some noise about this campaign!
you can share my music with any of your fellow music lovers!
you can sing along and know I'm with you in spirit!


 while the track list isn't complete...while the recordings aren't complete...while the album title and any finalized artwork are yet to be explored...I'm most excited that the music is made together with all of you now, please know, i wouldn't want it any other way. n a m a s t e  prayers up! feeling blessed to have the support of my family, my friends, the deep house community and a music circle that spreads across the world. so i hope the music makes you smile as much as you make me b e a m.and if any of you are still reading, please send a prayer my way. i need, feel and appreciate them most. soul size love x

story:
Summary

After a long journey of dipping in and out of music covers and being pushed to hone my musical abilities, I am finally taking the first major step onto my path as a musician in tandem with my acting career. This music video for the track Omertà will be my first single and will set the bar for future endeavors and opportunities!  

The video concept for Omertà will not be a traditional music video. We hope to create a trailer-like cut of a film inspired by my Italian heritage and classic mafia movies like The Godfather, to accompany the track. With our budget goal we can take the set back in time to the 1940-60s and visually achieve an aesthetic more reminiscent of a Hollywood film than music video. 

I am so unbelievably proud of this song, and although Covid derailed the strategic and organized plans I had for my music journey this year, I am refusing to end this year without hitting my most pivotal goal - which is to release my first single and music video. 

Your contribution will allow me and the talented team I have in place to fully realize a vivid concept that will take a village to execute WITHOUT cutting corners. It will allow the incredible friends I have in their respective industries to be paid and given the tools they need to make this project something we are all proud of and for you to enjoy! 

 

What We Need 

Our end goals is roughly $8,000 but whatever we raise will be applied!

BEFORE YOU FREAK OUT - "That sounds expensive!" - if only 320 people donate $25 we already achieve the goal! Not so impossible! Whatever you can contribute will be utilized responsibly. We understand the state of things around the world right now, so even $1 counts!  

As an actor, I have been very lucky to accumulate a wide network of incredible talents in all sorts of industries. From videographers, to visionary directors, to stylists and talented hair and makeup gurus - I want to make this project not only visually stunning, but incorporate as many of these talented artists as I can, AND PAY THEM! 

I hope this footage will elevate the song to a level that will leave a lasting impression. This will all come down to having the necessary budget to allocate to all the needs of a project on this scale.

THE MONEY WILL GO TO- Locations, permits, editing, film equipment, insurance, sound, crew members, fees, director, talent, props, styling, makeup, hair, Covid safety measures, and more.

So I know its cringe to crowdfund, but I love artists, my friends and music, and I want to aim big!  

 

What You'll Get

Because this video will be shot more like a film, I would love to include every single name of those who contributed and supported this project in the end credits! Picture a long scrolling screen of credits with all of your names attached to this amazing moment that will forever be "my first big step in music."

Not only will your name be stamped on the project as you are truly part of it, but I will send a special photo with a handwritten note with autograph to every email listed in the contributions! Just a small token of gratitude.  

I hope to also invite the contributors to a virtual ZOOM meet up sometime in the launching window of this music video. Imagine a huge meet up via ZOOM where I can speak to you guys more intimately about the projects creation, the plans for it, and updates. When this is organized we can send a follow up to the email you include with your contribution! 

 

The Impact

If we do meet our goal, I hope that you will also watch this video and feel how emotionally invested I am in the entire process and creation of this vision. The end result will be something I am doing FOR YOU GUYS in hopes of coming out of the gate with a bang, and to make sure future opportunities in music open to me. I want to keep making things for you guys with more resources available to me in the future. This video will set the bar for record labels, producers and musical business endeavors!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share this page as much as possible, or simply just send good energy to my team and I so that the process of creating this will go smoothly and be fun for everyone involved and beyond!

story:
Overview

I'm going back to my roots! After over ten years as the front man for The Unfortunates it is time for me to finally record and release my first solo record since 2008. I've written a collection of songs that are uniquely me and that capture my original passion for music and performing.  Every pre order goes directly towards the album and tour launch! To thank the fans for their continued support, we have created special limited edition merch for this launch. Every pre order will also be personalized and will include a thank you in the album's liner notes!

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise enough funds to finish the album's recording, produce the vinyl records and have a subsequent tour. 

There is a limited number of unique, signed and limited merch packages available to make this happen, as well as special concerts and private events. 

The Impact

I have never been able to make a record without the help of my great fans. We have never received a grant for our music projects and have always completed our albums by hard work and fan contributions. Without YOU this isn't possible! 

With COVID putting an end to almost all live music opportunities, I am relying on my fans more than ever to help me make this dream possible and I plan on rewarding them with a great record and a product they can be proud of.

Risks & Challenges

I have taken more risks musically, vocally and lyrically on this album than ever before and I am so excited to share it with you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to the pre order you can still help in easy ways! Please share and like my posts on facebook, youtube, twitter and instagram. YOU can make the biggest impact in getting the word out and I appreciate every like and share along the way.

story:
Overview

Since they were old enough to hold and play instruments, the boys of Leland Blue have pursued a lifelong passion of creating music that continues to push beyond their own boundaries in the hopes of connecting with like-minded people across the globe. With a continuously growing fanbase of 50,000+ monthly listeners on Spotify, this group of twenty-year olds found early encouragement when they released their first single in 2017, “Sofia” which has amassed over 2 million streams.

After two EPs of genre fluid music that continued to develop with every release, the boys of Leland Blue started to gather steam by playing a variety of shows as well as preparing for their biggest project yet. As the global pandemic shook the world at the start of 2020, all of that momentum was brought to an unexpected halt, just as it was for all other artists, workers, and humans alike. While the past year has been one of many hardships, the boys have found ways to persevere, while also continuing to substantially grow musically and keep their eyes on a dream. A dream that has the potential to turn making music from a hobby into a profession, and to ultimately change their lives. 

That’s exactly where you come in.

Where’s Your Money Going?

As mentioned in the video, there’s many pieces of the puzzle that lead to a professional and collective body of a musical project. It takes writing incredible songs, professional recordings, mixing, mastering, high-quality content to accompany those songs, marketing, advertising, branding, and much more. 

With all of those pieces in mind, we’ve set a goal of 10K to fully bring this project to fruition. All of the funds raised from this campaign will go directly back into these categories, which includes but is not limited to:

Studio time (recording, mixing, mastering)

Budgets for creative content (music videos, photoshoots, etc.)

Marketing + Advertising (ads for social media, music blogs, etc.)

Branding (singles and album artwork, logo design, etc.)

All of these pieces play a crucial part in the process of making sure everything feels cohesive and high quality. Cutting a corner anywhere can be detrimental to the project as a whole.

The Bottom Line

With the hopeful completion of this campaign, which leads to the completion of this project by hopefully the end of Summer 2021, the plan is to present all of these materials to a label with the intention of getting a record deal. The representation of a label will lead to more contacts, more opportunities, music distribution across the country, better promotion, and ultimately get this music in front of the people who want to see it.

In today’s music industry, labels are much more prone to signing an artist that already has the materials ready at hand. Granted these have to be exceptional materials, and we fully believe that’s the case with this project. 

Big dreams are scary. But if they don’t scare you, they aren’t big enough.

Risks & Challenges

There’s many risks and challenges that come with the completion of this goal. There is a lot of pressure to meet deadlines, and we have to rely on other people and sources to help us meet those deadlines. People are not always totally reliable, however, through many years of production experience, in both music and film, we feel completely determined, capable, and ready to navigate these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Right now is a tough time for everyone. There’s no denying that. If you’re not able to donate, spreading the word can be just as, or more, effective. A few clicks can go further than you would ever imagine.

Thank you so much for your support and love.

story:
Happy 2021 CA Army, are you ready for the next chapter?

It’s been a long journey, and we’re finally here. A full album in hand and a vision to share with you. But before we get into that, we want to tell you a bit about how we got here.

It was about two and a half years ago when we started this album. From the very beginning, we’ve always said that if we were going to go for this, we would do it right. Every one of us knew that this had potential. The stars just couldn’t seem to align for us. At some points, it really looked like it was a lost cause.

When the world shut down, we had to take a long look at what’s in front of us. We were under lockdown. That meant no playing side gigs, no going out, no vacations, nothing to distract us or keep us from making this album. At that point, we all got on a video call (the first of many) and said this is it. It's now or never.

These video calls turned into bouncing instrumental ideas back and forth and eventually making so many demos that we couldn’t keep track of them. We spent the whole quarantine writing remotely. Not once did we all get in a room with our instruments and start jamming to come up with ideas. It was all digital back and forth. After we had a good batch of songs we were proud of, we reached out to our long-time collaborator Felix Nieto to get in the studio with him and bring these tracks to life.

Black Sky Sunrise. This title is everything that we wrote into this album. There's so much dichotomy on this record between bright and beautiful and dark and heavy. There was so much grief, confusion, anxiety, depression, and anger in 2020, but amidst all of that we had this record, and we had each other. It felt like even though the future was dark and we had no idea what was going to come of all of it, it was worth putting it all on the line for this. This record was the light that pushed us to stay afloat.

We came out of the studio with brand new songs that reflected our feelings not only towards each other but also the world that was quickly changing around us. This record speaks of the times, but it also speaks of grief and loss for what we once had before all of this madness.

We've been keeping you updated on this whole experience the best we can from our homes in quarantine, and you guys have been championing us the entire way through. It's been incredible.

While we've made all this progress, we're still at a major disadvantage. We have all these new songs and ideas for making this album as incredible as possible, but it’s impossible for us to fund this all alone.

The only thing that brought this record together was us banding as a team. Today we want to expand that team. We want to bring you in on this project, get to know all of you better, and thank you for supporting us through all of this chaos. With everything we’ve been through to get here, trust and believe we are serving you absolutely nothing but our best.

We are forever grateful for all of the support we’ve received from our fans since the very beginning. Even when we were on a rocky road, we had so much love coming in from people that kept us together. We know you guys have our backs and we have so much faith in you. 

Black Sky Sunrise is coming soon.

Xx

Marina, Dougie, Nick & Paul

 

 

Risks & Challenges

A note for our followers and backers: This album is finished. No matter what happens it will come out. This campaign is our way of making sure that after all of this hard work, each song gets its chance to shine. With music videos, radio campaigning, advertisement, merchandise, and possible bonus tracks if we do well enough! We want more than anything to share this with you and bring you in on this insane opportunity.

Other Ways You Can Help

We intimately understand the financial troubles that people have been going through in the last year, and we completely understand if now is not the best time for you to get involved in a fundraiser like this. That's why keeping up with us on all of our social media, sharing all of our new content, and spreading the word would mean the absolute world to us either way.

https://linktr.ee/crashingatlas

A note for our followers and backers: This album is finished. No matter what happens it will come out. This campaign is our way of making sure that after all of this hard work, each song gets its chance to shine. With music videos, radio campaigning, advertisement, merchandise, and possible bonus tracks if we do well enough! We want more than anything to share this with you and bring you in on this insane opportunity.

Other Ways You Can Help
We intimately understand the financial troubles that people have been going through in the last year, and we completely understand if now is not the best time for you to get involved in a fundraiser like this. That's why keeping up with us on all of our social media, sharing all of our new content, and spreading the word would mean the absolute world to us either way.
https://linktr.ee/crashingatlas

story:
About Eric...

Eric Mullins is a saxophonist, composer, and music educator based in New Port Richey, FL.  After his first piano lesson in elementary school Eric became hooked on music. Eric studied music at The University of Memphis, The University of Louisville, and in 2003 received his Bachelor's degree in music performance from The New School in New York City.   Eric has performed in Tokyo, Japan with The Gospel Voices of Memphis, at The International Centre for African Music & Dance in Accra, Ghana, at The Monterey Jazz Festival, The Chicago Blues Festival, London's Royal Albert Hall and countless other venues.   In 2007 Eric and his wife Marina started "Mullins Music", a 501(c)(3) non-profit music school and recording studio in Tampa Bay, Florida. Eric also enjoys cooking, camping, and biking.

More about this project...

While attending high school in Memphis, TN, Eric began to experiment with composition.  He studied music theory and arranging in college and since then has written hundreds of songs. 

The music for this album was written during and inspired by Eric's time living in New York City from 2000 - 2003.  After nearly 20 years, Eric is presenting his first of three planned full length releases of original compositions and arrangements.

Featured musicians on the album will include Frank LoCrasto (piano), Renée Cruz (bass), Brandon Lewis (drums), Josh Evans (trumpet), Barry Olsen (trombone) and Valerie Naranjo (gyil).  Nate Najar will produce the recording.

Eric's album will be recorded on August 17th and 18th, 2021 at EastSide Sound Studios in New York City.

What your money goes to...

The total amount needed to produce this album is $13, 936.  The funds raised will go directly to:

  • Engineering, Mixing, and Recording Costs
  • Hiring Studio Musicians
  • Post-Production Mastering
  • CD & Vinyl Production

Beyond the music...

Eric has a passion for the issue of homelessness in his community.  10% of every donation to this campaign will be donated directly to Metropolitan Ministries, an organization that helps homeless and at-risk children and families in Tampa Bay, Florida.

If fully funded, that means Eric will donate over $1,300 to Metropolitan Ministries!

Other Ways You Can Help...

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell everyone about this project!
  • Share on Facebook and Instagram!

The Musicians...

Frank LoCrasto (piano)

To date, Texas-born, Brooklyn-based Frank LoCrasto has released four solo albums (When You’re There 2006, El Dorado 2011, LoCrasto 2015, and Lost Dispatch 2019). He has composed and recorded music for three feature length films (Sandbar 2012, Union Furnace 2015, Stranger in the Dunes 2016), and has had songs placed in the 2014 movie, Obvious Child, and the 2020 HBO series, How to With Jon Wilson. In addition, LoCrasto has recorded and toured with Cass McCombs, Pat Martino, Jeremy Pelt, James Iha, Parquet Courts, Fruit Bats, Nicholas Payton, Greg Osby, Okkervil River, and Wallace Roney. He has also appeared as a sideman on over 70 albums. Prior to the pandemic, LoCrasto was actively touring with his band, Cass McCombs, the Fruit Bats, and Grateful Shred.

Renée Cruz (bass)

Cuban-American bassist Renée Cruz was born and raised in Miami, FL and currently is based in New York City. Renée has performed and recorded with several of Jazz music’s most legendary icons, artists including Dr. Billy Taylor, Harry Whitaker, Jimmy Heath, Hank Jones, Frank Wess, Joe Wilder, Gerald Wilson, Ernestine Anderson, Joe Lovano, and Benny Golson.

Renée earned her Bachelor of Fine Arts from New School University for Jazz & Contemporary Music in 2004 and in 2005 was awarded a full scholarship to the Juilliard Jazz program where she earned her Masters of Music degree in 2007. She holds the distinction of being the first woman bassist in the program. 

Brandon Lewis (drums)

Drummer Brandon Lee Lewis has performed internationally with artists such as Gil Coggins, Harry Whitaker, Frank Wess, George Mraz, Kenny Garrett, Myron Walden, Azar Lawrence, Lezlie Harrison, Saul Rubin, Avi Rothbard, Anthony Wonsey, David Weiss, Billy Harper, Reggie Workman and Charles Tolliver, among others. He's also performed on Award-Winning Broadway productions The Color Purple and Memphis and the feature film American Gangster.

In addition to impeccable sideman work, he hosts a weekly Sunday night jam session, inherited from the great Harry Whitaker. Sundays have evolved into a community hang where Brandon's developed a band sound as a vehicle for his compositions, an offering known as the Program of Deprogramming, which features longstanding bandmates Lawrence Clark, Stacy Dillard, Theo Hill and Renée Cruz, in addition to a bevy of special guests.

Josh Evans (trumpet)

Josh Evans, born and raised in Hartford, CT, was drawn to the trumpet after hearing a Roy Eldridge and Dizzy Gillespie recording at the age of 10. By the age of 14 Evans’ musical career began to take shape when he started to study with and be mentored by the celebrated alto saxophonist/composer, and educator Jackie McLean. The experience would blaze the path for performances with Jackie McLean which included New York based venues known as the Blue Note, Iridium, the Regattabar located in Boston, MA, and the Bushnell Center for Performing Arts in Hartford, CT. In April 2005 Josh began a Three and a half year stint with the Winard Harper Sextet, the group personnel at different points consisting of Billy Taylor, Frank Wess and George Cables, as well as trumpet players Terrell Stafford, Claudio Roditi and Phillip Harper.  In April 2007, Josh was invited to perform a two week tour of Siberia with master saxophonist, and composer Benny Golson. It was during this time period that Evans would also start performing with master Drummer Rashied Ali and would become the bands trumpet player for the next two years. Josh Evans would play with Rashied Ali until the drummer’s untimely death in 2009. In January 2011, Josh Evans recorded and released his debut album ‘Portrait’. This Album shares Evans influential relationships with Rasieid Ali, Jackie McLean, Raymond Williams, Alan Palmer, and Ralph Peterson.

Barry Olsen (trombone)

Multi-­instrumentalist Barry Olsen is a native New Yorker who began his career as a teenager in the late 70’s playing trombone in that city’s Latin music (salsa) scene. Over the years he has performed with virtually all the major artists in this field, including Ray Barretto, Eddie Palmieri, Hector Lavoe, Tito Puente, Celia Cruz, Marc Anthony, and La India. He has also performed and recorded with Paul Simon, The Paul Winter Consort, David Byrne, Charlie Persip and many others.

On marimba and percussion he has performed in the orchestra of the Broadway hit “The Lion King” since 1998. On trombone and keyboards he performed in the show “Fela” (featuring the music of Nigerian afro­beat pioneer Fela Kuti) on Broadway and on tour in Europe and North America.

Since 1988 he has been performing Lobi and Dagara music from northern Ghana (West Africa) playing the drums gangaa and kuar, which accompany the gyil (pentatonic marimba). In 1996 he performed with Valerie Naranjo in the Kobine Festival of Traditional Music in Lawra, Ghana, where they were honored as the only non-­Ghanaians to date to be awarded a first prize. He has recorded five CDs in this genre with Ghanaian masters Kakraba Lobi and Bernard Woma.

Valerie Naranjo (gyil)

Valerie Dee Naranjo is from Southern Colorado. She began her musical studies as a child singing in her family tradition. Her love of gyil began at age 18 when she learned of the instrument and was rekindled at age 22 when she first heard a recording of the late Kakraba Lobi, founding gyil master of The Ghana Dance Ensemble. Kakraba mentored Valerie for 17 years whence they appeared on international CNN from the University of Ghana’s International Center for African Music and Dance.

In 1988 Valerie affected a decree from the Lawra Council of Elders and Chief Abiefa Karbo, that their ban on women playing gyil in public be lifted so that she could participate in the annual Kobine Festival of Traditional Performing Arts. She and Barry Olsen were honored, in 1996, with the only first place award at the Kobine Festival ever given to non-West African musicians to date.          

Valerie has been the percussionist for the NBC Saturday Night Live Band for 23 years, performing with such artists as Paul Simon, Lady Gaga, and Mick Jagger. Otherwise she has performed with such American artists as Carole King, Glen Velez, David Byrne, Philip Glass, and Paul Winter; Thuli Dumakude, Tu Nokwe, and Zim Nqawana (South Africa); The National Symphony, Kakraba Lobi, Ba-ere Yotere, and the late Bernard Woma (Ghana); Airto Moriera and Jose Neto (Brazil); and Zakir Hussein and Srinivas Krishnan (India).

Nate Najar (producer)

Guitarist Nate Najar is emerging as one of this decade’s finest modern jazz exponents. He is a player who uses a distinctive technique to convey his artistic prowess- not many artists play acoustic classical guitar with right hand classical technique, yet it is the perfect choice for Najar’s comprehensive approach. Not restricted to single notes or chords, Nate seamlessly weaves melody, harmony and rhythmic freedom. The result is music that is swinging, emotional, inventive and interesting. Continuing to perform at major venues and festivals across the entire globe, Nate’s latest album, Under Paris Skies was released in 2018 on Woodward Avenue Records. Rick Andersen of the All Music Guide called Nate "one of the most consistently interesting and stylish young guitarists on the jazz scene...." Becky Byrd, wife of the late guitarist Charlie Byrd says it best: "There is no doubt that there is a piece of Charlie's soul in Nate's mind, heart and fingers. Get ready world, here comes Nate Najar!!!"
