story:
We have been creating music together for 6 years now. We have worked tirelessly writing and performing these songs for the past 4 years, and now it is time to lay down these tracks you have all been hearing live.  We have already begun the recording process, spending the last two months, crafting these songs into the best they can be.

On June 20th we spent four days at the legendary Dockside studios in Maurice, LA. laying down the base of the tracks along the banks of the Vermillion Bayou with the help of engineer Justin Tockit and with the gracious hospitality of Dockside’s owners, Wish and Steve Nails.

The next phase of the project involves bringing in some of our favorite musicians to track guitar, strings, horns, and backup vocals. Eric will be recording and mixing these sessions from his home studio on Oak street in New Orleans.

All money donated to this campaign will be going directly to paying the musicians and producer, mixing and mastering, hiring an artist for album artwork  and printing these songs to vinyl! Budget is included in the FAQ's!

Any way you can contribute to help this dream become a reality is greatly appreciated, even if you are only able to like and share this so that more people can see it.

Thank you for all your love and support through the years and we are excited to share this amazing album with you!

All the love,
Maggie and Brian

story:
BIO

Hello! My name is Katie Sachs and I have been a singer-songwriter for over 20 years, with 3 studio albums and 2 official music videos under my belt. I have lived and traveled all over the country, playing songs and collaborating with other independent musicians - primarily in Massachusetts, Austin, TX and Asheville, NC. I am SOO excited to announce that I will be recording a BRAND NEW FULL LENGTH ALBUM this winter called The Factory of Almosts (read more below.) It's been two years since my last release, and five since my last full album, and this collection of songs feels like a true re-emergence - my best work yet. With a background as a community organizer and in the healing arts, I believe that art does not happen alone. I invite you to be a part of the creation of this project, especially during these times that can be so isolating and challenging. Let's make a new record together! 

LISTEN TO AND WATCH PREVIOUS WORK:

  • Watch "Baby Fever" Official Music Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=swAyNUrxTSU
  • Watch "Underwear Model" Official Music Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nsPogPCAz7g
  • Listen to previous albums: https://katiesachs.bandcamp.com/ or stream on Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/7B5RxKknGwpYKtJ...
  • More info at www.katiesachs.com

Project Summary

The Factory of Almosts is a collection of 11 songs about the end of love, almost loves, not being ready for love, and finding yourself through romantic challenges, vulnerability and heartbreaks. It's taken over 5 years to write, and is finally ready to be born! Pre-production for the album has begun, and the line up of musicians is truly incredible: members of Asheville's premier Indie Rock band - The Get Right Band,  Grammy-nominated bass player Paul Kochanski, the legendary Boston music promoter and musician Tom Bianchi, and more... Now all we need is funding!

The pandemic has hit all of us hard, especially working musicians. The winter already tends to be a slower time of year for touring artist, but this year will be even rougher. Your donations go not only to making the dream of this record a reality, but also to supporting independent artists who have limited income opportunities at this time. Additionally, I plan to re-route funds that I normally would put towards physical CD's into promotion of the record - something I have always struggled with. I want this album to have every opportunity of reaching a wider audience, and plan to hire a publicist - the best way to increase your chances of air play. 

As a thank you, there are options for perks at varying contribution price point, though any pledge amount is possible, and rewards are not required if you are just wanting to make a simple donation. Every pledge amount - large or small - is SO appreciated. Thank you for all of your support in making this record happen. 

Budget

Making an album is pricey, but very doable. "The Factory" will be my 4th studio album, and so I am very familiar with the costs involved and how to budget for and create a successful record that is produced on the cheaper end of things, but still sounds great! My plan for this album is to revert costs that I normally spend on physical printing and graphics to go towards publicity. My dream is to be able to hire a publicist for the album release, which is one of the best ways to increase the listenership of independent music. Here is a look at exactly where your donations will go:

  • MUSICIANS: $2,000
  • MIXING AND MASTERING: $2,000
  • PUBLICITY AND ADVERTISING: $1,000 +

Risks & Challenges

I recognize that I am asking for money during a year that has been financially challenging for everyone at a time when people are buying gifts for their loved ones for the holidays. Like many things this year, however, the timing of this project is what it is. My hope is that during this time of giving, music appreciators and supporters will find it in their hearts to make a donation of whatever amount is possible or feels comfortable to them. I TRULY believe that music is one of the most healing and powerful forces we have as humans and that this record has the potential to help thousands of people get through difficult times. I know that this year, for me, Fiona Apple's "Fetch the Bolt Cutters" was a god sent. I listened to it every day for about two months and it meant so much to me. There have been many albums like this that have touched the deepest parts of my soul, and though I don't presume to have nearly the level of talent as these famous musicians, if this record can do the same thing for even just one other person,  I can think of no greater honor and reward.  

  • Remember: Even a $5 donation can make a HUGE difference in getting an album funded!
  • Due to the pandemic, this album will be recorded differently than I have done it in the past, with each musician doing their own home recording. Though I will miss the magic of going into the studio and laying down live tracks, there are also advantages to socially distanced recording!  One is that I can work with musicians from all over the country. Another is that there is much more control over each instrument, as folks will be laying down their own tracks individually, rather than at the same time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I COMPLETELY understand that these are tough times and that not everyone who wants to support the album will be able to make a financial contribution. Have no fear! There are other, equally appreciated ways to help out. Here are just a few:

  • SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! Spread the word on social media, tell your friends, etc.
  • Send words of encouragement 
  • Offer relevant time or services/skills for free (i.e. Graphic Design. Writing press releases, Offering services or goods for perk rewards, just to name a few :)

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT WITH THE CREATIVE PROCESS!! THIS MUSIC CANNOT HAPPEN WITHOUT YOU!

Risks & Challenges
I recognize that I am asking for money during a year that has been financially challenging for everyone at a time when people are buying gifts for their loved ones for the holidays. Like many things this year, however, the timing of this project is what it is. My hope is that during this time of giving, music appreciators and supporters will find it in their hearts to make a donation of whatever amount is possible or feels comfortable to them. I TRULY believe that music is one of the most healing and powerful forces we have as humans and that this record has the potential to help thousands of people get through difficult times. I know that this year, for me, Fiona Apple's "Fetch the Bolt Cutters" was a god sent. I listened to it every day for about two months and it meant so much to me. There have been many albums like this that have touched the deepest parts of my soul, and though I don't presume to have nearly the level of talent as these famous musicians, if this record can do the same thing for even just one other person,  I can think of no greater honor and reward.  

Remember: Even a $5 donation can make a HUGE difference in getting an album funded!
Due to the pandemic, this album will be recorded differently than I have done it in the past, with each musician doing their own home recording. Though I will miss the magic of going into the studio and laying down live tracks, there are also advantages to socially distanced recording!  One is that I can work with musicians from all over the country. Another is that there is much more control over each instrument, as folks will be laying down their own tracks individually, rather than at the same time. 


Other Ways You Can Help
I COMPLETELY understand that these are tough times and that not everyone who wants to support the album will be able to make a financial contribution. Have no fear! There are other, equally appreciated ways to help out. Here are just a few:

SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! Spread the word on social media, tell your friends, etc.
Send words of encouragement 
Offer relevant time or services/skills for free (i.e. Graphic Design. Writing press releases, Offering services or goods for perk rewards, just to name a few :)

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT WITH THE CREATIVE PROCESS!! THIS MUSIC CANNOT HAPPEN WITHOUT YOU!

story:
::: ((( scroll down for updated progress & NEW videos))) :::

¡¡¡ tHanK yOu SO muCh to eVerYOne wHo's coNtriButeD !!!

"Who is robbie FITZSIMMONS?"

Robbie is a professional composer, performer and producer whose extensive musical history has landed him as a cowriter on Lana Del Rey's latest album, Ultraviolence, on stages at The Glastonbury and Electric Forest Festivals, recording at Jackson Browne's studio, Groovemasters (where Bob Dylan recorded his last two albums), and one on one collaboration time with Paul Simon.
He now feels he is ready to record his own material as a full length album!
The first single off the album, "The Worst is Over," is in its final stages of production and an elaborate single shot music video is in pre production.
Your contribution will go towards production costs of both the video and the album as well as production value for future live shows,
which look a little something like this:

 

"Where exactly will my donation go?"

We're honored to be pulling tons of favors from our ridiculously talented community of friends and family who are involved in music and video production on all fronts, BUT we do need financial help with::::

  • Studio time, mixing, mastering and printing of the single and album
  • Location, equipment and prop rentals for the video
  • Permits and Insurance costs
  • Set fabrication and decoration
  • Catering to keep the cast and crew satiated
  • Travel expenses
  • Production value for the video, the album and the live show!!!

     


"Do I get anything for donating?"

Your donations will not go unnoticed!  We are very grateful to have your support and for this we have offered a number of incentives to entice you, including:::
    • Cameos in a video
    • Personalized lessons and concerts
    • All access VIP packages to fesitvals
    • Personalized songs
    • Co-ownership of songs


    "Why should I support Robbie?"

    Robbie is wrangling together some of the greatest talent in the world to participate in this music video and future performances.  These include dancers, fire spinners, aerialists, clowns and mermaids.

    Robbie is also making waves in the music industry!  Aside from the Lana Del Rey collaboration people have been buzzing about his own music and singing for years but he's needed to go through his own personal growth before tackling a solo album.

    He's now in a position to go for it and feels like he is surrounded by a powerful community of support and inspiration!

    The plan is to release the single and the video in November, build hype, continue recording, release the album in February 2015 along with some more videos and then hit the festival circuit hard next summer.

    You have the opportunity to be a part of this adventure at the ground level!



    "What happens if he doesn't make his goal?" 

    Everything will still happen but on a smaller level.  

    We're looking for top notch production value because the art deserves it.

    If we make our goal we will be up to speed with the big names out there and we'll be able to keep everything independent in order to preserve artistic integrity!

    Indiegogo is cool because we will have access to anything that is donated to us regardless of whether we make 100% of our goal or not.*

    *If we make our $15, 000 goal, Indiegogo takes 4%. If we don't make our goal, they take 9% of whatever is donated and give us the rest.


    "I don't have any money to donate but I want to help!  Is there anything else I can do?"

    Thank you!  We're honored to have your support!  Here are some ideas:
    • Please spread the word to those you think might be interested!
    • Can you give Robbie a place to sleep if he is touring through your town?
    • Do you know people who might be interested in helping financially?
    • Are you a good cook? ;)

      There's all sorts of ways you can contribute to the project and we're certainly open to suggestions!



      :::MUSIC VIDEO PROGRESS:::

      We've raised enough to start getting location permits and rentals underway!

      THANK YOU!!!

      The video is set to film on October 11th and 13th.  The first day will be at a warehouse location near downtown LA and the second day will be at the Vasquez Rocks outside of Santa Clarita.

       

      ::: FEATURED TALENT :::


      ((( the Steaz )))

      ((( The Fungineers )))

       

      ((( Hannah Mermaid )))

       

       

      ((( Bubble Gutter )))

       

      ((( Daniel Gutierrez )))



      ((( Julia Garro )))



      ((( Durian Songbird )))



      ((( Jenkstars )))



      ((( Bijoulette & Furlesque )))


      :::The Team:::

      Director/Choreographer: Jesselynn Desmond

      Art Director: Tomas Verde

      Cinematographer/Camera Op: William Walsh

      Assistant Director: David Gueringer

      Editor: Megan Stone (She also edited the indiegogo vid, the little dear)

      Storyboards: Shoghi Castel De Oro & Lisa Dosson

      Set Design: The Jenkstars

      Production Manager: Lillie Castel De Oro

      Production Coordinator: Robyn Newmark

      Costumes: Helen Olds

      Body Painting: Nicolette Spear

      Lighting/Projections: Paul Holman


      :::THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION:::



      :::For more information:::

      robbieFITZSIMMONS.com
      facebook.com/robbiefitz101

story:
WHAT IS UP?!

For those that don't know me, I'm a musician/visual artist under the semi-pseudonym King Dylan. I've been making music for a good chunk of my life and have been able to do some pretty neat things with this career of sorts.  In 2019, thanks to support from people like you, I was able to fund my first ever Vinyl record and it went pretty well as everyone seemed to be really happy with what they received.  So I would like to do another Vinyl, but with my NEW album - 11 new songs, new videos, and with this Vinyl pressing I'm hoping to offer something different and unique - limited edition "Mystery Vinyl" which means the colour of each individual record will be a surprise.  Could be red, could be blue with white marble, could be black, or even clear!  So the record you get will be one of very limited editions!  I also have some fun ideas for perks...

What I Need + What YOU Get

Here's the details, homies.

I'm hoping to raise $2800 to put towards the manufacturing of 100 Vinyl copies of myNEW album that isn't out yet.  This is basically just below the exact cost of the pressing (~$2730+GST).  I was going to set it higher but I'm actually hoping to surpass that goal because Indiegogo takes their cut (9% if I don't reach my goal - and 5% if I do reach it) so along with shipping and handling costs (variable depending on who donates), I feel like it's fair that I take a few risks myself.  The money I've spent on Mastering, etc. the time I've put into the album and upcoming videos, are all a part of my investment into the music that I believe in.  Which I COULD just put online.  But I want to do Vinyl, and that gets pretty expensive up front.

So think of it like a guaranteed Pre-Sale, with options for additional perks that I wouldn't normally offer EVER.  

EVERY contributor will receive a Thank You in the liner insert by name.  If you haven't watched the video, one of the perks you can choose that I'm REALLY excited about is writing a creative, personalized song - that YOU help me write by using a "Madlib" (remember Madlibs?) style form where you give me ~10-15 random words to use and I have to use them in the lyrics.  If I get enough donors for this, I might even release them as a fun album online! 

There are other options, like a "Toast or Roast" (all in good fun) where I can either write a track about how cool and funny and good-looking you are, OR I can write a track about how much of a dingus with stupid hair you are.  Your choice.  (ever seen the Roasts on Comedy Central?)  A sense of humour is a must!  But if you're not feeling that, don't select it!  

I want to do some more paintings, so there will be a perk that includes the new album and a custom, unique painting (just for you!), similar to the option I had for the previous album.

If you're feeling like money's tight and you still want to support, there are other options for you too!  But plenty of options if you're feelin saucy.
 

Your Impact On This Project

Without people like you, independent artists like me would be subject to the likes of Spotify and YouTube, making a few bucks from years of hard work and creative pressure.  With physical products like Vinyl, it actually allows a musician to find real and tangible value in their work, rather than just a "thumbs up", or a "scroll-past".  We can hold it in our hands and know that this exists and was created by someone with a purpose.

I make music because I enjoy doing it, and I believe that your support means you believe that I can keep producing music that is enjoyable, or at least from the heart, and took a lot of work to achieve.  Not only will you be supporting me, but an industry that is constantly being devalued day by day.  Everybody consumes Art daily, and only a handful of people like yourselves actually stop to appreciate it.

The fact that you've read this far speaks volumes and I am forever grateful.

Risks & Challenges 

My ideal situation would be not having to ask you all for your help.  But then I wouldn't be offering these amazing perks over here!  Part of the challenge might be finding the time to write all these potential songs and hoping I can do you all justice, but I will get er done!  One of the risks I am taking is that I am going forward with the Vinyl pressing regardless.  It takes around 12-16 weeks to get the albums pressed and that is just.... phew... I'll be old and grey by then!   (psst, I already am) . So I have to get things rolling.

The best part about Indiegogo is that even if I don't reach the goal, YOU still get the Vinyl, and I still get a portion of the contributions.

But actual risks?  Let's be real. I mean I'm not going to lose my home or anything.  I'm privileged to be in the situation where I ONLY have to ask you to help with the cost of Vinyl.  I'm grateful that I am still able to make music and I couldn't ask for better people on my side.  But as with any investment, it's nice to have a guarantee.  And I believe what I'm doing will be worthwhile to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

At the end of the day, if this project isn't for you but you're thinking "Hey, well, that Dylan, he's alright!" then save your hard-earned money and just do me a simple favour by sharing this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, or online somewhere. If you know a Vinyl junkie that might be interested, send them the link, share the video, whichever works best.  Everything helps.

story:
Short Summary

This album is the culmination of 5 years of work beginning in New York City, continuing to Cooperstown, NY and ending in Gulfport, Florida. It contains some of the best songs I have written, great musicians on the tracks and songs mastered at Abbey Road Studio in London.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what it will take for me to release this album to the world:

  • I still have tracks unfinished and I need to hire musicians to add their musical skills to the performances of the gifted musicians already recorded. I still need to master half of the songs on the album and that is a very important link in the production chain. Five songs need to be submitted for copyright, and I'm hoping to make a music video for at least two of the songs.
  • You don't have to choose a perk, if you only want to donate, that's fine. If you would like a perk in return for your donation I have a range of options. You can get a CD, flash drive or poster of the album cover at every level. Play the guitar? you can get one or two personal guitars lessons, one-on-one with Roger. Want to hang out and hear some great stories about the good old days? Get dinner for two or for four with Roger at Pia's in Gulfport (or we could arrange for somewhere else if you so desire). Want your name as Executive Producer on the best album I've ever done? There's room for 5 people to be on the cover credited as Executive Producer. Would you like for Roger to come to you and play a house concert? That can happen within a 50-mile radius of Gulfport for a nominal contribution.
  • All money will go to fund the production of this album regardless of whether I meet the goal or not. If I do not reach my goal, I'll sell my other gold and platinum albums to Kelly Kincaide Richardson. (just kidding)

The Impact

This will make a big difference in bringing the project to fruition:

  • This is my first album in 10 years and, who knows, could be the last.
  • This will be my sixth album. I've played on 3 platinum albums and had music in films both big and small and all because I've been writing and playing non stop over a long career. This is the next step in a long journey.
  • You can be a part of my musical legacy and part of my musical history.

Risks & Challenges

I'm pretty close to completing this album. If I make my goal, or exceed it, the album should be ready by the summer. If I do not, the album will still be released, just on a longer timeline. I will honor all the perks in a timely manner,

  • I've run projects on shoestring budgets for many years and I know how to bring a project to a successful conclusion.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but would still like to be a part of the project:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about my album, Sunset.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share it and talk about the album on Facebook.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Confidential is a Norwegian symphonic Metal band, fronted by founder and song writer Astrid K Mjøen. She has been working as a freelance singer for some years now, and recently we’ve been working in studio with an album consisting of her songs. All songs on this album is of a very personal character, with stories from her life the last few years, which have been quite a bumpy road, which is reflected In some very emotional and beautiful songs.

This is her diary
 

Making an album on this scale is very costly, and with your help, we will fulfill our dream faster.
This album WILL BE RELEASED no matter what, so we can guarantee the delivery of each perk.

If we don't reach our goal, it will just take longer time.

*Estimated time for delivery is set to April 2021. This will change when we see the result of this crowdfunding, and it is dependable label release schedules

The album costs ALOT more than the 5000 EUR we ask for here. So when we reach our goal, we will have some more rewards for you to keep it going.

Rewards for reaching goals:

1000 EUR - We will release a small album teaser.
3500 EUR - Our backers will get a more extensive teaser video, with Astrid talking about the creation of the songs, and some insight on how we worked in the studio, recording the songs.
5000 EUR - Main Goal reached. All backers who bought the album, will get a  exclusive pre-listen to a single from the album.

Why is this album so expensive to make?

  • We have guest artist that are some of the best, and most know in the genre, like Jake E (Ex Amaranthe, Cyhra) Madeleine Liljestam & Rikard Ekberg (Eleine), Mike LePond (Symphony X) & Jonah Weingarten (Pyramaze, Catalyst Crime)
  • The album is Mixed and Mastered by Jacob Hansen (Amaranthe, Volbeat, Primal Fear++)
  • This is our debut album, so every penny so far has come directly from our own pocket

Confidential is a new band, but all the members have broad experience, and we have now joined forced to make this the most epic album we can.

  • Astrid K Mjøen - Lead Vocals
  • Frode Hovd - Rythm Guitars (Aldaria - ex Memorized Dreams)
  • David Hovde - Lead Guitars (AxeToss)
  • Robert Redmax Myrhaug - Drums (Sandberg, Slagmaur, Tragediens Trone)
  • Charlotte Stav - Synths & Backing Vocals


​

  • Facebook

  • SHARE the crowdfunding with all your friends
  • TELL all your friends about our crowdfunding
story_txt:
Confidential is a Norwegian symphonic Metal band, fronted by founder and song writer Astrid K Mjøen. She has been working as a freelance singer for some years now, and recently we’ve been working in studio with an album consisting of her songs. All songs on this album is of a very personal character, with stories from her life the last few years, which have been quite a bumpy road, which is reflected In some very emotional and beautiful songs.This is her diary 


Making an album on this scale is very costly, and with your help, we will fulfill our dream faster.This album WILL BE RELEASED no matter what, so we can guarantee the delivery of each perk.If we don't reach our goal, it will just take longer time.*Estimated time for delivery is set to April 2021. This will change when we see the result of this crowdfunding, and it is dependable label release schedulesThe album costs ALOT more than the 5000 EUR we ask for here. So when we reach our goal, we will have some more rewards for you to keep it going.Rewards for reaching goals:1000 EUR - We will release a small album teaser.3500 EUR - Our backers will get a more extensive teaser video, with Astrid talking about the creation of the songs, and some insight on how we worked in the studio, recording the songs.5000 EUR - Main Goal reached. All backers who bought the album, will get a  exclusive pre-listen to a single from the album.Why is this album so expensive to make?

We have guest artist that are some of the best, and most know in the genre, like Jake E (Ex Amaranthe, Cyhra) Madeleine Liljestam & Rikard Ekberg (Eleine), Mike LePond (Symphony X) & Jonah Weingarten (Pyramaze, Catalyst Crime)
The album is Mixed and Mastered by Jacob Hansen (Amaranthe, Volbeat, Primal Fear++)
This is our debut album, so every penny so far has come directly from our own pocket



Confidential is a new band, but all the members have broad experience, and we have now joined forced to make this the most epic album we can.


Astrid K Mjøen - Lead Vocals

Frode Hovd - Rythm Guitars (Aldaria - ex Memorized Dreams)

David Hovde - Lead Guitars (AxeToss)

Robert Redmax Myrhaug - Drums (Sandberg, Slagmaur, Tragediens Trone)

Charlotte Stav - Synths & Backing Vocals

story:
After 9 long years without new releases on its 'crown jewel' instrument, Museum Vleeshuis and Apotheosis vzw have found each other in the producing of a new disc for the label Ramée, entitled GRAND TOUR, recorded on the infamous Dulcken 1747 harpsichord in Antwerp. Music by Handel, Bach, Scarlatti, Forqueray, Rameau and Boutmy, all played by harpsichordist-in-residence Korneel Bernolet. More information in our video trailer!

Museum Vleeshuis has kindly sponsored the logistics for this disc (availability of the Museum hall and the instrument, pressing of the physical discs etc.), but up to this moment, the technical and artistic costs (playing, recording, editing...) remain uncovered.

This is where this crowdfunding comes in: through a pre-sale for this new CD (to be released internationally at the end of September 2021; pre-sale discs will be sent earlier of course), with the additional option to add previously released Apotheosis CDs to the return options of course, and many more. Any collected funds that might perhaps surpass the set goal, will be used for future CD or video projects including the Dulcken. We have many plans to share this instrument with a large(r) audience!

Thanks for your support!

 

***

 

ABOUT KORNEEL www.bernolet.com

A conductor and harpsichordist, Korneel Bernolet (°1989) is one of the most versatile talents on the international music scenes today, known and respected for his fresh, no-nonsense and immediate view and vision on music performance and style.

As a conductor, debuting at age 13 leading his own compositions, he works in a repertoire span from Monteverdi till Gershwin, with a preference for opera and oratorio. Between 2015 and 2018 he acted as assistant-conductor for Jos van Immerseel at Anima Eterna Brugge, ending with a highly praised livestreamed guest-conductorship in Beethoven's 9th Symphony and Choir Fantasy in Bruges and Frankfurt. Since 2014 he works closely together with Christophe Rousset as an assistant-conductor and harpsichordist in his orchestra Les Talens Lyriques. Recently he started collaborating with Collegium Vocale Ghent and the Flemish Radio Choir as a regular chorus master and conductor, and with Philippe Herreweghe as pianoforte-continuo and assistant-conductor with either the Orchestre des Champs-Elysées, Antwerp Symphony Orchestra and Collegium Vocale Ghent. Passion-tide 2021 he acted as assistant-conductor to Christoph Prégardien with Antwerp Symphony Orchestra; earlier in his career he assisted at B'Rock, cantoLX and Vokalconsort Berlin. As a guest conductor he'll make his first appearances with Il Gardellino (Marcel Ponseele & Jan Dewinne) soon at the Tage Alter Musik in Herne.
He conducted a.o. the Bach Akademie Australia (as festival star of the 2019 Bach edition of the Canberra International Music Festival, conductig seven concerts in one festival, amongst which the first ever Bach Johannes-Passion in Australia's capital), Flanders Symphony Orchestra, Anima Eterna Brugge, Collegium Vocale Gent, Transparant Music Theater, International Opera Academy Gent, Symphony Orchestra of the Royal Conservatoire Antwerp, and countless semi-professional ensembles. In all these positions, he was invited as a conductor at Vienna State Oper, Theater an der Wien, La Monnaie Brussels, Opéra National du Rhin Nancy, Rudolphinum Prague, Flemish Opera, Valenciana Temple Guanajuato Mexico, the Philharmonies of Paris, Cologne, Essen, the Alte Oper Frankfurt, and will soon make his debut as assistant-conductor at Teatro alla Scala in Milan.

With his own project, the Apotheosis Orchestra on period instruments, he plays and conducts music from Baroque till the high Romantic era, including Purcell, Bach, Handel, Bernier, Rameau, Telemann, Mozart, Benda, Haydn, Mendelssohn, Brahms, Vaughan-Williams... The group produced several chamber music CDs since 2011 (on the labels Et'cetera and Ramée/Outhere), and most recently their orchestral opera début-CD (Pygmalion by Rameau and Benda) was internationally praised as a new reference: "Korneel Bernolet is our new Rameau champion" (Classique News). This award-winning project was continued in an exciting production at MAfestival Bruges 2019, staged by Femke Gyselinck. Other partners-in-crime for opera, ballet and music theatre include Guy Joosten (Telemann Orpheus), Sigrid T'Hooft (Bernier Trois visages d'Hécate), Luigi de Angelis (Rameau Les indes galantes), Gemma Beltran (Mozart La finta giardiniera), Nathalie Van Parys (Rameau Les indes galantes)...

Korneel Bernolet is active world-wide as a recital soloist (throughout Europe, South-Korea and Australia, with solo appearances at Bach Academy Bruges, BOZAR Brussels, Musikfestspiele Potsdam Sanssouci, Wunderkammer Trieste, Cambridge University, Sydney University, Incheon National University, the Canberra International Music Festival...) and in livestream recitals on the internet and on international broadcast; and as an ensemble player: besides the above mentioned also as principal continuo player of Il Gardellino (Marcel Ponseele), Flemish Radio Choir (Bart Van Reyn), Transports Publics (Thomas Baeté), BachPlus (Bart Naessens); and in the past with B'Rock (Frank Agsteribbe), Mannheimer Hofkapelle, Antwerp Symphony Orchestra, Scherzi Musicali (Nicolas Achten), Utopia, several smaller ensembles and as a harpsichord duo partner of Christophe Rousset and Ewald Demeyere. If not for the COVID-19 pandemic, this list would also have included 2020-2021 productions with Staatskapelle Dresden and Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra, which will hopefully be postponed.

He studied historical keyboards with Paul Clement, Ewald Demeyere, Piet Kuijken, Gustav Leonhardt and Christophe Rousset; conducting through studies with Geert Hendrix and Luc Anthonis and masterclasses with Georg Grün, Daan Admiraal and through many assistantships. He obtained with stellar marks the Master degrees in both harpsichord and conducting at the Royal Conservatoire of Antwerp, where he started teaching already during his final study year. Korneel made his international début at the age of 19 as a continuo player with Sigiswald Kuijken's La Petite Bande, was named 'Young Musician of the Year' in 2014 by the Belgian Music Press Association, and two years later was appointed the new Professor of Harpsichord at the Royal Conservatoire of Antwerp, where he teaches on the famous Dulcken 1747 harpsichord at Museum Vleeshuis as 'harpsichordist in residence'. At this conservatoire he is coordinating the Historically Informed Performance Practice programme and conducts projects with the many formations, in which he also coaches the conducting students. He teaches and conducts at the International Opera Academy Ghent and is doing PhD research at Antwerp University. Lectures, masterclasses and concerts brought him to the conservatories and universities of Manchester, Vilnius, Cambridge, Antwerp and Sydney. His discography, including solo works by Balbastre, Rameau and Weckbacher, now counts some thirty recordings. Several solo recordings were added to the prestigeous online 'All of Bach' series by The Netherlands Bach Society.

Besides his concert career, he is a passionate and highly in-demand recording engineer and producer.

story:
Only on Indiegogo you are able to get “Out If This World” the sophomore highly anticipated first album of the new band led by the voice of Fair Warning Tommy Heart and the legendary Europe-guitarist Kee Marcello with an exclusive cover artwork on CD (with 4 live bonus tracks taken from the live album "Live from the HEAT").

Only in Indiegogo "Out Of This World" will be available as a limited coloured vinyl LPs.

Only on Indiegogo the exclusive concert album "Live From The HEAT" will be available as a limited coloured vinyl LPs.

Please note: you will get a free mp3 download coming with all the ordered LPs and CDs!

"Live From The HEAT" was mixed by Sebastian Roeder (Primal Fear, Luca Turilli's Rhapsody, Rhapsody Of Fire, Bonfire) and contains fan favourites from the Europe- and Fair Warning-catalogues mixed with three songs by Kee Of Hearts – the project where Tommy and Kee originally met.

OUT OF THIS WORLD's first studio album has been mixed by Ron Nevison (Kiss, Bad Company, Ozzy Osbourne, Lynyrd Skynyrd,Vince Neil, Meat Loaf, Heart, Chicago and many more). A true genius in his field who has collaborated with Kee again after unbelievable 33 years. First time since Europe’s „Out Of This World“-album.  

Keyboards on four of  the songs have been played by Deep Purple’s own Don Airey.


What can then be said about Tommy Heart and Kee Marcello? One of the best teams in the melodic rock / hard rock genre, hands down. Heart‘s voice just gets better and better as the years go by. Melodic one minute, soothing the next. Likewise, Marcello is on fire here and lays down some of his best and most memorable melodies and riffs in recent memory.

The sound is absolutely stellar thanks to Nevison who has given the band a sound that not only reinvigorates them, but also incorporates the soundscapes of the past. Modern and classic at the same time, if you will.

Every track on this beauty is worthy of attention whether it is the anthems “Twilight” and „Lighting Up My Dark“ the timeless shuffle anthem „The Warrior“  or the superb ballad “Only You Can Teach Me How To Love Again”. This record has everything fans of the classic Fair Warning and Kee’s Europe-years could possibly ask for. And then some!

Supported by the killer rhythm section of Darby Todd (Gary Moore, The Darkness) and Ken Sandin (Alien) OUT OF THIS WORLD is delivering 10 shining rock diamonds and an exciting concert recording.

Tracklisting Out Of This World studio CD

  1. TWILIGHT
  2. HANGING ON
  3. IN A MILLION YEARS
  4. LIGHTING UP MY DARK
  5. STARING AT THE SUN
  6. THE WARRIOR
  7. UP TO YOU
  8. AIN'T GONNA LET YOU GO
  9. ONLY YOU CAN TEACH ME HOW TO LOVE AGAIN
  10. NOT TONIGHT
  11. LET THE GOOD TIMES ROCK (Live from The HEAT)
  12. BURNING HEART (Live From The HEAT)
  13. MOMENTUM (Live From The HEAT)
  14. SUPERSTITIOUS (Live From The HEAT)

Tracklisting Out Of This World vinyl LP

  1. TWILIGHT
  2. HANGING ON
  3. IN A MILLION YEARS
  4. LIGHTING UP MY DARK
  5. STARING AT THE SUN
  6. THE WARRIOR
  7. UP TO YOU
  8. AIN'T GONNA LET YOU GO
  9. ONLY YOU CAN TEACH ME HOW TO LOVE AGAIN
  10. NOT TONIGHT

 

Live From The HEAT vinyl LP

  1. THE STORM (KEE OF HEARTS)
  2. A NEW DIMENSION (KEE OF HEARTS)
  3. LET THE GOOD TIMES ROCK (EUROPE)
  4. BURNING HEART (FAIR WARNING)
  5. SAVE ME (FAIR WARNING)
  6. TWIST OF FATE (KEE OF HEARTS)
  7. OPEN YOUR HEART (EUROPE)
  8. MOMENTUM (INSTR.) (OUT OF THIS WORLD)
  9. SUPERSTITIOUS (EUROPE)
  10. READY OR NOT (EUROPE)

story:
Musical Medicine for These Times!

Thrive Choir has dreams to release our debut record this year! More than ever, our world needs soulful music that illuminates the joy, pain and beauty of what it means to be human in this time of cultural and systemic transformation.

 

CURRENT GOAL: $19,000 will cover 100% of EP costs, indiegogo fees, and will help us make accompanying music videos to give this music wings across the internet!

STRETCH GOAL:  $30,000 will support us to follow our EP with a full 10 track album + more music videos!

 

Music That Makes a Difference.

We are:

  • A diverse choir of Black, African, Latino, Indigenous, European, Middle-Eastern, Asian & mixed-descent singers honoring the power of the liberatory Black Gospel Music Tradition to create modern medicine-music for people of all backgrounds, faiths and cultures.
  • Activists, mothers, healers, educators, social entrepreneurs & earth stewards who bring our passion and experience into original songs that fuel the social movements for justice.
  • The musical voice of Thrive East Bay and the Thrive Network, a community and movement devoted to love in action by building equitable systems where we can flourish as individuals, as communities, and as a planet.

When it comes to social change, we believe that music is not a luxury, but a necessity. Likewise, we hope to inspire our generation to be as courageous and visionary. 

Our music is for the movement. We've led thousands of people in the streets at marches, like the Rise for Climate 2018 march. We bring song to community healing rituals around issues like police brutality and gun violence. Additionally, we've inspired thousands at social-change conferences and festivals like Bioneers and Lightning in a bottle. It's time to spread our music further.

 

What We Need & What You Get

With the COVID19 shutdown, we had to cancel all of our gigs for the foreseeable future. This didn't stop our community work, and we took our music online and to the streets to sing through masks for Black Lives. However, all of our income has frozen, and we are still $19,000 away from what we need to finish this record. 

  • Thankfully, we've already tracked many of our 18 part vocal harmonies, and though our gracious choir has volunteered their valuable time and energy, we still need to pay our engineer Austin for his time, as well as guest instrumentalists, mixing, mastering, and some other studio and recording fees.  We are honored to be working with Matt Hennessy & VSOP Studios, who has worked with artists like Beyoncé, John Legend, Jamila Woods & many more. He is already helping us sound even more epic.
  • We have many more unique perks listed below for our generous supporters who will support more generously like vocal lessons, custom musical covers, and more! 

We appreciate your generous support! Don't hold back! And, all contributors of $20 or more will receive a copy of the EP as soon as it's ready, and an invitation to a special sneak peak event!

 

Why Your Help Matters

We have been pouring our love and energy into this music project for years. While success as an independent artist is a miracle of hard work and passion in itself, the coordination, democracy, and energy it takes to succeed as a 17 person music ensemble is a whole 'nother story!

  • With the COVID19 pandemic, it may be over a year before we can raise these funds through performing safely!
  • We have full faith that this EP will help our music to have the kind of wings it needs for this project to prosper, and we don't say that lightly! We have spent years fine-tuning our craft, and we're ready to blast off!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word! Help us give this music the wings it needs to reach the hearts that need it. 

  • Make Some Noise! Post about us on your social media platform using the indiegogo share tools!
  • Share us with radio stations, podcasts, or artists grants and fellowships who want to collaborate with us!
  • Send us your love and prayer!

 

Learn More & Contact

Check out thrivechoir.org to learn more about our music, and thriveeastbay.org to learn more about our community & social mission! Connect with us more at thrivechoirbooking@gmail.com 

 

Email us if you would like a receipt for your tax deductible donation.

We appreciate your generous support! Don't hold back! And, all contributors of $20 or more will receive a copy of the EP as soon as it's ready, and an invitation to a special sneak peak event!
 

Why Your Help Matters
We have been pouring our love and energy into this music project for years. While success as an independent artist is a miracle of hard work and passion in itself, the coordination, democracy, and energy it takes to succeed as a 17 person music ensemble is a whole 'nother story!

With the COVID19 pandemic, it may be over a year before we can raise these funds through performing safely!
We have full faith that this EP will help our music to have the kind of wings it needs for this project to prosper, and we don't say that lightly! We have spent years fine-tuning our craft, and we're ready to blast off!

 

Other Ways You Can Help
Help us spread the word! Help us give this music the wings it needs to reach the hearts that need it. 

Make Some Noise! Post about us on your social media platform using the indiegogo share tools!
Share us with radio stations, podcasts, or artists grants and fellowships who want to collaborate with us!
Send us your love and prayer!

 Learn More & ContactCheck out thrivechoir.org to learn more about our music, and thriveeastbay.org to learn more about our community & social mission! Connect with us more at thrivechoirbooking@gmail.com  Email us if you would like a receipt for your tax deductible donation.

story:
Hey everyone!

We are Heaven's Guard , a symphonic metal band from Hannover, Germany. Nearly  three years after thinking about founding this band, we finally are here with our first single "The Cause of Destiny". And nine further songs are ready to get recorded, mixed and mastered to complete our very first album Pathfinder.

 

Album no. 1

This album will be our first record and we put a lot of thoughts into how to make this as good as possible. As we do have decent recording opportunities, we realized, that we need to focus into the actual mixing and mastering process. So we asked some of the best people in this genre and eventually they were willing to help us. The result of this can be heard in our first single "The Cause of Destiny". But there also was a steep learning curve, so we are confident to even raise the bar for the full album!

 

What We Need 

All the story, we want to tell you are written down, and we can't wait to share all of them with you. But to make this happen, we need ask for your support in order to bear with the expensives, that come with a professional production.

Concret, we need your support to finance the production of our first full lenth album. However we will release the album, even if we don't hit the campain goal. The founding sum  from this campain will be used in order to realize the following steps:

  • Pre production and recording
  • Mixing & Mastering 
  • Booklet design

 

5.700 € is the amout of money, that we need to prdouce our first studio album wit the at least the same quality that you can hear on our first single The Cause of Destiny.

9.000 € is our stretched goal. If we are able to reach a foundation sum close to this amount, we will be able to improve our pre-production as well. Also we will then try to produce a music video.

 

What you get

You can choose from a number of different perks. However,

  • if you would like to have a specific combination of items
  • or your country is not available for shipping,

just contact us and we will put things together for you!

Digital Copies

If you get perk that contains our first Single, the Album or both in digital form, you will receive a one time link to download a digital copy. 

  • Single: You will receive your digital copy within 48 hours.
  • Album: You will receive your digital copy at the release day

 

Physical Copys

If you get a perk that contains a pysical copy of Pathfinder, you will receive the album cd as soon, as the album get's released, before everyone else.

 

Accessoires

​Guitar Picks: Here you have the chance of one frome Stevens custom guitar picks. And this is the only way to get one of them beside catching one live.

 

 

Drum Accessoires: You will get either one from Kevin personally played and signed drumsticks  or drum heads.

 

 

 

Personal Items

With some perks, we will create something individual for. This might be a personal video message recorded only for you or a handwritten lyric from your favorit song! Those things are completly unique! Those perks can be delivered within 2 weeks after your order.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute to our campaign, you can help us if you want to. Share this campaign, our social media and our single with people who you think might also be interested in this project.

 

Thank you to everyone who supports us in any way. We are honored to see that you want to make this project happen as much as we do! Thank you so much!

story:
What's this all about?

Over the last few years, I've written about everything that moves me, or fascinates me. That's one thing that holds this whole collection of music together; it's all from the heart.

I'm Kurt, a singer-songwriter and composer from New York. I started writing songs in my mid-20s, with a weekly project I called A Song, A Poem, And A Picture. I've followed my muse and honed my skills since then, always chasing after otherworldly experiences in music. For me, there's nothing like reaching into the "ether" (intuition, emotion, subconscious) and crystalizing something into a song, which both perfects an otherwise hard-to-access experience for me, and allows another person to experience it with me, or to make sense of their own experiences as they listen to the song.

These songs that I have ready to record, are the height of all that. My best work, and deeply personal. And I can't turn them into an album without your help.

What I Need + What You'll Get

To do this project at the bare minimum, I need to raise $5,000. Here's where all that goes:

  • Recording at the University of Montana: $100 to use the facilities, $200 for the engineer's time. (4 different sessions)
  • $520 goes to paying all the musicians at the "big band" recording session.
  • $200 goes to additional musicians recording their parts remotely.
  • $1,200 goes to the "All Flesh Is Like Grass" performance video at Prosper Pianos—this will be the culmination of what I've learned and practiced with video ads, and also just a really enjoyable video.
  • $400 goes toward having the album mastered by Aidan Brooks at The Lab in HB, where I recorded my first singles Hills to Sleep in  and Easter in SoHo.
  • $400 goes toward having the album mixed.
  • $160 goes to CDBaby to publish my music and get it on all relevant platforms: Spotify, iTunes, Apple Music, Tidal, TikTok, etc.
  • $300 goes to CD duplication (yes, people still buy CDs!)
  • $250 goes toward having t-shirts printed
  • $100 goes toward marketing the album.

Here's what you get:

  • $1 gets you a track from the album, and $3 gets you three tracks from the album. Every bit helps!
  • $10 gets you the whole album, as a digital download.
  • $25 gets you the album on CD, plus the digital download, and an assortment of visual and sonic goodies.
  • $45 gets you the T-shirt, and the digital download of the album,.
  • $70 gets you the T-shirt, the CD, the digital download, and some extra schmutz to download
  • $150 gets you "the complete collection"! The new CD, T-shirt, and digital download, plus my previous album Kennedy on 180-gram vinyl (and digital download), unreleased tracks of mine from the last 8 years, and PDFs of my musical arrangements (from both albums).
  • $220 gets you "the personal touch". The new CD and T-shirt, the Kennedy vinyl, and 3 Skype lessons on guitar, ukulele, or piano. You can also sub out the music lessons in favor of a home-cooked meal by me! [home cooked meal offered in NYC/Long Island and western Montana only]
  • $275 gets you a solo Skype concert! I'll perform your favorite songs of mine, maybe even throw in a cover song of your choosing. And you also get the digital download, the CD, and Kennedy on vinyl. 
  • $325 gets you an album credit (along with the new CD and Kennedy vinyl)
  • $400 gets you a custom made song! (plus CD, vinyl, and t-shirt)
  • $1,400 gets you a concert with a 5-piece version of my band! *Travel costs apply outside NYC or Missoula
  • $2,100 gets you a concert with the "full" version of my band! *Travel costs apply outside NYC or Missoula

Additional Tiers!

If we surpass the initial goal of $5,000, please don't stop giving! Every additional bit helps to make the album better and helps me to reach future fans with my music (no fans, no career!).

  • If we reach $6,120, I can record my composition Saturn at The Bunker studio, where I did the whole Kennedy album. It's a mixed media project that involves analog tape, and I began writing it in 2013. *If we go over $5,000 but don't reach $6,210, these can go toward a few smaller things like a professional PR campaign or a low-budget music video (like I did for Smoke).
  • If we reach $8,500, I can do all of that, plus a medium-budget music video (like I did for Oh, Love).
  • If we reach $11,000, I can do all of that, plus have vinyl records made of the album!

What if the $_____ goal isn't reached?

I'm confident we will raise the full amount, and then some! But if somehow that doesn't happen, it simply means some cost-cutting measures:

  • Instead of having CDs pressed, I'll burn them on my laptop and draw the artwork myself.
  • I'll eliminate some or all group recording, and have the parts (cello, bass, etc.) recorded remotely by the lowest bidder—or if funding is way under, some parts could be done with software instruments.
  • I'll record only the top 3 songs in a studio, and figure out how to home record everything else.
  • I'll knit the t-shirts myself using yarn and thread found in local dumpsters. (I'm kidding.)

In short, underfunding would create additional work and make things take longer, but it will still get done. The costs I just cannot cut are the All Flesh Is Like Grass performance video, having professionals mix and master the album, and having the t-shirts pressed (they are one of the perks, and unlike CDs I can't burn them on my laptop).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to give, I really do understand! If you'd still like to help (or if you donated but want to help more), there are a number of things that would be genuinely helpful.

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word! When sharing, it's helpful if you take a moment to write about why you care about me and about this project.
  • Donate your talent: Can you design artwork for the album and/or for the songs I'll be releasing as singles? Do you play any instruments professionally, that you could play for my music in one of the sessions or remotely? Are you an actor, willing to appear in a music video pro bono? Do you have some other talent/skill that could help me in creating this art?
  • Who do you know? Take a moment to think of your various family, professional, and friendship connections. Does your company hire bands for big events? Is your brother-in-law a huge Sufjan or Beach Boys fan who might want to back this project? Is your friend a writer who could get me some press for the campaign, or for the album release? These are all gold to an indie musician like myself.

Thanks so much for reading, and for your support!

story:
UPDATE:

Thank you, all contributors, for making this project happen! I am looking forward to releasing this album now. I will be checking pout various stretch goals, which I can add into this CD to make it all the more impressive. I'd rather not just toss in random garbage, like extra posters, stickers and whatnot, but would rather see what I can do to improve the album more. I will post up stretch goals as soon I find some interesting ones to work with. Thanks again!

Be sure to check out my discography, which is all free to download, at: https://hasenfang.bandcamp.com/


A More Lengthy Summary

Well, where to start? I have been writing lyrics since the late eighties and have been recording albums for over twenty years now. I have formed or co-founded various bands, such as Trembling, TR0LL, Stars & Moons Pillow and Nana's Favorite Gin, as well as my own solo music, Hasenfang. I have also collaborated with many other bands which I would rather not list off at this present time, seeing that I might forget a few and anger them. For the two decades I have made albums (of which there are over twenty), I always had always lived by two simple rules:

1.) Never sell any of our (or my) albums. Just give them away. 

2.) Never play live, even if asked to do so (i.e.; open for another band).

Those rules were based on the mentality I had, to see just how far "underground" we could go and still get recognition. During that time, depending on which band[s], we have had radio air-time and even had some songs played at clubs. Even to this day, the name TR0LL is still being used at our old school, where it originated from, in relation to a particular person. Twenty years and still kicking. I would say after all this time, to still be noted for our music, even by not selling one album or playing live to a crowd, we have fulfilled that mission. Now, for the first time, I am looking forward to recording and producing and album which is of high quality and one I can finally market. I have come to indiegogo to promote this undertaking and ask for your help. Back in the day, we always provided our own funds to buy instruments, mixers, recording devices and materials to make our own music. Thousands and thousands of hard earned dollars were spent to make tapes or CD's to pass out, free of charge to anyone even slightly interested. But these days, now that I am married and main breadwinner for my wife, it is hard to come by the cash I need to get this album underway, especially when trying to make it of good quality sound and production. 


A More Lengthy Summary II (On The Album)

So, here we are...from starting of my birthday (Feb. 26th) and going for 40 days (the age I have turned), I will be running this indiegogo project. This is the first time I have ever asked for help when pressing a release, so believe me when I say I feel a bit awkward doing it in this fashion...and will feel even more awkward when actually selling the album. However, I would really like to see if I can pull such a thing off. After twenty years, I feel it is about time to try and I deeply appreciate anyone who helps, heck, to simply wish me luck, even if it is just an encouraging remark with no accompanied funds, I'll be grateful for that. I know in this day and age, extra cash is hard to come by, which is why I am trying to produce this at the lowest price possible and still have a good sound come from it. The album will be entitled Winter Walk With Me and is a follow up to my last album, Liaisons (released on New Year's Eve 2008). Usually, my albums are "themed", however, this one was a bit hard to nail down. The title itself is loosely tied to my joy of seeing the return of Twin Peaks coming back for a third season (a mockery title of the film title Fire Walk With Me). Sadly, the only song which seems to have a David Lynch / Angelo Badalamenti style to it is the last track, Lust & The Douglas Fir. So, straying a bit from that, I have always loved the 80's New Wave / Synth-pop style. I can say this album will very Depeche Mode in essence, as well as having a hint of Darkwave genre, chirpy Steampunk and a trippy Ween flavor (for those who know those bands). I'm trying to incorporate sounds which impressed me as a teen, during the late 80's and early 90's. 

One thing I am doing new for the first time, is using a pinch-pull, drag-n-drop format of various music generator applications, such as Musicshake and Magix Music Maker. I always use to be hands on with my synth music, even playing the rapid arpeggio with my fingers. But, I wanted to see how well this style of music-making fitted with my lyrical sense, as well as over-dub my own sounds into the mix, to make a unique electronic experience. So far, it is coming along good. As of right now, the album has a track list of 17 songs and will be nearly 80 minutes in length. I am posting up the minimum amount it will take to mix and manufacture this item, as well as list the minimum amount for funding packages. I am looking forward to us achieving this project.

Thank you, 

~Michael Hasenfang

Album Track Listing 

NOTE: As of 03/05/2015, the album will now have 18 tracks and be 80 minutes long! This is an added bonus I have made for all, since we reached our funding goal.


Stretch Goals

Well, here are some extra added bonuses I will toss into this project, if we can reach the funding posted. So here we go...


REACHED! ~ At $700, I will switch from a Jewel Case to 4-Panel Digipak. As of right now, there will be a lyrics within. Not sure if I am going to go with a booklet, panel or poster. Guess I'll see which works best.

At $800 I will upgrade from 4 to a 6-Panel  Digipak. This will give me two extra sides to work with for extra artwork, pictures and/or info.

If we reach $1000, this will give me just enough to make a Double Album. I will release Whiteout as the second CD. Yes, I know, I have it up for free on bandcamp. But with this extra funding, I can now master it through Channel Fuse Media (along with the vocal album), to give it a better quality sound. With this, you will now have both the vocal and instrumental versions of each album with great sound. NOTE: I am not sure all of what the manufacturing site has to offer for cases, but it seems with the double album, we might have to revert back to Jewel case (only downside to the upgrade).

At $1500, I will also include Professional Mixing into the Mastering done at Channel Fuse Media. Home mixing will be done by myself, as well as Eric Hasenfang and Nick Chud. If we manage to get this stretch goal, I will take our work and allow it to be tweaked even more to professional album quality (this includes their mastering).

At $2500 I can afford to master and mix both of the albums.


...More goals to come if we reach these...

What I Need & What You Get

Originally, I posted this project on kickstarter with a $1500 goal. Five days until that funding was suppose to end (and at only $155 in), I did some more intense research and found that I could produce the same amount thing, at different sites, for about $1100 less! So here I am, rehashing this project for way lower than intended. Actually, I only need about $400 to pull this project off. However, since indiegogo has a minimum starting point of $500 to get the ball rolling, we will make a goal with that amount. I have allowed this project "Flexible Funding", since I actually need less than what is posted to green-light the album. So, even though it won't say so on indiegogo, once the funds reach 80%, consider the album fully funded. 

So, where am I going to get this done for so cheap, you might ask: Well, here are the links to the places I have chosen to proceed with the finishing of the album. I would also like to give a quick THANK YOU to Unifiedmfg, who contacted me during my kickstater campaign to inform me of their competitive prices. I'm glad they did. Anyway, here is what I am using on all levels:

RECORDING

Pro-Tools

M-Audio

Magix Music Maker

Musicshake

MASTERING: 

LANDR (once I am done with the home recording, I send my own mix through LANDR, for a quick buff, then off to...)

Channel Fuse Media

MANUFACTURING

Unified Manufacturing

Though I am sure there are some sites and businesses which offer cheaper deal, for the quality of what you get, these seem to be some of the best for the price. 

What you, as a contributor will get, is a digital download and/or hard copy of the CD album, with a bit more, depending on which Perk you help fund.  

A Free Listen & Download Of The Album [Instrumental Version]

As a means to show you I'm pretty much done with the album, you can even listen to, as well as download, all the music laid so far, over on my bandcamp site. However, the music  you will be hearing is NOT the finished/finalized music, but merely a free download I am giving away to everyone, not just those who contribute. Once the album is completely accomplished these tracks will have vocals, as well as a few more blurps and chirps of musical fun. Until then, enjoy this FREE un-mastered instrumental version of the album:

What The T-Shirt Will Look Like



Risks & Challenges

The only trouble I am having at the moment is figuring out why the drivers are not working for my M-Box. I music is laid, but I am having an issue with recording with the microphone. Apart from that (which should be resolved fairly soon), there really is no other problems I have at the moment. I'll let you in on a little secret though; I feel this album will be pressed and sent out LONG before June. I was just giving myself some extra time...just in case. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the news, especially to those you know, who enjoy Synth-pop, Electro, Gothic, Darkwave music. This is the first album I plan to actually press and sell and it would be nice to achieve this. Your contribution would be a great help in making this happen and I would be wildly grateful. Thank you.
story_txt:
UPDATE:Thank you, all contributors, for making this project happen! I am looking forward to releasing this album now. I will be checking pout various stretch goals, which I can add into this CD to make it all the more impressive. I'd rather not just toss in random garbage, like extra posters, stickers and whatnot, but would rather see what I can do to improve the album more. I will post up stretch goals as soon I find some interesting ones to work with. Thanks again!

Be sure to check out my discography, which is all free to download, at: https://hasenfang.bandcamp.com/

A More Lengthy Summary
Well, where to start? I have been writing lyrics since the late eighties and have been recording albums for over twenty years now. I have formed or co-founded various bands, such as Trembling, TR0LL, Stars & Moons Pillow and Nana's Favorite Gin, as well as my own solo music, Hasenfang. I have also collaborated with many other bands which I would rather not list off at this present time, seeing that I might forget a few and anger them. For the two decades I have made albums (of which there are over twenty), I always had always lived by two simple rules:
1.) Never sell any of our (or my) albums. Just give them away. 
2.) Never play live, even if asked to do so (i.e.; open for another band).
Those rules were based on the mentality I had, to see just how far "underground" we could go and still get recognition. During that time, depending on which band[s], we have had radio air-time and even had some songs played at clubs. Even to this day, the name TR0LL is still being used at our old school, where it originated from, in relation to a particular person. Twenty years and still kicking. I would say after all this time, to still be noted for our music, even by not selling one album or playing live to a crowd, we have fulfilled that mission. Now, for the first time, I am looking forward to recording and producing and album which is of high quality and one I can finally market. I have come to indiegogo to promote this undertaking and ask for your help. Back in the day, we always provided our own funds to buy instruments, mixers, recording devices and materials to make our own music. Thousands and thousands of hard earned dollars were spent to make tapes or CD's to pass out, free of charge to anyone even slightly interested. But these days, now that I am married and main breadwinner for my wife, it is hard to come by the cash I need to get this album underway, especially when trying to make it of good quality sound and production. 




A More Lengthy Summary II (On The Album)
So, here we are...from starting of my birthday (Feb. 26th) and going for 40 days (the age I have turned), I will be running this indiegogo project. This is the first time I have ever asked for help when pressing a release, so believe me when I say I feel a bit awkward doing it in this fashion...and will feel even more awkward when actually selling the album. However, I would really like to see if I can pull such a thing off. After twenty years, I feel it is about time to try and I deeply appreciate anyone who helps, heck, to simply wish me luck, even if it is just an encouraging remark with no accompanied funds, I'll be grateful for that. I know in this day and age, extra cash is hard to come by, which is why I am trying to produce this at the lowest price possible and still have a good sound come from it. The album will be entitled Winter Walk With Me and is a follow up to my last album, Liaisons (released on New Year's Eve 2008). Usually, my albums are "themed", however, this one was a bit hard to nail down. The title itself is loosely tied to my joy of seeing the return of Twin Peaks coming back for a third season (a mockery title of the film title Fire Walk With Me). Sadly, the only song which seems to have a David Lynch / Angelo Badalamenti style to it is the last track, Lust & The Douglas Fir. So, straying a bit from that, I have always loved the 80's New Wave / Synth-pop style. I can say this album will very Depeche Mode in essence, as well as having a hint of Darkwave genre, chirpy Steampunk and a trippy Ween flavor (for those who know those bands). I'm trying to incorporate sounds which impressed me as a teen, during the late 80's and early 90's. 
One thing I am doing new for the first time, is using a pinch-pull, drag-n-drop format of various music generator applications, such as Musicshake and Magix Music Maker. I always use to be hands on with my synth music, even playing the rapid arpeggio with my fingers. But, I wanted to see how well this style of music-making fitted with my lyrical sense, as well as over-dub my own sounds into the mix, to make a unique electronic experience. So far, it is coming along good. As of right now, the album has a track list of 17 songs and will be nearly 80 minutes in length. I am posting up the minimum amount it will take to mix and manufacture this item, as well as list the minimum amount for funding packages. I am looking forward to us achieving this project.
Thank you, 
~Michael Hasenfang

Album Track Listing 




NOTE: As of 03/05/2015, the album will now have 18 tracks and be 80 minutes long! This is an added bonus I have made for all, since we reached our funding goal.


Stretch Goals
Well, here are some extra added bonuses I will toss into this project, if we can reach the funding posted. So here we go...



REACHED! ~ At $700, I will switch from a Jewel Case to 4-Panel Digipak. As of right now, there will be a lyrics within. Not sure if I am going to go with a booklet, panel or poster. Guess I'll see which works best.


At $800 I will upgrade from 4 to a 6-Panel  Digipak. This will give me two extra sides to work with for extra artwork, pictures and/or info.


If we reach $1000, this will give me just enough to make a Double Album. I will release Whiteout as the second CD. Yes, I know, I have it up for free on bandcamp. But with this extra funding, I can now master it through Channel Fuse Media (along with the vocal album), to give it a better quality sound. With this, you will now have both the vocal and instrumental versions of each album with great sound. NOTE: I am not sure all of what the manufacturing site has to offer for cases, but it seems with the double album, we might have to revert back to Jewel case (only downside to the upgrade).

At $1500, I will also include Professional Mixing into the Mastering done at Channel Fuse Media. Home mixing will be done by myself, as well as Eric Hasenfang and Nick Chud. If we manage to get this stretch goal, I will take our work and allow it to be tweaked even more to professional album quality (this includes their mastering).

At $2500 I can afford to master and mix both of the albums.


...More goals to come if we reach these...

What I Need & What You Get
Originally, I posted this project on kickstarter with a $1500 goal. Five days until that funding was suppose to end (and at only $155 in), I did some more intense research and found that I could produce the same amount thing, at different sites, for about $1100 less! So here I am, rehashing this project for way lower than intended. Actually, I only need about $400 to pull this project off. However, since indiegogo has a minimum starting point of $500 to get the ball rolling, we will make a goal with that amount. I have allowed this project "Flexible Funding", since I actually need less than what is posted to green-light the album. So, even though it won't say so on indiegogo, once the funds reach 80%, consider the album fully funded. 
So, where am I going to get this done for so cheap, you might ask: Well, here are the links to the places I have chosen to proceed with the finishing of the album. I would also like to give a quick THANK YOU to Unifiedmfg, who contacted me during my kickstater campaign to inform me of their competitive prices. I'm glad they did. Anyway, here is what I am using on all levels:
RECORDING
Pro-Tools
M-Audio
Magix Music Maker
Musicshake
MASTERING: 
LANDR (once I am done with the home recording, I send my own mix through LANDR, for a quick buff, then off to...)
Channel Fuse Media
MANUFACTURING
Unified Manufacturing
Though I am sure there are some sites and businesses which offer cheaper deal, for the quality of what you get, these seem to be some of the best for the price. 
What you, as a contributor will get, is a digital download and/or hard copy of the CD album, with a bit more, depending on which Perk you help fund.  

A Free Listen & Download Of The Album [Instrumental Version]
As a means to show you I'm pretty much done with the album, you can even listen to, as well as download, all the music laid so far, over on my bandcamp site. However, the music  you will be hearing is NOT the finished/finalized music, but merely a free download I am giving away to everyone, not just those who contribute. Once the album is completely accomplished these tracks will have vocals, as well as a few more blurps and chirps of musical fun. Until then, enjoy this FREE un-mastered instrumental version of the album:

What The T-Shirt Will Look Like






Risks & Challenges
 The only trouble I am having at the moment is figuring out why the drivers are not working for my M-Box. I music is laid, but I am having an issue with recording with the microphone. Apart from that (which should be resolved fairly soon), there really is no other problems I have at the moment. I'll let you in on a little secret though; I feel this album will be pressed and sent out LONG before June. I was just giving myself some extra time...just in case. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Spread the news, especially to those you know, who enjoy Synth-pop, Electro, Gothic, Darkwave music. This is the first album I plan to actually press and sell and it would be nice to achieve this. Your contribution would be a great help in making this happen and I would be wildly grateful. Thank you.

story:
Carrie has spent her life committed to the art of storytelling through music and is now fulfilling a lifelong dream of recording an album or original music (with your help!)...her very first... which will likely not be her last.

Her career started as an artist performing as a triple threat  - with a  musical theater career earning her equity status doing professional shows across the country.   She has also doubled down on a commitment to music and arts education,  running her own dance troupe and ultimately helping hundreds of students learn to find their voice through vocal technique and coaching.  A classically trained vocalist and pianist, Carrie is also a talented songwriter who has always wanted to tell stories for music that remind us that life really is a stage and that music has the power to connect us by illuminating our shared journey through “this thing called life.”

With her partner Jamie, Carrie also runs a not-for-profit music venue out of her home that provides a stage for local and regional touring artists to share their gifts with music lovers.  Now with this new venture – her Debut Album, “Boxes”, Carrie is poised to share her personal musical gifts with the world.

“Boxes” is the embodiment of her passion for storytelling and in itself is not only a highly personal story of her life journey but one we can all relate to. From the excitement of taking a bold leap to chase your dreams, the ups and downs of the relationships that shape and sustain us,  to the struggle to find our place in the world and fit in the “boxes” we need to fill,.  The story also inspires empathy via the experience of coping with tragedies outside of our control and ultimately allowing every step of our journey to remind us that the older we get, the more opportunity we have to live our best life by simply choosing to do so. 

With the support of the amazingly talented and collaborative Atlanta Music Community, Carrie’s dream of recording her story and sharing her gift is coming true.  While Covid dealt a blow to the music world, Carrie got to work writing – finishing 11 songs in a variety of Genres that inspired her throughout her life and  tell a tale of the power of setting intentions, going after your ambitions despite the personal toll it takes and ultimately painting an uplifting portrait of the potential we all have within us to not just survive but to thrive.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We are hoping to raise at least $5,000 to help cover the cost of CD and production as well as distribution on digital music sites as well as our sound engineers.  But ultimately any help defraying the cost of what will be over $15,000 for compensating musicians, sound engineers, studio time and artwork would be tremendously helpful
  • In exchange for contributions, we are offering signed copies of the CD reserved seating at one of the limited spaces for Carrie's Album Release party at her magical outdoor home venue, Carrie's Corner.   We also have special treats reserved for those who want to sponsor specific elements of production like sound engineering and artwork.

The Impact

  • Your contribution will not only help Carrie's dream come true but allow the release of a highly impactful story to the world as well and supporting live music and the artists who share their gifts every day.
  • Our producer (and drummer) Justin Varnes, has had a successful music career as a jazz drummer and educator and produced his own album last year which landed on the Jazz Charts! 

Risks & Challenges

Carrie's work ethic and commitment to her musical craft have culminated in the completion of this monumental task - composing music and lyrics for an entire album with the support the ATL music community to develop charts, arrangements and collaborate on recording and performance.  

Without being able to compensate our team of talent we can't make this a reality.  This fundraiser will help us significantly defray personal out-of-pocket costs so we can continue to pay musicians to help carry on this body of work.

Once completed, this album will not only live on CDs and digital music but will be taken on the road, touring local and regional venues in Atlanta and the Southeast....and may even become it's own musical stage production!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate please share with your friends, social networks, and on the Indiegogo platform.  

Additionally, we would like to thank a few folks for their help:

Justin Varnes - our tireles producer and drummer.  Without you this production could never have happened

Kevin Bales - for being so inspired by her music that you inspired her to keep writing until she had an entire album

All the ATL musicians who contributed their talents to this project:  Kevin Bales, Kevin Smith, Nick Rosen, Laura Mustari, Cody Matlock, Tim Pitchford, Chip Crotts, Sam Skelton, Mace Hibbard, Justin Varnes, Grace Somer and Joe Gransden

Our videographer - who filmed produced the Indiegogo video you watched - The VERY TALENTED Matthew Delaney

And to all of you for your support of this dream project!

story:
Summary

Since 2004, Aquabear Legion has served to promote and support Ohio music and art and has been run by founders Brian Koscho and Todd Jacops since then. With 17 releases (mostly compilations from over the years) since then on vinyl, cd, tape, and digital, Aquabear comes into 2021 ready to make two more (new) archival compilations. We also have some awesome new merchandise with art from our good friend Matthew Presutti to help make that happen. Aquabear Legion is a labor of love and long-time passion for Brian and Todd. These pre-orders serve as a way to make these projects happen and also to help cover the Legion's minimal annual expenses to exist.

THESE ARE MY JEWELS (abl-018)
an archival compilation of Ohio music from before 2004 featuring: 333, Bob City, Bubba Ho-Tep,  The Bygones, Guinea Worms, The Husher, Kelley Deal, Kiddo, Kill the Hippies, Mike Rep & The Quotas, Moviola, Necropolis, Pimpy Accelerator, Proletarian Art Threat, Special Aviation Project, The Spiveys, and more.

PORK GRINDERS BALL (abl-019)
re-release from 3/27/99 in Lorain, Ohio featuring: 1972, Figurehead, Full Sun, Gourdo, McShitz, My Baby Arm, Steve Wolfe, The Stubs, Summer of 98, Washout Corporation, and Welfare Cheese

What We Need & What You Get

This is a combination of a pre-order campaign and a collective fundraiser. But you participate in that fundraiser by getting something in advance. In the world today there are many people, organizations, and places that need funds raised and donated WAAAY more than an Ohio rock and roll collective. But, we have had the most success with funding projects and doing pre-orders that work this way... so think of this as a big pre-order to support Aquabear.

In return for your advance support, you can get copies of the new compilations, shirts, hoodies, prints, and of course the huge selection of records, tapes, and more from past Aquabear releases.

We set our budget at $2500, here's the estimated breakdown:
*amounts are estimated TOTAL cost for each item including ALL elements needed to produce

These Are My Jewels compilation (cassette, 150 copies) - $525
Pork Grinders Ball compilation (cassette, 150 copies) - $525
New merchandise (shirts, hoodies, screens, stickers) - $600 
Shipping + supplies - $200
Aquabear Legion Annual Expenses - $250 
Marketing - $100
Percentage to the "man" for processing is 8% - $200

TOTAL: $2500

We would love to raise more and put any additional money raised into another release for later in the year!

The Impact

More music. More cool stuff. And for the archival projects, we specifically feel that it is important to preserve these recordings and put this awesome stuff out to more audiences. You help us make that happen. Thank you very very much.

Risks & Challenges

This will be the 5th pre-order/crowdfunding campaign that Aquabear Legion has done since back in 2011! So we aware of the challenges of managing these campaigns, and have a solid track record of producing the things we said we would, and getting them out the people who helped us make that happen.

Financially, we make multiple budgets based on different funding levels, so if we make less money than thought on the campaign this will all still happen... just less of it. Fewer tapes, less merch, less shipping, and fewer expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Tell your friends! Post about it. We depend on word of mouth for Aquabear Legion to work, so we need you to get this page out far and wide. Help us make awesome stuff and get it into the world.
